Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT BRUNEL




Founded in 1975, Brunel has developed into an international group with 12,000 employees and a turnover of â‚¬1.4 billion. We deliver Project and Consulting Solutions, Workforce Solutions and Global Mobility Solutions that transform global projects in Renewables, Conventional Energy, Mining, Life Sciences, Future Mobility, Industrials & Technology and many other sectors.




Brunel is listed on Euronext Amsterdam NV and is included in the Amsterdam Small Cap Index (AScX). The organization has grown into a renowned global brand with more than 120+ offices in over 40 countries on 6 continents.




ABOUT THE TEAM




Youâ€™ll be joining Brunelâ€™s Market & Business Intelligence (M&BI) team, part of our Global Sales Enablement function. Weâ€™re a lean, high-impact team enabling faster, smarter, and more strategic decisions across the business.




At M&BI, we combine market research, consultancy, and data analytics to support Brunelâ€™s strategic priorities and growth execution. Our mission is to turn data into decision intelligence, driving value through insight, efficiency, and innovation.




Reporting to Manager of M&BI, this role helps expand our impact by advancing strategic awareness and analytical capabilities.




ABOUT THE ROLE




Weâ€™re seeking a hands-on, execution-focused data analyst to accelerate our transition from descriptive reporting to diagnostic and predictive analytics. You'll build models, design dashboards, and run experiments that prioritize growth initiatives and inform high-impact decisions.




This role is ideal for someone who thrives in execution, bring strong technical expertise, and is curious to understand the "why" behind the data.




WHAT YOU'LL DO




Client - Focused & Client-Facing Reporting and Analytics (40%)




Build intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports that are:

Client-focused: based on client-related data (e.g. customer behaviour, chum, BD targeting)
Client-facing; visually polished, presentation- ready, and aligned with required communication standards




Trend Analytics & Modelling (40%)




Perform root cause analysis, forecasting, and segmentation to uncover performance drivers
Conduct segmentation and clustering analysis to identify behavioural or performance patters across regions, clients ortalent groups




Analytics Process & Tool Scaling (20%)




Build scalable (self-service) tools and templates for recurring insights needs
Support the evolution of our internal data ecosystem by contributing to data structure, quality, and integration efforts
Document processes and methodologies to ensure reproducibility and knowledge sharing




Evolving area (future-focused)




This evolving area includes hypothesis-driven analysis, pressure-testing assumptions, and scenario modelling. You'll partner closely with the M&BI Manager to explore emerging questions and translate them into data-backed insights that support strategic decisions




WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR




The ideal candidate will have academic-level intellectual and professional capabilities, with a minimum of 4 years of experience in a complex (international) organization. Key qualifications include:




Power BI Mastery: Advanced DAX, data modelling for experimentation, visualization design and performance tuning.
Data handling: Proficient in SQL and comfortable with Python
Analytical techniques: Solid foundation in segmentation, root cause analysis, and forecasting
Experience with Databricks or other cloud platforms(e.g. Azure, AWS)
Familiarity with data governance
Active listening & business communication
Growth mindset: Curious, adaptable, and open to learning advanced modelling and strategic analytics techniques
Model development: Exposure to or interest in building scenario models and statistical testing
Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field




INTERVIEW PROCESS




Two interviews and an online assessment




WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU




Competitive base salary
Hybrid (3 days in the office) & flexible working
Coaching and mentoring through weekly check-ins
Friendly, collaborative & supportive team environment
Laptop and smart phone with Microsoft powered IT tools
Benefits; including pension scheme, group health insurance, 26 paid vacation days with the option to buy upto 40 vacation days per year, travel allowance scheme, bicycle lease plan, gym discount
Through the Brunel Academy - Brunel's learning & development programme - you have every opportunity to continue to develop yourself, both professionally and personally

Founded in 1975, Brunel has developed into an international group with 12,000 employees and a turnover of â‚¬1.4 billion. We deliver Project and Consulting Solutions, Workforce Solutions and Global Mobility Solutions that transform global projects in Renewables, Conventional Energy, Mining, Life Sciences, Future Mobility, Industrials & Technology and many other sectors.


Brunel is listed on Euronext Amsterdam NV and is included in the Amsterdam Small Cap Index (AScX). The organization has grown into a renowned global brand with more than 120+ offices in over 40 countries on 6 continents.


ABOUT THE TEAM


Youâ€™ll be joining Brunelâ€™s Market & Business Intelligence (M&BI) team, part of our Global Sales Enablement function. Weâ€™re a lean, high-impact team enabling faster, smarter, and more strategic decisions across the business.


At M&BI, we combine market research, consultancy, and data analytics to support Brunelâ€™s strategic priorities and growth execution. Our mission is to turn data into decision intelligence, driving value through insight, efficiency, and innovation.


Reporting to Manager of M&BI, this role helps expand our impact by advancing strategic awareness and analytical capabilities.


ABOUT THE ROLE


Weâ€™re seeking a hands-on, execution-focused data analyst to accelerate our transition from descriptive reporting to diagnostic and predictive analytics. You'll build models, design dashboards, and run experiments that prioritize growth initiatives and inform high-impact decisions.


This role is ideal for someone who thrives in execution, bring strong technical expertise, and is curious to understand the "why" behind the data.


WHAT YOU'LL DO


Client - Focused & Client-Facing Reporting and Analytics (40%)


Build intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports that are:

  • Client-focused: based on client-related data (e.g. customer behaviour, chum, BD targeting)
  • Client-facing; visually polished, presentation- ready, and aligned with required communication standards


Trend Analytics & Modelling (40%)


  • Perform root cause analysis, forecasting, and segmentation to uncover performance drivers
  • Conduct segmentation and clustering analysis to identify behavioural or performance patters across regions, clients ortalent groups


Analytics Process & Tool Scaling (20%)


  • Build scalable (self-service) tools and templates for recurring insights needs
  • Support the evolution of our internal data ecosystem by contributing to data structure, quality, and integration efforts
  • Document processes and methodologies to ensure reproducibility and knowledge sharing


Evolving area (future-focused)


This evolving area includes hypothesis-driven analysis, pressure-testing assumptions, and scenario modelling. You'll partner closely with the M&BI Manager to explore emerging questions and translate them into data-backed insights that support strategic decisions


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


The ideal candidate will have academic-level intellectual and professional capabilities, with a minimum of 4 years of experience in a complex (international) organization. Key qualifications include:

  • Model development: Exposure to or interest in building scenario models and statistical testing
  • Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field


INTERVIEW PROCESS


Two interviews and an online assessment


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU


  • Competitive base salary
  • Hybrid (3 days in the office) & flexible working
  • Coaching and mentoring through weekly check-ins
  • Friendly, collaborative & supportive team environment
  • Laptop and smart phone with Microsoft powered IT tools
  • Benefits; including pension scheme, group health insurance, 26 paid vacation days with the option to buy upto 40 vacation days per year, travel allowance scheme, bicycle lease plan, gym discount
  • Through the Brunel Academy - Brunel's learning & development programme - you have every opportunity to continue to develop yourself, both professionally and personally

Title: Associate, Revenue Analytics - EMEA
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

The Revenue Analytics team provides the company with insights into what drives our past and current revenue and membership trends as well as an outlook on future growth. Internally, our analytical insights help inform our growth and monetization strategy. Our revenue and membership forecasts are critical components that feed into the corporate planning process for spending and resource allocation across content, commerce, and technology.

Netflix is looking for the best and brightest candidates to use data and business insights to inform and drive key strategic decisions. We believe that we derive a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach we take to managing the company. Senior management relies heavily on the Revenue Analytics team to develop a data-driven perspective on the company's growth, and the outcomes of our analyses play a critical role in how we plan for and execute on the company's business objectives.

This role is based out of Netflixâ€™s EMEA headquarters in Amsterdam. The role will include occasional travel to Netflixâ€™s global headquarters in California.

Responsibilities


Support strategic value-added analyses to understand the drivers behind membership and revenue growth in the EMEA markets, derive actionable insights and feedback to collaborative cross-function stakeholders (Content, Partnerships, Ads, Payments, Product, Consumer Insights, Data Science etc.)
Assess and communicate the impact of business decisions such as price changes, content launches, and product innovations to facilitate planning and operational decisions
Analyze and evaluate the business impact of key external events such as competitor moves or country-specific events
Research, track and generate insights about the membership growth landscape
Be a key contributor to in-region pricing decisions, compiling internal and external intelligence to inform price and plan strategy
Collect cross-functional inputs to inform and support the revenue and membership forecasts (acquisition, retention, and market penetration)
Support efforts to centralize and standardize revenue performance reporting, helping identify cross-region best practices to enhance scalability and consistency in business analytics


Qualifications

A successful candidate should have the ability to combine comprehensive data analytics with sound business intuition and judgment, and effectively communicate analytical insights to stakeholders. Given the questions asked of our team are often urgent in nature and have an immediate impact on how the business makes decisions, the individual coming into this role must be able to deliver accurate results promptly. They must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.


3+ years of experience in a quantitative role (e.g. business analytics, management consulting, banking, investment management, etc.)
Bachelorâ€™s degree with an emphasis on quantitative coursework
Proficiency in MS Excel & SQL required
Experience building quantitative models in Excel or other modeling tools
Experience writing complex SQL queries to analyze large data sets
Other coding and technical experience (e.g. VBA, Python, Tableau, etc.) is a plus, but not a prerequisite
Ability to independently extract, explore, and analyze big data from both internal and external sources to guide the analysis of complex issues
Possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, discipline, and flexibility
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Highly skilled in preparing effective presentations (Google Slides, MS PowerPoint) with a clear narrative and impactful visuals
Team player with strong interpersonal skills and a proven ability to build successful relationships at all levels
Experience and knowledge with various EMEA markets is preferred, but not required

Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Business Intelligence Analyst

This is Worldline

Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

The Opportunity

We're looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to provide insights across our multiple products, countries and large merchants. Youâ€™ll work within a freshly consolidated datalake in Azure in a growing international team. You will be able to make an immediate impact on our performance by transforming petabytes of data into clear, precise and relevant information.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities


Working within a team of business analysts on weekly and monthly reporting in PowerBI
Writing SQL queries in Databricks to deliver various analyses
Helping identify anomalies in our performance and triggering conversations on potential fixes
Preparing visuals for compelling storytelling to various stakeholders across the organization
Simplifying some of our ways of working to ensure scalability


Who Are We Looking For

We Look For Big Thinkers. People Who Can Drive Positive Change, Step Up And Show Whatâ€™s Next â€“ People With Passion, Can-do Attitude And a Hunger To Learn And Grow. In Practice This Means


You have an eye for detail
You have an appetite for tackling problems both big and small
You have a knack for following through
You are keen to share your findings with others support our growth
You've got substantial knowledge of Power BI and SQL
Bonus points for experience with Databricks and/or Salesforce
You can communicate effectively to a wide variety of audiences


Perks & Benefits

At Worldline Youâ€™ll Get The Chance To Be At The Heart Of The Global Payments Technology Industry And Shape How The World Pays And Gets Paid. On Top Of That, You Will Also


A rewarding salary
Opportunity to develop yourself in a rapidly growing and agile global organization.
Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career


Shape the evolution.

We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here youâ€™ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.

Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Our mission at Qwello is to revolutionize the charging industry, we are committed to turn the world from combustion to electric. We design, build and operate charging infrastructure for the public space. We excel in simplicity, user focus and engineering excellence. We value diversity of thought, background and approaches and foster a culture of belonging. We understand that the best products are built by excellent teams, not individual superstars. Be part of shaping the E-mobility of the future!

Qwello acquired Park&Charge in 2024 and we now operate in the Netherlands under the name Park&Charge (for more info visit www.parkncharge.nl). To reach our goal, we are looking for a Data Analyst who will help us analyze data to drive operational improvements and support strategic decisions.

As a Data Analyst, you will work with data to provide insights that optimize our charging station operations, forecast demand, and improve processes. You will play a key role in ensuring data integrity, collaborating across teams, and supporting business growth through data-driven solutions.

Only candidates with fluent Dutch will be considered for this position, please refrain from applying if you do not meet this requirement.




Your Responsibilities ðŸš€
Support the team to deliver data analyses and data visualizations to steer the development of relevant metrics and the discovery of business opportunities.
Use data modeling techniques to forecast demand and customer behavior.
Design and maintain dashboards and reports that provide insights into key performance indicators and business performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs, identify relevant data, and implement data-driven solutions.
Contribute to the development of existing ETLs to optimize the reliability and profitability of our growing fleet.





Your Profile âœ¨
Bachelor's or masterâ€™s degree in data analytics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, social science research, or similar field.
Strong knowledge of data analysis tools (Excel, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Looker) and confidence with Python scripting.
Ability to extract insights from raw data and understand database architecture, data landscapes, and warehouses.
Strong analytical skills to identify problems, analyze data, and provide valuable insights within organizational and industry contexts.
Proactive approach to problem-solving with a result focused attitude.Â 
The ability to work in a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment.
Willingness to take initiative, and to ensure high quality standards.
Fluency in both written and verbal Dutch and English.





Your Benefits ðŸª´
Flat hierarchies with an efficient decision-making processes without red tape.
The opportunity to play a key role in shaping the mobility revolution.
Be part of an international and dynamic team of more than 35 nationalities.
Enjoy a remote-friendly environment withÂ  flexible options, you choose whether to work entirely from home, in one of our offices or a mix that suits you and you have the possibility of workation within the EU, plus 30 vacation days.
Regular company and team events outside of the office to disconnect from our computers and reconnect with colleagues on hikes, mountain e-bike tours, offsites and more.
Personal and professional development through in-house lunch & learn sessions, collaborative coding challenge discussions, as well as externally provided training, courses and conferences.








Equal Opportunities:

We strive to eliminate discrimination,Â  remove barriers and ensure equal opportunity through a transparent recruitment process. We are fully committed to fostering an inclusive and respectful work environment where everyone can succeed.Â  At Park&Charge everyone is welcomed regardless of cultural background, creed, race, sexual orientation, colour orÂ  gender expression.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a data-driven professional who's excited to transform business questions into actionable insights that drive decisions. In this role, youâ€™ll collaborate with commercial teams, to influence strategic planning and elevate business performance. You will work alongside talented and driven data peers in a dynamic environment to create real impact in HousingAnywhere's growth.

Excited for the challenge? We are excited to hear from you!



Your role & Impact

The purpose of this role is to empower commercial teams with insights and recommendations to grow our marketplace and get the most of our team.


Collaborate closely with the commercial teams to translate business questions into analyses, synthesise insights and develop recommendations to drive business results.
Define, develop and monitor the key metrics to measure operational performance and business outcomes, and identify drivers for changes in these metrics
Ensure business questions are addressed in the most effective format (ad-hoc deep-dive, recurring analysis, dashboards, self-serving functional tools)
Empower stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via dashboards and self-serving tools, in close collaboration with the Analytics Engineering and Business Intelligence teams.
Develop dashboards and reports that support operational business processes.
Support commercial team OKR planning and measurement.
Identify and implement opportunities to enhance existing analytical processes and methodologies




Your team

Our Commercial Analytics and Business Intelligence team is formed by 4 analysts from diverse backgrounds and experience levels. We collaborate closely with data engineers, analytics engineers, and data scientists to extract insights and drive informed decision-making.



Your profile

Required:


4+ years experience as a Data Analyst, or equivalent role with a strong data/analytics component.
Analytical mindset, combined with good business sense and orientation.
A good communicator who can present insights and recommendations clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Self-starter with strong project and time management skills.
Proficient in SQL and Google Sheets, and experience with at least one dashboarding tool (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.)


Preferred


Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.) is a plus
Previous experience in a high-growth, fast-paced tech company is a big plus.
Experience creating interactive dashboards in Tableau


Whatâ€™s in it for you


Unlimited paid holidays, minimum-based not maximum!
Hybrid working policy with 2 days working from the office.
Flexibility to work remotely for up to 2 months per year!
1,000 EUR personal development budget.
Complete coverage for commuting.
30% ruling application assistance.
Personal equipment, including laptop and ergonomic setup.
Gym membership discount with GoVital or OneFit.
Dutch/English classes budget.
Variable pension scheme.
Diverse international community (46+ nationalities).
Pet-friendly office in Rotterdam city centre.
Fun team-building and after-work drinks every Friday.


About HousingAnywhere Group

HousingAnywhere is Europeâ€™s largest mid-term rental platform, covering over 125 cities across Europe and several in the US. With Kamernet and Studapart under its umbrella, HousingAnywhere empowers people to live wherever and however they choose. Through our advanced online platforms, which together attract over 30 million users annually, we connect young professionals and students directly with accommodation providers. Our team of 250 professionals is dedicated to helping tenants find comfort and peace of mind in their rental search, whether they're looking for a home across the globe or just across town.

Our mission

Rent Easy, Live Free.

Our Values


Ownership
We are Enablers
We are Changemakers
We are Connectors


If you have further questions, please email Iris at i.fernandes@housinganywhere.com

Excited for the challenge? We are excited to hear from you!



Your role & Impact

The purpose of this role is to empower commercial teams with insights and recommendations to grow our marketplace and get the most of our team.

  • Collaborate closely with the commercial teams to translate business questions into analyses, synthesise insights and develop recommendations to drive business results.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We help companies modernize business operations, adopt intelligent automation, deliver real-time performance insights and connect the enterprise - accelerating the impact of digital transformation. Founded in 1987 and recognized as a trusted advisor, HSO is one of the world's top business solution and implementation partners, large enough to serve, small enough to care. We are 100% dedicated to Microsoft technology, with practices that offer our clients a complete set of Microsoft cloud solutions from a single global partner. HSO is a proven global leader with unique delivery capabilities offered from our dedicated Microsoft practices in more than 30 offices across the Americas, Europe, Australia and Asia.

HSO is a Gold Certified partner since 2002 and since 2006 has been a part of the Microsoft Dynamics Inner Circle, a prestige reserved for just 1% of Microsoft partners worldwide. Within HSO you'll work with Microsoft Dynamics 365, Azure cloud platform and our unique, industry-specific solutions.

We are a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business insights and decisions. Our team is passionate about technology and data, and we are looking for a talented Data Engineer / Data Analyst to join us.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
Analyze complex datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses
Create and manage dashboards and reports to visualize data trends and metrics
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation
Optimize data processes for performance and scalability



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a similar role
Proficiency in Fabric, SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities



Benefits

Why choose HSO?

Freedom and flexibility

An organization with a lot of professional freedom and flexibility where we make the best choices together to optimize your development process during your career.

Culture

An open and accessible work environment full of colleagues who are always there for each other. We are one big HSO Team. Because without cooperation and fun, there is no success!

Development and growth

A job with plenty of growth opportunities in an organisation with an eye for your talents, ambitions and the things that drive you.

A good remuneration package

An excellent salary and fringe benefits include a laptop, mobile phone, flexible incentive plan, large office offering a collaborative environment with a modern design and free parking in Amsterdam.

Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company and work with many international colleagues? Then you can apply immediately!

Title: Data Analyst - Freelance - Amsterdam
Description:
Job Title: Freelance Data Analyst

Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands

Contract Type: Freelance

Duration: 6 months

Start Date: ASAP




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse and manipulate large datasets using Python and SQL to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Create and maintain automated reporting and dashboards using Power BI.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to define KPIs, business metrics, and analytical requirements.
Build statistical models and forecasts to assist with decision-making.
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous data validation and cleansing techniques.
Translate complex data analysis into clear, understandable business recommendations.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Proven experience (3+ years) as a Data Analyst or similar role, preferably in a freelance capacity.
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying, data extraction, and analysis.
Expertise in data visualization and reporting tools, particularly Power BI.
Solid experience with Python for data analysis, automation, and building models.
Some experience working with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Strong ability to analyse large datasets, draw insights, and generate actionable recommendations.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical data to non-technical teams.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in the Finance Industry is a plus.
Familiarity with ETL processes and database management systems.
Knowledge of data privacy laws, including GDPR compliance.
Ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams.

Title: Ice Cream: Business Intelligence Internship
Description:
The Ice Cream division at Unilever is preparing to stand on its own, aiming to become an independent, EUR 8.3 billion publicly listed company by the end of 2025. Weâ€™re on a mission to create the ultimate snacking company. A place where growth, innovation, founder and ownership mentality, and performance are cultivated and rewarded. And where we craft extraordinary ice cream experiences - transforming ordinary moments into lasting memories. Because we know, life tastes better with ice cream.

About The Magnum Ice Cream Company

The Magnum Ice Cream Company is all about growth. Growing our business. Growing our customersâ€™ businesses. Growing our peopleâ€™s careers. Growth begins with empowerment. So we free our people to be innovative, responsible entrepreneurs, driven and equipped to give our consumers more amazing products and unforgettable moments â€“ and having fun doing it.

With 19.000 expert ice cream colleagues and iconic brands like Wallâ€™s, Cornetto and Ben & Jerryâ€™s, loved in 76 countries, we are the worldâ€™s largest Ice Cream company leading the industry. We have been taking pleasure seriously for more than 100 years, serving happiness with every lick or scoop of ice cream for generations.

We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of The Magnum Ice Cream Company as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen before the end of 2025.

We dream big but keep things simple to act fast.

If you want to grow with us, make an impact, and shape the future of Ice Cream, this is the place for you!

Job Purpose

As an intern in the Business Intelligence Department, your ideas will drive impact, and your creativity will take center stage.

The team will provide you with opportunities to support projects that will help you gain hands-on experience in data analysis, modelling, and developing data-driven solutions, enhance skills in collaborating with cross-functional teams and communicating data insights effectively.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
Create visual representations of data to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide solutions.
Ensure data quality and integrity by managing data sources and performing regular audits.
Identify opportunities to improve data processes and implement best practices.
Learn and apply tools and technologies such as SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Excel.
Assist in various projects by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.


You Are The Perfect Fit If


Youâ€™re available for 5 to 6 months starting 1st September 2025 (minimum 32 hours/week).
Youâ€™re enrolled (3rd or 4th year) in Bachelor or Master of Economics, Econometrics, or Data Science.
You have strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Experience with SQL and/or Python is a plus.
You have experience with PowerBI.
Experience with AI (LLM or ML) is a plus.
You demonstrate innovation and creativity.
You have advanced Excel skills.
You are fluent in English.


What You Can Expect


A unique mix of global scale & start-up spiritâ€”â‚¬8.3bn powerhouse with an agile, entrepreneurial mindset. Weâ€™re building a new high growth Ice Cream company from the ground up.
A â‚¬625 gross/month allowance.
Travel reimbursement (if you donâ€™t have a student travel card).
Career without limitsâ€”42 markets, international opportunities, and fast tracked growth.
A performance-driven cultureâ€”Freedom to act, disrupt and grow â€“ your success is measured by impact.
A company that celebrates joy, innovation, and purposeâ€”We create extraordinary careers, just like our ice cream creates extraordinary moments.


Additional Information

As publicly announced, Unilever will separate its Ice Cream business which is expected by the end of 2025. This role will transfer to the new Ice Cream company.

Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life. This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.

For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position

ARE YOU EXCITED TO CRAFT THE ICE CREAM FUTURE?


Click "Apply now" and upload your CV and motivation letter. Don't forget to complete the questionnaire we send you. It's your chance to shine!
Our team will carefully review your application. We receive a lot of applications, so please bear with us as we give each one the attention it deserves.
If we think you might be a great fit, we'll schedule a friendly phone call to get to know you better and hear about your motivations.
We'll present your profile to the manager. If theyâ€™re impressed, you'll be invited for an interview to discuss the opportunity further.
After the interview, the manager will provide feedback on your performance. If you are selected, you'll receive an offer letter with all the exciting details about your internship.
Once you accept the offer, we'll guide you through the onboarding process, including any necessary paperwork, training sessions, and introductions to your awesome team.
You'll kick off your internship, get integrated into the team, and start working on your cool projects and responsibilities.


Disclaimerâ€¯

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

We take pleasure seriously. Join the Ice Cream team now!

  • Meerdere jaren ervaring in een rol als data engineering of data-analyse met tools als SQL, Python, Data Vault en PowerBI
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands.
  • Ervaring met SCRUM/Agile werken.


We komen graag met je in contact als je het leuk vindt om vanuit een technische data-achtergrond bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren en de spin in het web te zijn tussen Data Engineers en Business Stakeholders. Solliciteer via nielsv@doghouse-recruitment.nl of via de "Nu solliciteren" button.


Salaris: Tot â‚¬ 90K

Locatie: Utrecht (hybride)

Title: Intern (Data Analysis)
Description:
THIS OPPORTUNITY IS FOR 9 WEEKS THIS SUMMER FROM END OF JUNE 2025. (You must be able to commit to the full 9 weeks)




You are full of potential




WE'RE HERE TO UNLEASH IT




Your success, performance and inspiration is our aspiration.




A career at Korn Ferry means thriving in a diverse, autonomous, and flexible environment. Excellence is consistently recognized and rewarded, empowering you to share your ideas and follow them through. And, because weâ€™re all about taking talent further, you can look forward to exceptional training and development.




Korn Ferryâ€™s KFI business helps develop organizational structure, culture, performance, development, and people to drive sustainable growth by addressing four fundamental organizational and talent needs: Organization Strategy, Assessment and Succession, Leadership & Professional Development, and Total Rewards.




As a KFI summer intern with Korn Ferry, you will have the opportunity to learn about our company, our capabilities and solutions. You will gain first-hand experience of working on client projects as part of a team, and you will get to learn from solution and industry experts throughout the program through on-the job and structured learning sessions.




You will also have the opportunity to build networks with colleagues and peer groups locally and internationally with peers taking part in Korn Ferryâ€™s Intern program in other international offices.

This is a hybrid Internship program and there will be an expectation for all Interns to be able to get to the Amsterdam office at least three days per week.




If you do well, you may be offered an opportunity to join our Emerging Talent program.

To be eligible for the Korn Ferry KFI Internship:




You must be a Masters student who will be completing their studies and be available for full time employment in 2025.
You must speak English and preferably Dutch on a professional level
Korn Ferry is not able to sponsor applicants for these roles, so please note that you must have full authorization to work permanently in the EU.
We look for a diverse range of skills and experience and are interested in candidates who are actively involved in extracurricular activities whilst successfully balancing academic study.
You should be naturally curious and keen to use your analytical, problem-solving skills to generate creative solutions to client challenges.
OSP Intern: Support in creating Organization Success Profiles looking at outcome measures of for strategic priorities like innovation or expansion and growth.
Focus of curating/collecting/cleaning external outcome and performance metrics to define what good orgs for this OSP look like.
Focus on a particular KF dataset (e.g. pay, or engagement) to analyze the relationships between our data and those external metrics.
Work with backend systems and APIs to collect and consolidate data.
Develop scripts or tools to automate the generation and delivery of reports.
Assist in building and optimizing data pipelines for efficient data flow between systems.
Clean, preprocess, and validate data to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Work closely with data analysts, engineers, and others to meet reporting and data integration needs.
Help monitor data processes and troubleshoot issues related to data collection or reporting automation.
Document workflows, automation processes, and data sources for future reference and scalability.
Preferred Degrees/Majors: Masters

- Computer science

- Data science

- Data engineering

- Information systems




To apply, please send us your CV with a cover letter outlining what makes you a good candidate and why you would be interested in an Internship with Korn Ferry.

Title: Data Analyst â€“ Advertising
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol is always advancing its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and over 50,000 trading partners. Our advertising propositions help shoppers discover products and advertisers reach customers â€“ this is where youâ€™ll make a difference. Youâ€™ll use data to help our advertising customers maximise visibility over their products on our platform where, how and to whom it matters. This also makes shopping journeys more relevant to our shoppers.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and is becoming an increasingly important channel for our advertising customers. Their need for data and insights are no exception. They rely on us to provide them with meaningful metrics, insightful analyses, and reliable predictive models to keep investing effectively.

What Youâ€™ll Do As a Data Analyst

Youâ€™ll join 15 analysts in Bolâ€™s advertising analytics organization. Together you share a mission of making people performant through analytics. This role is for the versatile analyst, one that is equally comfortable talking to data as to stakeholders. Your stakeholders can be colleagues from the Advertising and Product domains as well as advertiser customers. Your days vary but at the core youâ€™ll use SQL/Python/Tableau/dbt/git to provide metrics, analysis, and predictions that help advertisers make better decisions.

Youâ€™ll collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs, identify key performance metrics, define high value use cases for analytics to help advertising customers make better decisions. Your work will be input for amongst others client meetings, white papers, webinars, and public industry appearances.


Analysing advertising KPIs in all stages of the Media Funnel and identifying relevant shopper behaviour across their journeys. You'll use your analytical skills to uncover patterns and insights in our data that help us understand how to optimize the effectiveness of our advertising propositions.
Working closely with internal stakeholders (Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing) and top advertising and agency customers to identify high value applications of analytics. You use your data expertise to help guide decision-making processes and ensure that data-driven insights and recommendations are central to retail media plans.
Developing extensive domain knowledge across our business to effectively manage and analyse advertising KPIs delivered through presentations, dashboards, white papers or public industry appearances.
Developing high-quality data pipelines for dashboarding and KPIs in collaboration with our analytical engineers (using dbt), ensuring that the data we use for reporting and analysis is accurate, complete, and up-to-date.
Writing high-quality and easily interpretable SQL and Python code that can be reused. You'll use your SQL skills to query large, complex datasets, extracting the data needed to answer key business questions. You'll also ensure that your SQL and Python code is reusable, well-documented, and easily interpretable by other members of the team.


Why you can make the difference?

Youâ€™re an enthusiastic team player who lives and breathes analytics. The ideal candidate for this role has a strong analytical mindset, a healthy appetite for making business impact and excellent communication and collaboration skills. You have experience working with SQL and dashboarding tools like Tableau and are comfortable navigating and analysing large, complex datasets. You also have a knack for translating complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations.

3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


- If you strongly value clarity No, if innovating, autonomy, and ambiguity sound terrifying to you.
- You only want to process data No, if you only want to process data and prefer someone else to handle project and stakeholder management.
- If you believe analysts donâ€™t need domain knowledge No, if you don't want to dive into the world of advertising. Curiosity and willingness to learn about our domain and customers are key to your success.
+ Youâ€™re an analytics professional Yes, if you have 5+ year experience delighting decision makers with your analytical skills. SQL is a must, Python scripting is a strong plus.
+ Obsess over creating value for advertisers Yes, if you believe output does not equal outcome and judge success by value creation.
+ You get (and create) energy by working with others Yes, if you can translate technical information into language anyone can understand. You enjoy working with both data and people.


It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analist




Maak impact met data in de publieke sector! Wil jij met jouw analytische vaardigheden bijdragen aan betere zorg, onderwijs en overheidsdiensten? Bij Van Dam Datapartners zoeken we een Data Analist die data omzet in heldere inzichten en concrete adviezen.




Wat ga je doen?




Analyseren & inzicht bieden: je onderzoekt datasets van gemeenten, zorginstellingen en andere publieke organisaties om maatschappelijke trends en knelpunten te signaleren.
Datavisualisatie & rapportages: je bouwt dashboards en rapportages in tools zoals Power BI, Tableau, Qlik of Cognos, zodat besluitvormers direct aan de slag kunnen met jouw inzichten.
Adviseren & presenteren: je vertaalt data naar duidelijke en overtuigende adviezen en presenteert deze aan opdrachtgevers.
Samenwerken & verbeteren: je werkt in een dynamisch team, waarbij je samen met Data Engineers en BI-specialisten slimme data-oplossingen ontwikkelt.




Wie ben jij?

Minimaal 1 jaar ervaring binnen het publieke domein.
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met het analyseren van data.
Kennis van datavisualisatie, statistiek en SQL.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden: je kunt complexe analyses eenvoudig uitleggen.
Je houdt van een uitdaging en voelt je thuis in een dynamische commerciÃ«le omgeving.
Je bent proactief en neemt het initiatief om met klanten in gesprek te gaan, zowel op inhoud als op de relatie. Je signaleert kansen en zoekt samen naar de beste oplossingen.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Je komt te werken bij een ambitieuze organisatie, waar je samen met een enthousiast team werkt aan projecten die ertoe doen.




Een marktconform salaris (â‚¬ 3.750 â€“ â‚¬5.500 bruto per maand op basis van 40 uur per week), afhankelijk van jouw werkervaring;
8% vakantiegeld;
NS-Business Card of reiskostenvergoeding (â‚¬ 0,23 per km);
Een laptop en telefoon;
25 vakantiedagen;
De mogelijkheid om (maximaal 5) dagen bij te kopen of te verkopen;
Pensioenregeling bij Nationale Nederlanden;
Een thuiswerkvergoeding van â‚¬ 2,40 per dag en de mogelijkheid om een thuiswerkplek in te richten;
Toegang tot de Academy en de mogelijkheid om een persoonlijk opleidingsprogramma samen te stellen.




Heb je nog vragen, dan mag je altijd contact met ons opnemen via werkenbij@vandamdatapartners.nl.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
You are

  • have a Master in Econometrics, Computer Science, Business Administration, Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree;
  • have 0â€“ 1 years of experience in Data-Consulting and have strong analytical skills;
  • are excited about big data, predictive analysis, process mining and continuous improvement;
  • are fluent in English and Dutch (pre);
  • have experience with SQL or Python;
  • like drinking beers as much as you like statistics.

You will be

  • analysing large data sets to optimise business processes through process mining;
  • creating value for our clients by building automated workflows and predictive models;
  • building business cases and presenting them to our clients;
  • receiving training in process mining (and get certified!);
  • spending your Friday afternoon in Witte de With;

Title: Ice Cream: Customer Development Internship â€“ Data Analysis and Report
Description:
The Ice Cream division at Unilever is preparing to stand on its own, aiming to become an independent, EUR 8.3 billion publicly listed company by the end of 2025. Weâ€™re on a mission to create the ultimate snacking company. A place where growth, innovation, founder and ownership mentality, and performance are cultivated and rewarded. And where we craft extraordinary ice cream experiences - transforming ordinary moments into lasting memories. Because we know, life tastes better with ice cream.

About The Magnum Ice Cream Company

The Magnum Ice Cream Company is all about growth. Growing our business. Growing our customersâ€™ businesses. Growing our peopleâ€™s careers. Growth begins with empowerment. So we free our people to be innovative, responsible entrepreneurs, driven and equipped to give our consumers more amazing products and unforgettable moments â€“ and having fun doing it. â€¯â€¯

With 19.000 expert ice cream colleagues and iconic brands like Wallâ€™s, Cornetto and Ben & Jerryâ€™s, loved in 76 countries, we are the worldâ€™s largest Ice Cream company leading the industry. â€¯We have been taking pleasure seriously for more than 100 years, serving happiness with every lick or scoop of ice cream for generations. â€¯

We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of The Magnum Ice Cream Company as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen before the end of 2025. â€¯

We dream big but keep things simple to act fast. â€¯

If you want to grow with us, make an impact, and shape the future of Ice Cream, this is the place for you!â€¯

Job Purpose

As an intern in the Costumer Development Department, your ideas will drive impact, and your creativity will take center stage.

The team will provide you with opportunities to support projects that will help you develop and apply data analysis skills using tools like Excel, create customer analytics on sales performance, learn data manipulation and storytelling based on data, monitor and evaluate product performance, support marketing campaigns and innovations.

Key Responsibilities


Prepare sales data audits and analysis.
Create monthly performance reports.
Translate sales data into actionable insights.
Update and manage databases and reports.
Assist in retailer presentations and stakeholder engagement.
Conduct independent or team analyses.
Ensure data quality.


You Are The Perfect Fit If


You are available for 5 to 6 months starting 1st September 2025 (minimum 32 hours/week).
You are enrolled in a Bachelor (3rd or 4th year) or Master program with an analytical component.
You have experience with Power BI, Python, and/or R (a big plus).
You are fluent in English and Dutch.
You have strong analytical skills (Excel experience a plus).
You are curious, flexible, and data-savvy.
You have an affinity with commercial strategy


What You Can Expect


A unique mix of global scale & start-up spiritâ€”â‚¬8.3bn powerhouse with an agile, entrepreneurial mindset. Weâ€™re building a new high growth Ice Cream company from the ground up.
A â‚¬625 gross/month allowance.
Travel reimbursement (if you donâ€™t have a student travel card).
Career without limitsâ€”42 markets, international opportunities, and fast tracked growth.
A performance-driven cultureâ€”Freedom to act, disrupt and grow â€“ your success is measured by impact.
A company that celebrates joy, innovation, and purposeâ€”We create extraordinary careers, just like our ice cream creates extraordinary moments.


Additional Information

As publicly announced, Unilever will separate its Ice Cream business which is expected by the end of 2025. This role will transfer to the new Ice Cream company.

Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life. This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.â€¯

For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position

ARE YOU EXCITED TO CRAFT THE ICE CREAM FUTURE?


Click "Apply now" and upload your CV and motivation letter. Don't forget to complete the questionnaire we send you. It's your chance to shine!
Our team will carefully review your application. We receive a lot of applications, so please bear with us as we give each one the attention it deserves.
If we think you might be a great fit, we'll schedule a friendly phone call to get to know you better and hear about your motivations.
We'll present your profile to the manager. If theyâ€™re impressed, you'll be invited for an interview to discuss the opportunity further.
After the interview, the manager will provide feedback on your performance. If you are selected, you'll receive an offer letter with all the exciting details about your internship.
Once you accept the offer, we'll guide you through the onboarding process, including any necessary paperwork, training sessions, and introductions to your awesome team.
You'll kick off your internship, get integrated into the team, and start working on your cool projects and responsibilities.


Disclaimerâ€¯

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.â€¯

We take pleasure seriously. Join the Ice Cream team now!

  • You'll kick off your internship, get integrated into the team, and start working on your cool projects and responsibilities.

Disclaimerâ€¯

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.â€¯

We take pleasure seriously. Join the Ice Cream team now!

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Zie jij het als een uitdaging om data om te zetten in waardevolle inzichten? Wil jij jouw analytische talent inzetten om processen slimmer,efficiÃ«nter en toekomstgericht te maken? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou! Solliciteer direct en maak het verschil met jouw data-gedreven aanpak.




Hier ga je werken

Het bedrijf is een toonaangevende dienstverlener actief in heel Nederland. De organisatie is volop in beweging en hecht veel waarde aan digitalisering en datagedreven werken. Met 5000 medewerkers en 650 partners is het Ã©Ã©n van de grootste dienstverleners van Nederland.




De organisatie werkt met verschillende technologieÃ«n die de werkzaamheden van hun werknemers efficiÃ«nter maken. Deze technologieÃ«n creÃ«ren een stroom aan data die zeer nuttig is voor de organisatie. Voor het data-team zijn we op zoek naar een enthousiaste Data Analist die graag meedenkt aan een moderne, toekomstbestendige data-infrastructuur.




Als Data Analist speel je een sleutelrol in het omzetten van data naar waardevolle inzichten die direct bijdragen aan het verbeteren van de dienstverlening. Je werkt samen met collega's uit het data-team aan innovatieve projecten rondom sensoren, robotica, machine learning en process mining. Met jouw analyses help je processen slimmer, sneller en efficiÃ«nter te maken. Je analyseert data uit verschillende bronnen, bouwt dashboards en rapportages, en geeft advies op basis van jouw bevindingen. Je zorgt ervoor dat data begrijpelijk wordt gepresenteerd en dat de organisatie hierop kan sturen.




Klaar om met jouw inzichten echte impact te maken? Solliciteer dan direct en versterk dit innovatieve team! Heb je vragen of wil je meer weten over de rol? Neem dan gerust contact op met Eva Pelle van Experis via 06-38685915 of eva.pelle@experis.nl!




Dit ga je doen

Verzamelen, combineren en analyseren van data uit verschillende bronnen.
Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van dashboards, rapportages en datavisualisaties.
Signaleren van trends, knelpunten en kansen ter ondersteuning van bedrijfsbeslissingen.
Meewerken aan projecten rondom procesoptimalisatie, sensordata, machine learning en process mining.
Presenteren van analyses en aanbevelingen aan interne stakeholders.
Bewaken van de datakwaliteit en zorgen voor heldere, betrouwbare datasets.




Dit neem je mee

Aantoonbaar HBO-WO werk- en denkniveau;
Sterk analytisch denkvermogen en oog voor detail.
Vaardig in het vertalen van data naar begrijpelijke inzichten voor de organisatie.
Ervaring met Power BI en basiskennis van SQL is een prÃ©.
Proactieve houding en de vaardigheid om zelfstandig te werken.




Dit krijg je

Een bruto maandsalaris tussen â‚¬2.500,- en â‚¬4.000,- o.b.v. 40 uur.
â‚¬50,- tegemoetkoming in je ziektekosten (bovenop je brutosalaris).
8,33% vakantiegeld en 25 tot 27 vakantiedagen.
Laptop, tablet en telefoon van de zaak.
Goede studiemogelijkheden en opleidingsbudget.
Reiskostenvergoeding van â‚¬0,23/km of volledige OV-vergoeding.
Uitstekende pensioenregeling.
Flexibiliteit: Ã©Ã©n vaste kantoordag (maandag) en een tweede dag naar keuze.
Werken in een omgeving waar jouw analyses Ã©cht impact hebben en waar je wordt gestimuleerd om je verder te ontwikkelen.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
JOIN OUR TEAM

Junior Data Analyst

Amsterdam




THE OPPORTUNITY

We are delighted to offer a unique opportunity to join the Orange Capital Partners family and embark in our exciting journey by becoming our new Junior Data Analyst based in Amsterdam. Are you talented, eager and looking for a new challenge? This job might be for you!




THE FIRM

Since being founded in 2014, Orange Capital Partners (OCP) has established itself as one of the leading and fastest growing real estate investment firms in Europe. From inception to date, we have successfully grown our portfolio to a value of around â‚¬5bn, first in our home market, the Netherlands and then more recently internationally in Ireland, Denmark, Finland and Germany.




With support from blue chip institutional investors and by focusing on long term investments, predominantly in residential and retail real estate, our track record and reputation for excellence is strong. This great achievement provides us with a solid foundation to seek new opportunities and pursue an ambitious growth strategy for the years to come.




THE PEOPLE

At OCP, our people are considered our greatest asset. Currently we have a diverse, international and highly skilled dynamic team of c. 80 professionals spread across 4 offices: Amsterdam (HQ), Dublin, Copenhagen, and Helsinki.




â€œBe engaged! Strive for the best! Play as a team! Do what is right!â€ tells you who we are and what we stand for. We promote a growth mindset and give our employees room to prove themselves, offering responsibilities from day one and opportunities to develop and learn within a challenging yet safe work environment. We work closely together in our vibrant, modern-looking offices and enjoy spending time together during the many social events organized throughout the year such as sport, dinners, drinks, charity events, offsites, ski trips, etc.




THE ROLE

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers an excellent opportunity to further develop your data skills and transform data into compelling visual representations that help drive business insights and decisions at OCP.




Main activities:

Work closely with our Data Analyst and stakeholders in the organization to understand data analysis and visualization needs.
Perform data analyses and create engaging and informative Power BI dashboards using data from our Data Platform (Snowflake).
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to support business objectives.
Present findings and visualizations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.




THE PROFILE

This role is ideal for someone with a passion for data and excels at conveying information through visuals. If you are eager to learn and ready to work in a young and energetic team, we would love to hear from you!




Required skills, experience and qualifications

Masterâ€™s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Econometrics, Computer Science or a similar field.
Some experience with data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau or any other relevant tool.
Some experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Experience with SQL and Snowflake or comparable cloud products is a bonus.
Analytically driven.
Willingness to work in a self-directed way at times, but equally able to excel collaboratively.
Effective communication skills to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders.
Fluent in English.




WHAT WE OFFER

Competitive compensation.
Young and entrepreneurial atmosphere.
Vibrant and international working environment.
Social events.




If you want to join the exciting OCP journey and apply for this position, please reach out to our Data Analyst Robbert-Jan Brinkhorst at robbertjan.brinkhorst@orange-cp.com

Title: Student Data Analyst Intern
Description:
We are looking for a Student Data Analyst Intern to join our Trevolution team within Dyninno Group travel division.




Trevolution is a global leader in air ticketing and travel services, serving retail and corporate clients in 50+ markets. With over 20 years of expertise and an entrepreneurial spirit at our core, we combine modern tech with a customer-first approach to simplify travel. As the 4th-largest US airline ticket consolidator, we partner with 70+ airlines, offering a full booking experience with expert support â€“ focused on value and convenience. Our products, including online sales, call bookings, and semi-OTAs, are continually expanding to meet market trends.




As a Student Data Analyst Intern, you will gain hands-on experience in data collection, analysis, and visualization. You will work closely with our data and business teams to extract meaningful insights, support decision-making, and contribute to ongoing projects.




Internship Period: July 2025 â€“ December 2025 (can be negotiated).

Hours: 32-40 hours per week.




Responsibilities:

Analyze data from various sources.
Assist in developing reports and dashboards.
Support business teams in data-driven decision-making.
Identify trends and patterns in large datasets.
Collaborate with colleagues on improving data processes.




Requirements:

Student must be enrolled in a Dutch university HBO/WO program in Data Science, Business Analytics, Econometrics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience with data analysis tools such as Python, R, or SQL is a plus.
Knowledge of data visualization tools (Looker, Power BI, Tableau) is advantageous.
Detail-oriented with strong communication skills.
Able to work both independently and in a team.




What We Offer:

Internship allowance: subject to discussion, based on university policy.
Travel cost reimbursement (if needed).
Hands-on experience in a data-driven environment.
Guidance from experienced professionals.
A dynamic and inspiring workplace.
Please note that we only offer a regular internship and not a research internship.




Interested? Send your CV to hr_netherlands@dyninno.com with the subject â€œInternship Application â€“ Student Data Analystâ€ by the 16th of May.




We look forward to your application!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ben jij een gedreven Data Analist met een passie voor de financiÃ«le wereld die graag de cruciale rol heeft in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar het worden van meer data-driven? Wil je impact hebben door data te vertalen naar waardevolle inzichten en besluitvorming? Dan is deze rol als Data Analist binnen onze organisatie iets voor jou!




Data Analist




Als Data Analist speel je een cruciale rol in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar data-gedreven organisaties. Je identificeert de informatiebehoeften van de business en vertaalt deze naar relevante data-oplossingen. Met jouw technische expertise verzamel en analyseer je data en zet je deze om in waardevolle inzichten.

In jouw rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het integreren van klantdata met andere databronnen en het omzetten van deze gegevens in actionable insights. Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert zowel nieuwe als bestaande dashboards die onze opdrachtgevers ondersteunen. Hierbij identificeer je nieuwe databronnen, valideer je de verzamelde data en presenteer je deze op een overzichtelijke manier. Dankzij jouw analyses en inzichten kunnen onze opdrachtgevers hun proposities en processen verder verbeteren.

Je werkt nauw samen met je eigen team en diverse teams bij onze opdrachtgevers, waarbij je hen ondersteunt en adviseert op zowel tactisch als strategisch niveau.




Wat bieden we jou?




Jouw gedrevenheid binnen Novisource wordt beloond. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij je kunt blijven ontwikkelen en kunt doorgroeien. Jij bent daarin altijd in de lead! Naast vakinhoudelijke opleidingen bieden wij ook cursussen en trainingen op het gebied van diverse methodieken en vaardigheden aan. Daarnaast:

Een salarisrange van â‚¬ 4.500,- tot â‚¬ 6.500,- bruto per maand (afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring) en een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling
Een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget
Laptop, vaste onkostenvergoeding en telefoonvergoeding
Direct een vast dienstverband
Leaseauto of reiskostenvergoeding
Verbinding is Ã©Ã©n van onze kernwaarden, we investeren dus gedurende het hele jaar in inhoudelijke, inspirerende en vooral leuke events
Een hybride werk cultuur. We vinden elkaar zeker op ons gezellige kantoor in Amsterdam (vlakbij station Bijlmer Arena), maar stimuleren eigen verantwoordelijkheid en flexibiliteit




Wat neem je mee?




Je bent nieuwsgierig van aard, denkt graag in oplossingen en bent resultaat gedreven. Uiteraard heb je een goed ontwikkeld organisatiebewustzijn en daarnaast neem jij onderstaande mee:

HBO/WO gediplomeerd
Minimaal 4 jaar ervaring binnen de financiÃ«le dienstverlening op het gebied van data
Je hebt een sterk analytisch denkvermogen en bent communicatief vaardig
Je hebt eerder gewerkt in een Scrum/Agile omgeving (sterke prÃ©)
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift
Aantoonbare ervaring met de financiÃ«le sector
Ervaring met het werken binnen multidisciplinaire teams




Over Novisource

Novisource is een kleinschalige, ambitieuze en persoonlijke consultancy-organisatie. We bemiddelen intelligente, gedreven en gepassioneerde consultants die meebouwen aan de (digitale) verandering van morgen. Vooralsnog met name in de financiÃ«le sector, maar we werken hard aan uitbreiding van onze klantenportefeuille. We geloven dat onze expertises ook in andere sectoren hard nodig zijn en willen zo meer diversiteit bieden aan onze consultants wat betreft werkomgeving en opdrachten.

Daarnaast zitten we als organisatie zelf ook in een veranderproces, waarin we professionaliseren om de volgende stap te kunnen zetten in kwaliteit, zowel richting onze mensen als richting onze klanten. Houd je van ondernemen, meebouwen, de dynamiek die hoort bij groei en van direct verschil en resultaat zien van het werk dat je doet?

Dan is deze rol geknipt voor jou.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Over The Member Company







We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:







About this vacancy




As a Data Analyst at TMC Data Science, you will transform raw data into actionable insights that guide strategic decision-making. You will create dashboards and visualizations that simplify complex data and support innovation through trend analysis and forecasting.







Key Responsibiliies




Analyze data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities.
Develop intuitive dashboards and reports for stakeholders.
Conduct trend analysis and create predictive models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business.
Present findings in a clear and impactful manner.




hat we expect from you?

Bachelorâ€™s or Msc degree in Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related fields.
3-5 years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence.
Proficiency in visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Strong analytical and communication skills.
Knowledge of the high-tech industry is a plus.




What you can expect you

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.




At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.




As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.

Over The Member Company



We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:



About this vacancy


As a Data Analyst at TMC Data Science, you will transform raw data into actionable insights that guide strategic decision-making. You will create dashboards and visualizations that simplify complex data and support innovation through trend analysis and forecasting.



Key Responsibiliies


  • Analyze data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities.
  • Develop intuitive dashboards and reports for stakeholders.
  • Conduct trend analysis and create predictive models.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business.

hat we expect from you?

Title: Data Analyst InternÂ
Description:
Azerion

Azerion was founded in 2013 and is a technology company providing digital advertising and online gaming services headquartered in the Netherlands. Azerion operates a proprietary digital advertising platform focusing on both gaming and general (nongaming) content.

In recent years Azerion Group has expanded along the user engagement value chain to become a full stack provider of online digital advertising services, connecting advertisers with audiences through digital content (owned and third party) providers globally. The Group is involved in the provision of content-driven technology and data, serving consumers, advertisers, digital publishers, and game creators globally.

Our mission is to be the go-to-partner for advertisers for an easy to-use, competitively priced, brand-safe digital environment.

We are headquartered in Amsterdam and we have more than 1100 talented people of 55 nationalities working in 24 offices around Europe, with very diverse and multi-ethnic backgrounds.

For our Business Intelligence team at Azerion Head Quarters in Amsterdam we are looking for an Intern Data Analyst.

Team

The Business Intelligence team is an international, growing team within Azerion, with the mission of providing useful and actionable insights to our gaming/advertising products.

From importing the data, to processing it, analyzing it and exposing it to the users, we cover the whole data flow. Huge volumes of data, multiple sources and different analysis techniques are their own bread and butter.

We all are data enthusiasts with passion for our work, if thatâ€™s your dream job too, this is your chance!

What you will be doing and learning

The Data Analyst intern will work with gaming/advertising related data, with the main goal of deriving useful insights in order to enhance our products portfolio performance.

He/she will be collaborating with the other Data Analysts and with the Product Owners of the different products in the Azerion portfolio. No matter if itâ€™s a casual or social game, mobile or desktop advertisement, there is always something hidden to find in our data.

Every day there is always a chance to learn something new while having fun!

Your Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To


Understanding stakeholderâ€™s requirements and translating them into actionable reports/analysis
Communicating with live operations team / POs in order to assist them in making data driven decisions and adjusting their product update and promotion strategy
Taking an active role in the daily operations, responding to report performance and delivery issues
Developing both regular and ad-hoc reports
Maintaining, troubleshooting, and resolving issues/questions for report inventory
Supporting report environment best practices, coding standards, and look-and-feel
...and most important...having fun with data!


What you are able to bring to the table


Passion for the gaming/advertising industry
Passion for data
Strong analytical thinking and ability to solve problems
Proactive self-learner, able to adapt quickly to new technologies and solutions
Team and independent worker
Ability to work in a fast paced and active environment with evolving priorities
Ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences


What We Offer You


The opportunity to work and learn at an innovative, high-paced company located near Amsterdam
An informal yet professional international working environment
Room for personal development in a highly skilled and motivated team
Hybrid work
Internship fee of â‚¬400,- per month
Lunch is provided for free
Weekly optional workout programs like kick boxing


Does this sound like that great internship youâ€™re looking for?

Apply by clicking the apply button, fill in the online form and attach your CV.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at

recruitment@azerion.com

Hereâ€™s what happens after you send your application

Youâ€™ll receive an email confirming our hiring department has received your application. An update will follow as to what the next stage will be for you.
