people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of todayâ€™s technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. We call this human forward.

Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com


If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our recruitment business partner: jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk


The recruitment procedure consists of a screening and at least two interviews. Later in the process, an (online) assessment and a job offer conversation take place.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Bij Astek Nederland werk je als Data Analist midden in de digitale transformatie van onze klanten. Jij zorgt ervoor dat strategische en operationele beslissingen worden genomen op basis van feiten. Niet alleen door dashboards te bouwen, maar door Ã©cht te begrijpen wat er speelt in de organisatie â€“ en daar slimme, schaalbare inzichten op los te laten.




Wat ga je doen?

In deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het omzetten van data in waardevolle inzichten. Jij speelt een centrale rol in het creÃ«ren van een continue feedbackloop waarmee strategieÃ«n en producten doorlopend verbeterd worden.




Je houdt je onder andere bezig met:

â–ª Vertalen van businessvragen naar data-analyses en meetbare KPIâ€™s

â–ª Ondersteunen van productontwikkeling met datagedreven inzichten

â–ª Verzamelen, modelleren en visualiseren van data (Power BI vereist)

â–ª Data valideren en datakwaliteit monitoren, samen met de data engineers

â–ª Presenteren van analyses aan stakeholders op verschillende niveaus

â–ª Bewaken van dataprivacy en compliance

â–ª Proactief bijdragen aan verbeterinitiatieven en incidentanalyse




Wat breng jij mee?

â–ª 3â€“5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist in een agile/IT-omgeving

â–ª Ervaring met Power BI is een must, SQL is een mooie prÃ©

â–ª Communicatief sterk, nieuwsgierig, en resultaatgericht

â–ª Je weet complexe materie begrijpelijk te maken voor elk type stakeholder

Astek Nederland (voorheen Immune-IT) is dÃ© IT-detacheerder waar expertise, groei en persoonlijke aandacht samenkomen. Sinds 2021 zijn we officieel onderdeel van de internationale Astek Group, waar we de kracht van een wereldwijd netwerk combineren met een persoonlijke en betrokken aanpak.




Wij richten ons op diverse IT-professionals, waaronder testers, developers, (Data/DevOps) engineers, data scientists, scrummasters en business analisten. Ons doel is om jou te verbinden met uitdagende opdrachten bij toonaangevende opdrachtgevers in heel Nederland.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:




At Rainforest Alliance, we believe in the value of data. The Data Management and Intelligence department is paving the way for enabling data-driven decisions by focusing on the delivery of scalable data products, supporting internal decision-making, unlocking the value of data, and creating a solid data foundation on which we can continue to build our data offering.




We are looking for a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our team and contribute to the development of data-as-a-product solutions. In this role, you will be responsible for creating compelling dashboards and reports, designing reliable data models, and analyzing complex datasets to uncover insights that drive business strategies. You will collaborate with a variety of internal and external stakeholders to understand their data needs, ensuring that the data products meet those requirements and deliver real value.




This position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to impactful projects and grow in a collaborative, data-driven environment.




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Data Visualization & Reporting: Create compelling and easy-to-understand dashboards, reports, and visualizations using BI tools like Tableau or Power BI to effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.
Data Modelling: Design and build scalable and reliable data models. Collaborate with the Data Engineering team to meet data requirements and ensure optimal model performance. Leverage best practices to deliver self-service solutions while maintaining flexibility for future enhancements.
Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to understand their needs, gather data requirements, and provide actionable insights that address business challenges. Collaborate with Data Engineering, Architecture, GIS, and Product teams to ensure analytics efforts align with the organization's broader data strategies.
Data Analysis & Insights: Analyse large and complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform business strategies and operations.
Ensure data quality by proactively identifying, analysing, and addressing inconsistencies, anomalies, or inaccuracies within datasets. Collaborate with Data Engineering and business teams to investigate root causes.
Continuous Learning & Improvement: Stay updated on the latest tools, techniques, and trends in data analysis. Apply innovative methods to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of analytics initiatives.
Communication: Effectively present analytical findings to diverse audiences through presentations, workshops, and training sessions. Support teams in building data literacy and understanding analytics tools and insights. Regularly deliver presentations to non-technical audiences, both within and outside the organisation.




QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelorâ€™s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Ability to work independently, take ownership of projects, and ensure timely delivery.
2+ years of experience in data analysis or a related role.
Proficiency in tools such as SQL, Python, R, and BI platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an ability to work with complex datasets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate technical insights for non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with data governance principles and data privacy regulations.




Preferred Skills:

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Exposure to machine learning concepts and their applications.
Knowledge of global commodity supply chains and sustainability practices.
Experience working with voluntary standards in agriculture or forestry.




Job Level: 4




Salary: Commensurate with experience




Deadline: 02 May 2025




Notes: Only candidates authorized to work in the Netherlands will be considered.




If you have any questions about the job vacancy, please contact the HR department: recruitment@ra.org




The Rainforest Alliance encourages diversity and inclusion across the global organization. With this commitment to diversity, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, color, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ages, disability and any other protected group.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ben jij een gedreven Data Analist met een passie voor de financiÃ«le wereld die graag de cruciale rol heeft in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar het worden van meer data-driven? Wil je impact hebben door data te vertalen naar waardevolle inzichten en besluitvorming? Dan is deze rol als Data Analist binnen onze organisatie iets voor jou!




Data Analist




Als Data Analist speel je een cruciale rol in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar data-gedreven organisaties. Je identificeert de informatiebehoeften van de business en vertaalt deze naar relevante data-oplossingen. Met jouw technische expertise verzamel en analyseer je data en zet je deze om in waardevolle inzichten.

In jouw rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het integreren van klantdata met andere databronnen en het omzetten van deze gegevens in actionable insights. Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert zowel nieuwe als bestaande dashboards die onze opdrachtgevers ondersteunen. Hierbij identificeer je nieuwe databronnen, valideer je de verzamelde data en presenteer je deze op een overzichtelijke manier. Dankzij jouw analyses en inzichten kunnen onze opdrachtgevers hun proposities en processen verder verbeteren.

Je werkt nauw samen met je eigen team en diverse teams bij onze opdrachtgevers, waarbij je hen ondersteunt en adviseert op zowel tactisch als strategisch niveau.




Wat bieden we jou?




Jouw gedrevenheid binnen Novisource wordt beloond. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij je kunt blijven ontwikkelen en kunt doorgroeien. Jij bent daarin altijd in de lead! Naast vakinhoudelijke opleidingen bieden wij ook cursussen en trainingen op het gebied van diverse methodieken en vaardigheden aan. Daarnaast:

Een salarisrange van â‚¬ 4.500,- tot â‚¬ 6.500,- bruto per maand (afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring) en een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling
Een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget
Laptop, vaste onkostenvergoeding en telefoonvergoeding
Direct een vast dienstverband
Leaseauto of reiskostenvergoeding
Verbinding is Ã©Ã©n van onze kernwaarden, we investeren dus gedurende het hele jaar in inhoudelijke, inspirerende en vooral leuke events
Een hybride werk cultuur. We vinden elkaar zeker op ons gezellige kantoor in Amsterdam (vlakbij station Bijlmer Arena), maar stimuleren eigen verantwoordelijkheid en flexibiliteit




Wat neem je mee?




Je bent nieuwsgierig van aard, denkt graag in oplossingen en bent resultaat gedreven. Uiteraard heb je een goed ontwikkeld organisatiebewustzijn en daarnaast neem jij onderstaande mee:

HBO/WO gediplomeerd
Minimaal 4 jaar ervaring binnen de financiÃ«le dienstverlening op het gebied van data
Je hebt een sterk analytisch denkvermogen en bent communicatief vaardig
Je hebt eerder gewerkt in een Scrum/Agile omgeving (sterke prÃ©)
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift
Aantoonbare ervaring met de financiÃ«le sector
Ervaring met het werken binnen multidisciplinaire teams




Over Novisource

Novisource is een kleinschalige, ambitieuze en persoonlijke consultancy-organisatie. We bemiddelen intelligente, gedreven en gepassioneerde consultants die meebouwen aan de (digitale) verandering van morgen. Vooralsnog met name in de financiÃ«le sector, maar we werken hard aan uitbreiding van onze klantenportefeuille. We geloven dat onze expertises ook in andere sectoren hard nodig zijn en willen zo meer diversiteit bieden aan onze consultants wat betreft werkomgeving en opdrachten.

Daarnaast zitten we als organisatie zelf ook in een veranderproces, waarin we professionaliseren om de volgende stap te kunnen zetten in kwaliteit, zowel richting onze mensen als richting onze klanten. Houd je van ondernemen, meebouwen, de dynamiek die hoort bij groei en van direct verschil en resultaat zien van het werk dat je doet?

Dan is deze rol geknipt voor jou.

Title: BI Data Analist
HTML:
Milgro is hÃ©t technologiebedrijf voor het managen van natuurlijk kapitaal. Wij stellen organisaties in staat een duurzame omgang met grondstoffen op winstgevende wijze in hun bedrijfsvoering te integreren. Daarmee versnellen wij â€˜het nieuwe normaalâ€™ van een circulaire economie.


Wat ga je doen?

Thuis of op kantoor, als Data & Technology team starten wij de werkdag met een stand-up volgens de scrum-methodiek. Je praat je collegaâ€™s bij over de producten waar je gisteren aan gewerkt hebt, wat je prioriteiten voor vandaag zijn en wat nog niet helemaal is gelukt. Met als doel om tijdens de tweewekelijkse â€˜sprintâ€™ gezamenlijk iets moois op te kunnen leveren.

Als BI analist heb je een afwisselende baan; van het omzetten van data in begrijpelijke informatie, tot het in gesprek zijn met collegaâ€™s van andere afdelingen over een idee dat net is gepitcht en waarvoor een impactanalyse nodig is. Van het analyseren in SQL tot het visualiseren van data in Power BI.


  • Je zorgt voor het ophalen, controleren en verwerken van data. Vervolgens zet je deze om in begrijpelijke informatie en geeft hierover advies;
  • Je maakt rapportages en dashboards die naadloos aansluiten op de behoefte van de eindgebruiker, reken houdend met een gebruiksvriendelijke UI/UX;
  • Je geeft de Product Owner en de rest van product team advies over de beste oplossingen tijdens de discovery fase van een product ontwikkeling;
  • Het onderbouwen van bedrijfsprocessen aan de hand van statistieken, om daarna te helpen met het optimaliseren van deze processen;
  • Het trainen van de superusers en gebruikers in het gebruik van Power BI;
  • Actieve samenwerking met andere afdelingen voor een effectieve productontwikkeling;
  • Beheren van de enterprise rapportages en dashboards in Power BI;
  • Het uitvoeren van impactanalyse bij wijzigingen.


De ideale kandidaat

Is iemand die data-minded en analytisch goed onderbouwd is en energie haalt uit de samenwerking met collegaâ€™s van verschillende afdelingen en zich kan verplaatsen in de behoefte van de eindgebruiker. Daarnaast beschik je over:

  • kennis van Power BI en SQL ;
  • kennis van DAX measures;
  • kennis van data modellen volgens de Kimball standaard;
  • minimaal over HBO werk- en denkniveau met bij voorkeur een bedrijfskundige achtergrond. Ervaring in een data-analyse omgeving is een prÃ©;
  • Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift;
  • Krijgt energie van agile-scrum werken.


Wat kan je van ons verwachten?

  • Een uitdagende baan waarbij je werkzaam bent in ons inspirerende kantoor in Rotterdam.
  • Hybride werken: een goede balans tussen thuis en op kantoor werken.
  • Professionele en leuke collegaâ€™s.
  • Een prettige informele werksfeer.
  • De kans om je op persoonlijk en professioneel vlak te ontwikkelen.
  • Aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden.


Wie is Milgro?

Milgro is hÃ©t technologiebedrijf voor het managen van natuurlijk kapitaal. Wij stellen organisaties in staat een duurzame omgang met grondstoffen op winstgevende wijze in hun bedrijfsvoering te integreren. Daarmee versnellen wij â€˜het nieuwe normaalâ€™ van een circulaire economie.


Milgro is een ambitieuze organisatie waarin technologie, ondernemerschap, innovatie en maatschappelijke relevantie samenkomen. Werken bij Milgro betekent veel uitdaging en afwisseling in je werkzaamheden.


Ja, ik wil deze baan bij Milgro!

Leuk dat je enthousiast bent geworden! We zien je sollicitatie graag tegemoet. Stuur jouw CV en motivatiebrief naar onze HR-Officer Simone Hogeweij via werkenbij@milgro.nl.


In de bepaling of wij wel of geen match zien, wordt onze keuze uitsluitend gebaseerd op jouw kennis, ervaring en jouw eventuele motivatie voor Milgro en de functie. Afkomst, sekse, seksuele oriÃ«ntatie, religie of geloofsovertuiging, leeftijd, beperkingen, sociaal-economische status, gezinsstatus en/of andere persoonlijke kenmerken spelen geen rol in onze besluitvorming.


We komen graag zelf in contact met onze nieuwe collega. Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Over The Member Company







We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:







About this vacancy




As a Data Analyst at TMC Data Science, you will transform raw data into actionable insights that guide strategic decision-making. You will create dashboards and visualizations that simplify complex data and support innovation through trend analysis and forecasting.







Key Responsibiliies




Analyze data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities.
Develop intuitive dashboards and reports for stakeholders.
Conduct trend analysis and create predictive models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business.
Present findings in a clear and impactful manner.




hat we expect from you?

Bachelorâ€™s or Msc degree in Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related fields.
3-5 years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence.
Proficiency in visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Strong analytical and communication skills.
Knowledge of the high-tech industry is a plus.




What you can expect you

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.




At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.




As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.

Over The Member Company



We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:



About this vacancy


As a Data Analyst at TMC Data Science, you will transform raw data into actionable insights that guide strategic decision-making. You will create dashboards and visualizations that simplify complex data and support innovation through trend analysis and forecasting.



Key Responsibiliies


  • Analyze data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities.
  • Develop intuitive dashboards and reports for stakeholders.

hat we expect from you?

Title: Data Analyst InternÂ
Description:
Azerion

Azerion was founded in 2013 and is a technology company providing digital advertising and online gaming services headquartered in the Netherlands. Azerion operates a proprietary digital advertising platform focusing on both gaming and general (nongaming) content.

In recent years Azerion Group has expanded along the user engagement value chain to become a full stack provider of online digital advertising services, connecting advertisers with audiences through digital content (owned and third party) providers globally. The Group is involved in the provision of content-driven technology and data, serving consumers, advertisers, digital publishers, and game creators globally.

Our mission is to be the go-to-partner for advertisers for an easy to-use, competitively priced, brand-safe digital environment.

We are headquartered in Amsterdam and we have more than 1100 talented people of 55 nationalities working in 24 offices around Europe, with very diverse and multi-ethnic backgrounds.

For our Business Intelligence team at Azerion Head Quarters in Amsterdam we are looking for an Intern Data Analyst.

Team

The Business Intelligence team is an international, growing team within Azerion, with the mission of providing useful and actionable insights to our gaming/advertising products.

From importing the data, to processing it, analyzing it and exposing it to the users, we cover the whole data flow. Huge volumes of data, multiple sources and different analysis techniques are their own bread and butter.

We all are data enthusiasts with passion for our work, if thatâ€™s your dream job too, this is your chance!

What you will be doing and learning

The Data Analyst intern will work with gaming/advertising related data, with the main goal of deriving useful insights in order to enhance our products portfolio performance.

He/she will be collaborating with the other Data Analysts and with the Product Owners of the different products in the Azerion portfolio. No matter if itâ€™s a casual or social game, mobile or desktop advertisement, there is always something hidden to find in our data.

Every day there is always a chance to learn something new while having fun!

Your Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To


Understanding stakeholderâ€™s requirements and translating them into actionable reports/analysis
Communicating with live operations team / POs in order to assist them in making data driven decisions and adjusting their product update and promotion strategy
Taking an active role in the daily operations, responding to report performance and delivery issues
Developing both regular and ad-hoc reports
Maintaining, troubleshooting, and resolving issues/questions for report inventory
Supporting report environment best practices, coding standards, and look-and-feel
...and most important...having fun with data!


What you are able to bring to the table


Passion for the gaming/advertising industry
Passion for data
Strong analytical thinking and ability to solve problems
Proactive self-learner, able to adapt quickly to new technologies and solutions
Team and independent worker
Ability to work in a fast paced and active environment with evolving priorities
Ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences


What We Offer You


The opportunity to work and learn at an innovative, high-paced company located near Amsterdam
An informal yet professional international working environment
Room for personal development in a highly skilled and motivated team
Hybrid work
Internship fee of â‚¬400,- per month
Lunch is provided for free
Weekly optional workout programs like kick boxing


Does this sound like that great internship youâ€™re looking for?

Apply by clicking the apply button, fill in the online form and attach your CV.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at

recruitment@azerion.com

Hereâ€™s what happens after you send your application

Youâ€™ll receive an email confirming our hiring department has received your application. An update will follow as to what the next stage will be for you.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Who we are




The commodity world is complexâ€”it is fast-moving but traditional. These everyday products, from your morning coffee to the grains in your pasta, play a critical role in the global economy and in our daily lives.




Vesper is disrupting the commodity game. We are the fastest-growing commodity intelligence platform, trusted by giants like NestlÃ©, Unilever, and Danone. We combine cutting-edge AI with real-world data to give our customers the insights they need to win in a volatile market.




What we expect from this role




As our Business Intelligence Analyst, your mission is to derive actionable insights and opportunities from our internal data. There is an emphasis on product and usage behavior, but also financial and commercial data play an important role. You will help us build a smarter, faster business by providing data-informed answers to key questions like â€œHow can we improve our retention?â€ or â€œWhat is our churn risk from certain customer segments?â€.




You will partner closely with other teams and play an important role by building automated data pipelines, creating actionable insights while also enabling self-serve analytics to support our strategic and business decision-making.




We are looking for somebody who loves getting â€œinto the dataâ€, improving data-driven decision-making processes, translating business questions into BI solutions, applying analytics rigour to strategic questions and collaborating effectively with others.




If you like to jump on a high-speed train, enjoy all the learnings that come from a rapidly changing environment, get energy from having autonomy and enjoy an environment where decisions are made in a minute, this role might be for you!




What you will be doing




Generate accurate and reliable data insights: break down business problems and turn raw data into actionable insights around user behavior (e.g. customer retention, cost-usage analysis)
Enable data-informed decision making: empower all departments and management to make data-driven decisions by providing relevant automated dashboards, tailor-made insights or self-serve analytics where needed
Build and maintain data infrastructure: develop and optimize ETL pipelines to consolidate data from various raw data sources and integrate them into a unified database
Secure data reliability: ensure data is consistent, accurate and trustworthy â€“ from collection to reporting

What you will bring




2-4 years experience in a role in Business Intelligence, Analytics, or a related field â€“ ideally with previous experience in a fast-paced environment (scale-up, tech or product-driven organisation)
Strong analytical and problem solving skills â€“ you break down complex problems using data and can translate ambiguous business questions into measurable insights
Solid technical foundation â€” you have proven skills in SQL and Python and are comfortable with data modeling, setting up and managing ETL processes, and database design (ideally with previous experience with Airflow)
Solid stakeholder management skills â€“ you love to say â€œyesâ€, but definitely know when to say â€œnoâ€. You keep everyone in the loop and can create a shared understanding across the team
Excellent communication skills â€” you speak both â€œdataâ€ and â€œhumanâ€ and can work with technical peers and non-technical stakeholders
Business intuition â€” you understand how different parts of the business connect and how to prioritize what matters most
Autonomy & initiative â€“ you donâ€™t wait to be told what to do. You seek out problems, validate assumptions and propose solutions
An eye for detail â€” you take pride in clean, accurate data and high-quality wor
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Business Analytics)




What you get




A fast-moving, high-growth environment with plenty of opportunity to learn
Full ownership of your domain, and the trust to shape your role
A collaborative culture that values speed, clarity, and impact
A chance to transform a traditional business impacting every day of our lives
A fantastic location in the city centre of Amsterdam
Great hangouts with brilliant people

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Location: Amsterdam (Hybrid, 2 days a week in the office)
Rate: â‚¬84 per hour
Duration: 6 months initial (possible extensions)




About the Role

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Experience Measurement team. This role is pivotal in supporting data migration efforts and enhancing analyses and dashboards related to key partner and traveler surveys. These surveys are integral to strategic research initiatives that inform decisions across Leadership, Product, and Strategy departments.




Key Responsibilities

Data Management: Handle large-scale data assets, ensuring data quality and stability.
Visualization: Develop and maintain key visualizations of survey data using Tableau, optimizing performance and integrating with Snowflake.
Workflow Optimization: Create and manage workflows to support scalable dashboard creation.
Statistical Analysis: Apply basic statistical models for descriptive analytics.
Collaboration: Work closely with peers and stakeholders, providing and receiving constructive feedback.
Innovation: Identify and propose new technical approaches and improvements.
Data Governance: Support processes such as data classification and asset creation.
Integration: Design workflows that connect various data sources, including experiment data, survey data, and behavioral events.




Required Skills

Proficiency in Tableau and data visualization techniques.
Experience with Airflow for workflow management.
Strong expertise in SQL and Python.
Familiarity with big data ecosystems.
Knowledge of GitLab for version control.
Understanding of survey data complexities, particularly for Tableau visualization.
Experience with Qualtrics and experimentation methodologies.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Openness to feedback and a strong team player mentality.




Apply today for immediate consideration!

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Voor een vooruitstrevende organisatie in de energiemarkt in Maastricht ben ik namelijk op zoek naar een BI Specialist met gevoel voor data Ã©n impact.


Je komt terecht in een hechte, energieke werkomgeving waar duurzaamheid, innovatie en persoonlijke groei centraal staan. De organisatie is al jaren actief in dynamische energieprijzen en werkt met een jong team aan slimme oplossingen voor de zakelijke markt. Denk: geen logge processen, maar korte lijnen, veel vrijheid en Ã©cht iets bijdragen.


Wat deze rol extra interessant maakt:

  • Je haalt de informatiebehoefte direct op bij de business;
  • Je stuurt data engineers aan om de juiste datasets beschikbaar te krijgen;
  • Je bent dus in de lead: communicatieve skills zijn erg belangrijk;
  • Je vertaalt data naar heldere, strategisch relevante dashboards en rapportages;
  • Je bespreekt inzichten met interne stakeholders en adviseert op basis van jouw analyses.


Wat je kunt verwachten:

  • Salaris tot â‚¬ 6.000 p/m (fulltime) + 34 vrije dagen + vitaliteitsbudget;
  • Ruimte voor thuiswerken en goede vergoedingen (OV, km, thuiswerk);
  • Moderne, informele cultuur met focus op groei en duurzaamheid;
  • Werken in een team dat graag samen vooruit wil, zonder egoâ€™s.


Ben je benieuwd of dit iets voor je is?

Laat het me even weten, dan vertel ik je er vrijblijvend en discreet wat meer over.

Title: Data Strategist
Description:
About TCS

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is a global leader in IT services, digital, and business solutions that partners with its clients to simplify, strengthen, and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise, and a global network of innovation and delivery centers.




TCS operates on a global scale & has over 6,08,985 of the worldâ€™s best-trained consultants representing 152 nationalities in 53 countries. TCS established its presence in the Netherlands in 1992 and works with leading Dutch Customers across industry sectors, including several NL20 companies. TCS has been ranked #1 in customer satisfaction, among IT services providers in the Netherlands in a survey by Whitelane Research and is recognized as a Top Employer in the Netherlands, Europe & also Global by the Top Employers Institute




For more information, visit www.tcs.com




Role description

A Data Strategist is responsible for defining, implementing, and driving the data strategy across the organization to enable data-driven decision-making. This role bridges the gap between business objectives and data initiatives, ensuring that data assets are leveraged effectively to achieve business goals. The Data Strategist works closely with executives, business leaders, data engineers, and analysts to create actionable insights, optimize data management processes, and build a culture of data literacy within the organization.




Responsibilities:

Data Strategy Development:

Lead the development and execution of the organizationâ€™s data strategy, aligning data initiatives with overall business goals and objectives.
Define long-term data strategies, including data collection, management, analysis, and usage, ensuring alignment with corporate priorities.
Identify key opportunities to leverage data as a strategic asset across the business.
Develop and maintain a roadmap for data initiatives that integrates various departments' needs (e.g., marketing, finance, operations, etc.).




Data Governance and Quality Management:

Establish and enforce data governance frameworks to ensure data quality, consistency, and compliance across the organization.
Define best practices for data collection, storage, access, and utilization to ensure data integrity.
Work with IT, data engineering, and other teams to ensure data privacy and security standards are followed, meeting compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Oversee the implementation of data management policies and procedures that promote transparency, trust, and accountability in the organizationâ€™s data usage.




Collaboration with Business Leaders:

Serve as the primary point of contact for all data-related initiatives across business functions.
Work with business stakeholders to understand their data needs, translate those into actionable data strategies, and ensure data solutions are aligned with business objectives.
Translate complex data issues into clear, actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders, enabling informed decision-making at all levels of the organization.
Work closely with leadership teams to ensure data strategies support long-term business growth and innovation.




Data Analytics and Insights:

Provide guidance on data analytics best practices and methodologies, enabling teams to extract actionable insights from data.
Ensure that business teams are utilizing data effectively for operational, tactical, and strategic decision-making.
Champion data-driven decision-making across the organization by identifying key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics that align with business priorities.
Leverage advanced analytics, including predictive models and data visualizations, to help guide business decisions and strategies.




Data Infrastructure and Tools:

Collaborate with data engineering and IT teams to ensure that the organization has the right tools, platforms, and technologies for collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data.
Identify gaps in data infrastructure and recommend improvements or new technologies to enhance data capabilities.
Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in data analytics tools and technologies, and drive the adoption of relevant tools to improve data workflows.




Performance Monitoring and Reporting:

Track and monitor the effectiveness of data strategies, ensuring data initiatives deliver measurable business value.
Design and implement reporting systems and dashboards to track key business metrics and performance indicators.
Provide regular reports to executive leadership and key stakeholders, summarizing data trends, insights, and the impact of data initiatives on business performance.




Training and Data Literacy:

Foster a data-driven culture by promoting data literacy across the organization.
Lead training initiatives to increase understanding and effective use of data across departments.
Create and implement programs to help teams at all levels develop their data skills, from basic data interpretation to advanced analytics.




Data Innovation and Continuous Improvement:

Explore and experiment with emerging data technologies, techniques, and methodologies to continuously improve data processes and strategies.
Drive innovation within the organization by exploring new ways to leverage data for competitive advantage.
Ensure that data practices are continuously evolving and adapting to industry trends, new challenges, and the evolving business environment.




Skills and Qualifications:

Educational Background:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Information Management, or a related field (Masterâ€™s degree preferred).




Technical Skills

Proven experience with data analytics, data management, and business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Strong knowledge of data modeling, data architecture, and data governance frameworks.
Familiarity with data processing frameworks, such as SQL, Python, R, or other programming languages used for data manipulation and analysis.
Experience with data management platforms (e.g., Hadoop, AWS, Google Cloud Platform, or Azure).
Knowledge of data security and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Strong ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
Proven experience in identifying and developing KPIs and metrics that drive business performance.
Ability to apply advanced statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, or predictive analytics models to solve complex business problems (preferred but not required).




Soft Skills:

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience presenting executive leadership and guiding strategic decision-making.
The ability to translate business problems into data-driven solutions that are both practical and impactful.
Strong leadership and project management skills, with the ability to drive data initiatives across multiple teams.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including business leaders, data engineers, data scientists, and IT professionals.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.
Ability to think strategically about how data can be used to meet business goals and drive organizational change.
Experience in developing and implementing long-term data strategies that support business transformation.




Experience:

Experience with advanced analytics, such as machine learning, AI, or automation in a business context.
Experience working with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and big data solutions.
Familiarity with agile methodologies and how they can be applied to data strategy initiatives




Work Environment:

Collaborative and fast-paced work environment.
Opportunity to work with state-of-the-art technologies.
Supportive and dynamic team culture




Privacy Notice

Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer. We truly believe that employing a diverse workforce is pivotal to our success. Please note, recruiting decisions are always based on applicantâ€™s skills, competencies & experience and potential fitment to the available role

  • Design and implement reporting systems and dashboards to track key business metrics and performance indicators.
  • Provide regular reports to executive leadership and key stakeholders, summarizing data trends, insights, and the impact of data initiatives on business performance.


Training and Data Literacy:

  • Foster a data-driven culture by promoting data literacy across the organization.
  • Lead training initiatives to increase understanding and effective use of data across departments.
  • Create and implement programs to help teams at all levels develop their data skills, from basic data interpretation to advanced analytics.


Data Innovation and Continuous Improvement:

  • Explore and experiment with emerging data technologies, techniques, and methodologies to continuously improve data processes and strategies.
  • Drive innovation within the organization by exploring new ways to leverage data for competitive advantage.
  • Ensure that data practices are continuously evolving and adapting to industry trends, new challenges, and the evolving business environment.


Skills and Qualifications:

Educational Background:

  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Information Management, or a related field (Masterâ€™s degree preferred).


Technical Skills

  • Proven experience with data analytics, data management, and business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
  • Strong knowledge of data modeling, data architecture, and data governance frameworks.
  • Familiarity with data processing frameworks, such as SQL, Python, R, or other programming languages used for data manipulation and analysis.
  • Experience with data management platforms (e.g., Hadoop, AWS, Google Cloud Platform, or Azure).
  • Knowledge of data security and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
  • Strong ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
  • Proven experience in identifying and developing KPIs and metrics that drive business performance.
  • Ability to apply advanced statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, or predictive analytics models to solve complex business problems (preferred but not required).


Soft Skills:

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience presenting executive leadership and guiding strategic decision-making.
  • The ability to translate business problems into data-driven solutions that are both practical and impactful.
  • Strong leadership and project management skills, with the ability to drive data initiatives across multiple teams.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including business leaders, data engineers, data scientists, and IT professionals.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.
  • Ability to think strategically about how data can be used to meet business goals and drive organizational change.
  • Experience in developing and implementing long-term data strategies that support business transformation.


Experience:

  • Experience with advanced analytics, such as machine learning, AI, or automation in a business context.
  • Experience working with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and big data solutions.
  • Familiarity with agile methodologies and how they can be applied to data strategy initiatives


Work Environment:

  • Collaborative and fast-paced work environment.
  • Opportunity to work with state-of-the-art technologies.
  • Supportive and dynamic team culture


Privacy Notice

Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice


Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer. We truly believe that employing a diverse workforce is pivotal to our success. Please note, recruiting decisions are always based on applicantâ€™s skills, competencies & experience and potential fitment to the available role

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about bridging the gap between business needs and IT data solutions? Do you enjoy translating business needs into actionable insights through tools in BI and reporting? Are you excited about joining a new, innovative role in an international environment where your advice will drive impactful change?

We are expanding our Data team! In this exciting new role, you will play a key part in driving value for our organization by acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions, specializing in the Business Intelligence (BI) and Reporting domain. This is a unique opportunity to shape your role, taking on significant responsibility and making a direct impact on the business. You will advise and implement strong technical solutions, contributing to the growth and success of the organization.

What makes this role even more exciting is the diversity of your stakeholders: ranging from headquarters to regional teams and local businesses. You will be involved in innovative projects, taking on new challenges that offer great opportunities for personal and professional growth.

We are looking for a talented new colleague to join us as our next:

Data Analyst

In this role you will be part of a talented and skilled data team. You will report to the Lead BI and EAI and collaborate closely with various stakeholders across our dynamic and growing company.

The tasks and responsibilities are:


Collaboration with business stakeholders for the definition and establishment of KPIs, metrics, and analytical requirements.
Translation of complex data requirements into clear, actionable recommendations for the business.
Coordination with Data Engineering teams for smooth workflow and data integration.
Design and development of automated reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Analysis of large datasets for the identification of trends, patterns, and insights for decision-making.
Assurance of data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all reports.
Streamlining of processes for data collection and reporting.
Training and support for teams in the use of reports and dashboards.
Presentation of findings and insights to senior management and stakeholders.



About You


We are looking for a data wizard with strong business and people skills with the following background and experience:
You have at least a Bachelor degree in IT, Data science or a related field.
At least 4 years of working experience in a Data/Business Analyst or similar role.
Strong proficiency and interest in SQL & Python for querying, data extraction, and analysis.
Expertise in data visualization and reporting tools, particularly Power BI.
Experience with Agile/Scrum teams and working with SAP ECC or SAP S4HANA is a plus.
Excellent proficiency in the English language, both spoken and written.
You are strong in â€˜translatingâ€™ technical data to non-technical teams and the other way around.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
You are data savvy, pragmatic and enjoy to work with different various and international stakeholders.



What We Offer


A competitive reward package, including bonus eligibility.
A collaborative, international, and commercial environment where you can make a meaningful impact.
Opportunities for continuous professional development and growth.
A dynamic team culture that values integrity, efficiency, and open communication.



We are the creator of drinks. We take great pride in creating world-class beverages, partnering with top retailers and brands across Europe, North America, and Australia to produce drinks that you love every day.

Do you want to see your drinks on every table? Do you want to join our exciting journey?

â€¯

Recruitment process

Are you interested in this open position, feel free to send your application!

In case of any questions with regards to the position, you may reach out to Yasimin Harput (Corporate Recruiter Group/HQ)

Phone: 010 440 5100

E-mail: yasimin.harput@refresco.com

Additionally: we have great pleasure in getting in touch with potential new employees directly. For this reason we are fully managing the search for this role in-house and will not be needing any external assistance (agencies e.g.).

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist
HTML:
Ben jij een Business Intelligence (BI) specialist met kennis van datapreparatie, SQL en Tableau en/of Power BI? Houd jij ervan om inzicht en overzicht te creÃ«ren? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!


Wat ga je doen?

Als BI specialist bij Ziengs en Scapino ondersteun je de organisatie bij het verwerken en structureren van data om tot waardevolle analyses en inzichten te kunnen komen. Dit betekent dat je zorgt dat we de juiste data uit de verschillende bronnen kunnen halen en dat deze data gestructureerd en eenduidig wordt opgeslagen in het datawarehouse. Belangrijk daarbij is de kwaliteit en consistentie van de data te waarborgen, zodat je de juiste dataverbindingen en -combinaties kunt maken om tot optimale dashboards en rapportages te komen. Je helpt de organisatie daarmee om nog meer data gedreven te kunnen werken.


Je werkt nauw samen met key-users van de afdelingen om complexe vraagstukken op te lossen en waardevolle inzichten te ontwikkelen die de interne sturing en besluitvorming ondersteunen. Je weet de vraag van de klant goed in kaart te brengen en stemt in het â€˜bouwâ€™ proces regelmatig af over de voortgang en ook achteraf zorg je voor de juiste kwantitatieve en kwalitatieve controle.

Naast het uitbreiden en onderhouden van de bestaande BI-omgeving, help je ook bij het (opnieuw) vormgeven en combineren van data afkomstig uit nieuw te implementeren systemen, waaronder een ERP, maar mogelijk ook de implementatie en migratie van nieuwe BI tools.


Waar kom je te werken?

Als BI specialist werk je voor twee bekende ketens in de retailmarkt. Ziengs en Scapino hebben beide een rijke historie. Het zijn oer-Hollandse familiebedrijven met een focus op Retail en in het bijzonder schoenen. Gezamenlijk hebben de formules meer dan 250 winkels in Nederland en behoren we tot de grotere retailers van Nederland. Ziengs en Scapino kenmerken zich door een ondernemende cultuur. Passie voor schoenen, vakmanschap en ondernemerschap zijn hierbij belangrijke kernwaarden.


De afdeling BI is verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, verwerken en analyseren van data, het ontwikkelen van rapportages en dashboards en het verbeteren van de datakwaliteit binnen de organisatie.


Je komt te werken op ons servicekantoor in Assen.


Wie ben jij?

Jij bent iemand die pragmatisch kan werken in een dynamische omgeving. Je staat stevig in je (Ziengs of Scapino) schoenen en bent gewend om te schakelen tussen diverse niveaus binnen de organisatie. Je hebt een passie voor data en informatie en daarnaast heb je:

  • HBO werk- en denkniveau;
  • Minimaal 2-3 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare functie, bij voorkeur in een Retail organisatie;
  • Uitstekende kennis van SQL en BI tools als Tableau en/of Power BI;
  • Kennis van Alteryx, ETL en (BI) Cloud technologie is een prÃ©;
  • Ervaring met het prepareren van data;
  • Een sterk analytisch en probleemoplossend vermogen;
  • Een resultaatgerichte, gestructureerde en pro-actieve werkhouding;
  • Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden waardoor jij o.a. als sparringpartner voor het management kan fungeren.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Markt conform salaris;
  • Personeelskorting;
  • 24 vakantiedagen op basis van een fulltime dienstverband;
  • De mogelijkheid om deel te nemen aan onze gezamenlijke lunches op kantoor;
  • Een actieve personeelsvereniging;
  • De mogelijkheid tot deelname aan ons fietsplan;
  • Een uitdagende en dynamische werkomgeving waarin je belangrijke impact hebt binnen twee organisaties op het gebied van informatievoorziening en data gedreven werken;
  • Een informele werksfeer waar jij jezelf kunt zijn.


Zullen we kennismaken?

Wil jij bijdragen aan een data gedreven organisatie en ben je klaar voor deze uitdagende rol als BI Specialist? Stuur dan je CV en korte toelichting via de button. We kijken ernaar uit om kennis met je te maken!


Nog vragen? Neem contact op met Maeva (Recruiter) via:

Mail: werken@scapino.nl / werken@ziengs.nl

Telefoon: 06 23 73 19 19 / 0592 379 353

Title: BI Specialist
Description:
Eurofiber Cloud Infra biedt toonaangevende cloud infrastructuurdiensten en maakt deel uit van de Eurofiber Group. Wij bieden slimme, open en toekomstbestendige cloud infrastructuuroplossingen aan bedrijven, overheden en non-profitorganisaties.





Vacatureomschrijving



BI Specialist



Wil jij impact maken met data en bijdragen aan strategische inzichten binnen onze organisatie? Ben jij analytisch, leergierig en klaar om je BI-skills verder te ontwikkelen? Dan zoeken wij jou!



Jouw rol



Als BI Specialist werk je aan het analyseren, structureren en visualiseren van data om onze teams te ondersteunen bij datagedreven beslissingen. Je helpt bij het opzetten en onderhouden van dashboards en rapportages en denkt mee over het verbeteren van onze data-infrastructuur. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende teams, zoals Sales, Operations en IT, en rapporteert aan de Business Controller.



Jouw verantwoordelijkheden



Inventariseren van de databehoeften bij business stakeholders en deze vertalen naar rapportages en dashboards.
Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van datamodellen in Power BI en andere BI-tools.
Ondersteunen bij de inrichting van ons Datawarehouse (DWH) in samenwerking met IT en Business Control.
Meedenken over de verdere automatisering van rapportages en processen.
Analyseren van data om inzichten te creÃ«ren die bijdragen aan betere strategische en operationele beslissingen.
Samenwerken met de business om data-driven werken verder te stimuleren.

WAAROM JE BIJ EUROFIBER CLOUD INFRA WILT WERKEN



Eurofiber Cloud Infra geeft je vertrouwen. Dat geeft je de vrijheid om zelf te bepalen hoe je je werk doet en samen met je collega's je doelen bereikt. Dat is onze leidraad. Jij zit in de driver's seat, dus hoe jij je persoonlijk en professioneel ontwikkelt is aan jou.



Als het gaat om het bereiken van je volledige potentieel, bieden we geen one-size-fits-all concept. We bieden je een hybride werkaanpak, waarbij we je de ondersteuning geven die je nodig hebt om uit te blinken.



Dit betekent:



Een salaris afgestemd op jouw talent, en een bonus;
Een gezonde work/life balance;
Actieve ontwikkeling van je vaardigheden en competenties door middel van verschillende opleidingsmogelijkheden;
29 vakantiedagen per jaar, op basis van een 40-urige werkweek.


Functie-eisen



Wat breng je mee?



HBO werk- en denkniveau, bij voorkeur in een relevante richting (bijv. Business Intelligence, Data Science, Informatica of Bedrijfskunde);
Enkele jaren ervaring opgedaan met BI-tools zoals Power BI (of vergelijkbare tools);
Kennis van SQL en datamodellering is een pre;
Affiniteit met de samenwerking tussen sales en operations;
Analytisch sterk, proactief en communicatief vaardig;
Interesse in data-analyse en de ambitie om verder te groeien binnen BI;
Ervaring met data-architectuur en governance is een plus, maar geen vereiste.


Aanvullende informatie



Over ons
Eurofiber Cloud Infra is een onderdeel van de Eurofiber groep en specialiseert zich op het gebied van cloud infrastructuur oplossingen en diensten zoals colocatie, connectiviteit, cloud, IaaS, Kubernetes en andere zaken. Wij helpen klanten met consultancy, implementatie en beheer van hun cloud infrastructuur en alle strategische keuzes die daarmee gepaard gaan. We werken met een sterk groeiend team van nu ongeveer 70 personen aan innovatieve cloudtechnologie voor klanten als Asics, TeamBlue, Meneba, verschillende gemeentes, andere overheidsinstellingen en financiÃ«le organisaties. Het team is multicultureel en bestaat uit enthousiaste professionals vol drive en ambitie. De cultuur is dynamisch en snel. Dit heeft geleid tot een innovatieve mindset en we blijven continu opzoek naar verbetering.




Klaar voor je volgende stap?
Iedereen heeft talent, en we zijn ervan overtuigd dat Eurofiber Cloud Infra een bedrijf is waar dat talent helemaal tot uiting kan komen. Heb jij interesse? Stuur dan jouw cv zo snel mogelijk.



Heb je nog vragen? Bel dan zeker naar (+31) 030-2428720.



DIVERSITEITSBELEID
Als motor van de digitale samenleving helpen we mensen hun potentieel ten volle te benutten. Bij Eurofiber Cloud Infra vormen waarden zoals diversiteit, gelijkwaardigheid en inclusie de kern van dat potentieel. Ons engagement op dat vlak is van cruciaal belang. We zijn ervan overtuigd dat verschillende standpunten binnen een team ons helpen om slimme oplossingen voor bedrijven, overheidsinstanties en non-profitorganisaties te ontwikkelen. Daarom willen we graag kennismaken met kandidaten die unieke vaardigheden, opinies en ideeÃ«n aan de dag leggen. Kandidaten die gewoon zichzelf zijn en kunnen samenwerken met en leren van anderen. Of je nu aan de slag gaat bij ons IT- of engineeringteam, we zijn altijd op zoek naar nieuwe collega's die onze kernwaarden hoog in het vaandel dragen en die elke dag opnieuw toepassen in hun werk.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
This is Worldline




Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.




The Opportunity




We're looking for a Business Analyst to provide insights across our multiple products, countries and large merchants. Youâ€™ll work within a freshly consolidated datalake in Azure in a growing international team. You will be able to make an immediate impact on our performance by transforming petabytes of data into clear, precise and relevant information.




Day-to-Day Responsibilitiesâ€‹




Working within a team of business analysts on weekly and monthly reporting in PowerBI
Writing SQL queries in Databricks to deliver various analyses
Helping identify anomalies in our performance and triggering conversations on potential fixes
Preparing visuals for compelling storytelling to various stakeholders across the organization
Simplifying some of our ways of working to ensure scalability




Who Are We Looking For




We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show whatâ€™s next â€“ people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:




You have an eye for detail
You have an appetite for tackling problems both big and small
You have a knack for following through
You are keen to share your findings with others support our growth
You've got substantial knowledge of Power BI and SQL
Bonus points for experience with Databricks and/or Salesforce
You can communicate effectively to a wide variety of audiences







Perks & Benefits




At Worldline youâ€™ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:

A rewarding salary
Opportunity to develop yourself in a rapidly growing and agile global organization.
Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career







Shape the evolution.




We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here youâ€™ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.







Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com







We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

We're looking for a Business Analyst to provide insights across our multiple products, countries and large merchants. Youâ€™ll work within a freshly consolidated datalake in Azure in a growing international team. You will be able to make an immediate impact on our performance by transforming petabytes of data into clear, precise and relevant information.


Day-to-Day Responsibilitiesâ€‹


  • Working within a team of business analysts on weekly and monthly reporting in PowerBI
  • Writing SQL queries in Databricks to deliver various analyses
  • Helping identify anomalies in our performance and triggering conversations on potential fixes
  • Preparing visuals for compelling storytelling to various stakeholders across the organization
  • Simplifying some of our ways of working to ensure scalability


Who Are We Looking For


We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show whatâ€™s next â€“ people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:


  • You have an eye for detail
  • You have an appetite for tackling problems both big and small
  • You have a knack for following through
  • You are keen to share your findings with others support our growth
  • You've got substantial knowledge of Power BI and SQL
  • Bonus points for experience with Databricks and/or Salesforce
  • You can communicate effectively to a wide variety of audiences



Perks & Benefits


At Worldline youâ€™ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:

  • A rewarding salary
  • Opportunity to develop yourself in a rapidly growing and agile global organization.
  • Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
  • Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career



Shape the evolution.


We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here youâ€™ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.



Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com



We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

Ervaring met het werken in complexe IT-omgevingen en de bereidheid om ook tijd te besteden aan operations in samenwerking met andere serviceteams




Wat wij geven

Title: Business Intelligence Analist
Description:
Business Intelligence Analist bij Nijhuis Saur Industries




Nijhuis Saur Industries is wereldwijd toonaangevend in innovatieve watertechnologieÃ«n. Wij ontwikkelen geavanceerde waterzuiveringssystemen en circulaire oplossingen voor industrieel waterbeheer. Met onze technologieÃ«n zuiveren, hergebruiken en optimaliseren we water voor milieuvriendelijke toepassingen.




Ben jij een ambitieuze professional met een passie voor data, technologie en wereldwijde impact? Houd je van een dynamische werkomgeving, los je graag complexe vraagstukken op en wil je een sleutelrol spelen in onze digitale transformatie? Dan is de functie van Business Intelligence Analist iets voor jou!




Wij geloven in groei en ontwikkeling. Dus ben jij ambitieus en klaar voor een volgende stap, maar voldoe je (nog) niet aan alle functie-eisen? Geen probleem! Je krijgt bij ons de kans om in te stromen als junior en jezelf te ontwikkelen naar een medior rol â€“ of zelfs door te groeien naar een andere functie. Met uitdagende projecten en volop leermogelijkheden helpen we je het maximale uit je talent te halen.

Wil jij bouwen aan de toekomst van data en technologie? Solliciteer nu en groei met ons mee!




Jouw rol

Als Business Intelligence Analist speel je een cruciale rol in de implementatie en optimalisatie van ons Workday-platform. Je leidt data-gedreven initiatieven, bewaakt de datakwaliteit en werkt samen met internationale stakeholders om een toekomstbestendig ecosysteem te creÃ«ren voor HR, IT, business en finance.




Wat ga je doen?

Een sleutelrol vervullen in de Workday-implementatie, samen met experts en lokale partners.
Verantwoordelijk zijn voor datamigratie, validatie en governance om de nauwkeurigheid te waarborgen.
De brug slaan tussen technologie en business door data te vertalen naar bruikbare inzichten.
Innovatie stimuleren, processen optimaliseren en het systeem continu verbeteren.

Dit ben jij

Jij maakt jezelf snel dingen eigen, kan snel schakelen en je bent gemotiveerd om Workday te implementeren (ervaring is een plus, maar nieuwsgierigheid is belangrijker!).
Beschikt over sterke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden en een passie voor data.
Je bent communicatief vaardig in het Engels (Nederlands is een plus) en weet effectief samen te werken met stakeholders op alle niveaus.
Je hebt interesse in internationale projecten en bent bereid om af en toe te reizen.

Wat wij bieden

Salarisrange voor deze functie is bij een 40-urige werkweek, afhankelijk van je professionele ervaring, ligt tussen de â‚¬3.563 en â‚¬ 5.000 bruto per maand.
Flexibiliteit: Start je werkdag tussen 07:00 en 09:00 uur.
Vrije dagen: 27 vakantiedagen + 7 ADV-dagen.
Goede reiskostenvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer.
CarriÃ¨regroei: Een impactvolle rol met echte verantwoordelijkheid en doorgroeimogelijkheden.
Innovatie en technologie: Werken in een internationale omgeving met de nieuwste systemen.
Training & ondersteuning: Word een Workday-expert met begeleiding van corporate leiders in HR, finance en IT.
Een dynamisch team waarin jouw ideeÃ«n Ã©cht tellen.
Secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals Benefits@work, keuzemodel arbeidsvoorwaarden en een sportkaart voor diverse sporten in de Achterhoek, Arnhem, Nijmegen en omgeving.

Klaar om impact te maken met data? Solliciteer nu en bouw mee aan de toekomst van Nijhuis Saur Industries!




Ben je een recruiter?

Graag willen we je vragen om ons niet te bellen of e-mailen, tenzij wij jou eerst hebben benaderd. Wij zijn van mening dat wij onze nieuwe collegaâ€™s zelf kunnen vinden, ondersteuning door bureaus is daarom ook niet gewenst. Profielen en cvâ€™s die ongevraagd door bureaus worden toegezonden, ook als deze direct naar de leidinggevende worden gestuurd, zullen worden behandeld als directe sollicitaties van de kandidaat zelf. Bedankt voor je begrip!

Join our #missionwater

Title: Analytics Expert
Description:
Are you our new colleague?

Weâ€™re looking for a Analytics Expert at Randstad Global

Diemen - Netherlands, hybrid, fulltime




BR&AF

The business risk and audit function (BR&AF) provides assurance and recommendations to the Executive Board and the Audit Committee on Randstad Groupâ€™s (risk) management, control and governance practices. Therefore the department facilitates in setting governance standards. It provides advice on internal control improvements, it conducts audits, special investigations and assignments worldwide on request of the Executive Board and Audit Committee. BR&AFâ€™s responsibility includes the quarterly reporting based on: the risk and internal control self assessments, audit results, discussions on internal control weaknesses and analysis of the key risks reported throughout the company's management structure. This also substantiates the Groupâ€™s in-control statements.




The global function consists of team members operating through hubs spread over 4 continents. The team is organized in a matrix consisting of control & audit focus teams on business and functional areas (e.g. digital, talent, client, back office & shared service centers and fraud & forensics) and partners that are the linking pin to operating units (business risk & audit partners) with a global view. A support group is set up for professional practice, learning & development, quality improvement & methods, analytics and PMO.




Representatives of the different groups (Focus teams, BR&A Partners and support group) form the BR&AF core management team that reports to the Managing Director BR&AF.




how you will contribute

You are part of the Business Risk & Audit Function (BR&AF) that covers all business operations related to Clients, Talents and our (shared) Back-, Mid- and Front offices, as well as our Accounting & Reporting and other specialist functions like HR. With your data analytics experience you enhance BR&AF's delivery to management bringing insight on Randstad's in-control situation.




As analytics expert you:

support building and rolling out the BR&AF analytics roadmap.
perform technical data analytics, including data visualization, data reports, data cleansing scripts, and data validation as part audits, risk management, internal controls support and combined assurance projects and activities.
assist in taking the audit projects in Randstad to the next level through researching and evaluating new analytics concepts and technologies (e.g. generative AI/machine learning) in support of BR&F practices.
collaborate as an integrated part of audits teams in the definition and execution of analytics.
support non analytics professionals within the function growing their capabilities enabling them to leverage analytics more effectively.
are willing to travel. As the standard office locations for the BR&AF team are organized in hubs, like in the country mentioned, travelling is estimated to be about 20% to 30% of the job.




what you will be doing

as co-creator support the analytics lead in the development and roll out the data analytics roadmap
lead the build out of the control structures to ensure sustainable analytics technology including data retention and clean up logic
participate in risk assessments, periodic sampling, and data-driven root cause analysis.
perform data analysis procedures, including data profiling, data mining, trend analysis, and predictive modeling. Apply statistical techniques and visualization tools to analyze large volumes of data and identify patterns, anomalies, and potential audit risks.
perform data collection, clean, analyze and report processes from various internal and external applications and databases, as well as other data sources when necessary.
interpret the results of data analysis and provide meaningful insights to audit teams and BR&AF management.
review and validate data analytics work performed by audit teams.
identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions as needed.
act as a resource for colleagues with less expertise.




who will you work with

business risk & audit partners
partners/communities within applications operations and data management both at randstad global as well as in our operating companies
external co-source partners
IT security, data protection, information security and business continuity communities within the Randstad organization.
BR&AF stakeholders/clients within the business including local MT's, process and control owners




what you will bring

You bring a hands-on and in depth understanding of data science and analytics concepts and structures combined with a drive to develop and roll out impactful analytics. With your drive for results you are able to balance short term delivery needs with mid term needs for standardization and sustainability of solutions. You understand the people, process, and technology dilemma's that go into building out analytics and are able to translate this into practical business cases both within the risk & audit function as well as over other functions.




As an Analytics Expert you:

have minimum 8 years of relevant experience
have minimum a master degree in business information management, computer science, or Mathematics and related accreditation (e.g. CAP/CDMP/CISA/CISSP)
have level BEC B1/B2 or higher Business English preferably combined with proficiency in one of the following languages: Dutch, Spanish, French, Italian and /or German
have a strong independent mindset
are experienced in international stakeholder management & change
are an innovative thinker that challenges the status quo
have an agile and flexible working style and passion for on the job coaching and development
have a pragmatic, realistic yet ambitious vision on analytics
deliver on the roll out of analytics through the 3 pillars of people, process and technology.
integrate technological developments into practices (e.g. generative AI)
effectively connect and take people with different backgrounds allowing non analytics experts to take ownership of initiatives and results




your competencies

Within Randstad we defined the following Human Forward Leadership competencies:

delighting people: connect people (client, talent, employee, society), building strong client relationships and delivering client-centric solutions.
performing today: resourcefulness securing and developing resources effectively and efficiently.
leading change: manages ambiguity operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear.
securing the future: drives vision and purpose painting a compelling picture of the vision and strategy that motivates others into action.
creating clarity: showing line of sight: making sense of complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems and provides direction, is delegating and removing obstacles to get work done
courage to challenge: shows courage and confidence to speak up skillfully, challenging others even when they are confronted with resistance or unfamiliar circumstances
collaborates, reaches out, you excel in organizational sensitivity: manoeuvering comfortably through complex policy, process and people-related organizational dynamics recognizing the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to an organization




whatâ€™s in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this and are in accordance with the applicable (local) Randstad employment policies and related personnel guide.

We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.




people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of todayâ€™s technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. We call this human forward.

Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com




If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our recruitment business partner: jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk




The recruitment procedure consists of a screening and at least two interviews. Later in the process, an (online) assessment and a job offer conversation take place.
