Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Media help partners understand the changing advertising landscape. Specialising in audience measurement, consumer targeting and in-depth intelligence into paid, owned and earned media, their global coverage and local expertise enable better understanding of media audiences and their relationships with brands.

Kantar Media is a wholly owned but operationally independent part of the Kantar Group.

Job Details

As people increasingly move across channels and platforms, Kantar Mediaâ€™s data and audience measurement, targeting, analytics and advertising intelligence services unlock insights to inform powerful decision-making.

Working with panel and first-party data in over 80 countries, we have the worldâ€™s fastest growing cross-media measurement footprint, underpinned by versatility, scale, technology and expertise, to drive long-term business growth for our clients and partners.

Our versatility, scale, technology, and expertise enable our 5000 people across Latin America, Europe, the Middle East, Asia Pacific, North America, and Africa to understand audiences and help the worldâ€™s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Location: Stockholm, Vasagatan

Description

Role Description

Excitingly Kantar Media has partnered with the MMS to build a new Cross-Media Measurement panel in Sweden, that will be one of the first of its kind in the world. We are looking for forward-thinking, diverse, and client-focused individuals to join our team and make this audience measurement panel a success for MMS and Kantar Media.

We are seeking a skilled data engineer who is eager to take on diverse responsibilities encompassing data integration, data architecture, database infrastructure, and ETL development.

Tasks & Responsibilities

The ideal candidate will possess strong critical thinking skills, and collaborate well with cross-functional, international, and local teams.


Design, develop, test and maintain robust data pipelines that ensure seamless data integration.
Design and implement scalable and efficient data architecture solutions to support business requirements.
Evaluate and enhance various database systems (MS SQL, Oracle, Access, MySQL, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, etc.) for optimal storage, retrieval, and analytical efficiency.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues with data infrastructure and ensure data quality and integrity.
Write and optimize Python scripts for data processing, and automation solutions.
Create impactful visualizations using Power BI, SSRS, or equivalent tools.
Conduct reverse engineering on software applications, understanding internal structures, algorithms, and functionalities; analyze scripts, binaries, and source code for interpretation.
Analyse and organize raw data, ensuring data is reliable for consumption by data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders.
Demonstrate flexibility in taking on various tasks and adapting to changing priorities.
Stay current with advancements in data engineering technologies and practices.


Required


Bachelor's or masterâ€™s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Fluent in both Swedish and English.
Proficient in SQL programming for effective database design, optimization, and querying.
Proficient in Python scripting for data processing and automation.
Experience with a cloud environment (Azure)
Experience in with industry big data platform stack (for example: Databricks, Spark, Airflow)
Proven hands-on experience in developing, and maintaining robust ETL data pipelines.
Good understanding of database administration, data warehousing concepts, and architectures.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills for effective troubleshooting of data issues.
Demonstrate strong communication skills, conveying intricate technical concepts effectively.
Exhibit trustworthiness, resilience, and a quick-learning aptitude.


At Kantar Media we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career thatâ€™s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted, and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and wellbeing is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

At Kantar Media, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity; therefore, we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate based on age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Interested? Apply today or get in contact with maria.bonal@kantar.com to learn more.

Country

Sweden

Why join Kantar?

We pride ourselves on understanding people, and what makes us think and act the way we do.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. Weâ€™re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like youâ€™re not an exact match, weâ€™d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Analytics Implementation Specialist
Description:
ðŸ“Stockholm ðŸ“† As soon as possible

ðŸ‘©ðŸ½â€ðŸ’» Office: 3 Days a Week ðŸ“š Our Recruitment Process

Weâ€™re now looking for an Analytics Specialist to join our Analytics team. In this role, youâ€™ll help shape the data foundation and strategy for leading brands, driving app tracking and analytics initiatives alongside a skilled team.

With solid experience in app analytics and data platforms, you have a passion for creating tracking and measurement solutions. You thrive on building strong partnerships and enjoy collaborating with both colleagues and clients to share insights and expertise.

We offer a dynamic, curiosity-driven culture where innovation is at the forefront. Youâ€™ll work with some of the industryâ€™s best in digital marketing and martech, all driven to explore new frontiers in a supportive, collaborative environment.

What You Will Be Doing


Design and implement comprehensive measurement plans, driving analytics solutions across both websites and mobile apps.
Maintain high data quality by diagnosing, troubleshooting, and resolving tracking and technical issues.
Innovate and contribute new ideas, conducting research to advance app analytics capabilities and methodologies.
Provide strategic guidance to clients, helping them optimize their analytics architecture and enhance the depth and accuracy of insights.


What We Are Looking For


Expertise in Tracking Methodologies: Expertise in tagging, data layers, and server-side tracking, especially within the Google stack (Google Analytics, Tag Manager, BigQuery).
Technical Proficiency: Confident in Javascript, web technologies (e.g. cookies, HTTP requests) and product APIs.
Stakeholder Communication & Project Management: Skilled in engaging with stakeholders and managing project timelines effectively.
Experience: 2+ years of hands-on experience with web or app tracking technologies.
High Technical Skills: Capable of guiding customers seamlessly through the integration process.
[Preferred] App Analytics Knowledge: In-depth understanding of app analytics tools and platforms (e.g. Firebase, Appsflyer/Adjust, Amplitude/Mixpanel, SKAdNetwork).


What We Offer

You can read our full offering in our handbook.


An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - thatâ€™s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
Transparent salary setting, you can find all our salary bands in our Handbook - this role is an L2 role within the Analytics column. Check it out!
30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurances. Or different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.


Are you curious to learn more about us? You can meet some of our coworkers and read about our departments here. For insights into how is life at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.

We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.

Please send your application in English.

We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Application Deadline: May 18, 2025




Location: Stockholm, Helsinki




At Bonava we are not only building houses, but we are also creating homes and neighbourhoods where people live their lives. As a data engineer at Bonava you will design and build data flows between different systems and write efficient code to transform data for various services to ensure that our users have the data they need in their applications.




The role

In this role you will design, build, maintain and optimise data pipelines in Microsoft Synapse Analytics and their related components in Microsoft Azure, such as Logic Apps and Azure Functions. You will work with relevant stakeholders to understand the requirements, draft solutions that follow our internal guidelines and then develop these. You will write code in PySpark (a mix between Python and SQL that runs on Spark) to ingest, transform, and store data automatically in efficient ways in our data lake. You will also build algorithms to extract, create and transform data that will be used to deliver new insights to the business. Finally, you will contribute to the continuous improvement of our data platform.




The way we work

The team you will be joining is a distributed team of 8 persons split between Stockholm, Helsinki, and Berlin. As the Data-team we cover everything from integrations to reporting and AI. We use a hybrid setup, mixing remote work with working from the office.




We work in an agile way aiming for small frequent releases using guiding principles from the software development world. Our tech stack is mostly within Microsoft Azure, where we are using PySpark and Synapse Analytics heavily for data engineering and analysis and Microsoft Power BI for reporting. For integrations we focus mainly on Data Factory/Synapse Analytics, Logic Apps, Azure Functions and API management.




Who we are looking for?

For this role you need to both enjoy writing code and have a clear interest in understanding the business and the data. You learn new technical tools quickly when you have the proper support. Working independently is something you are used to, but you are also comfortable with asking for help and helping your colleagues when needed. You have a high attention to details, and you understand the importance of both correctness in the data and prioritisation.




We believe you have a MSc in computer science, data science or information systems.




Skills & Requirements

Required

Experience in PySpark (preferred) or in SQL + Python
Experience of building data pipelines in Azure Data Factory or Azure Synapse Analytics
Experience of making API calls to extract data
Knowledge of relational databases, SQL, modelling of data and normalisation of data structures
Knowledge of complexity, optimisation, and characteristics of less and more efficient algorithms
Professional level in English




Meriting

It is also meriting if you have experience of any of the following:

PySpark (strongly preferred)
Git and CI/CD
Azure DevOps
Azure Logic Apps
Azure Functions
Azure API Management




Join our journey

When you apply, please submit your resume and cover letter in English together with relevant grade transcripts. We are reviewing applications continuously, so please send your application as soon as possible but no later than May 18, 2025.




If you have any specific questions, please contact Helena SjÃ¶berg at helena.sjoberg@bonava.com, the recruiting manager.




About the company

Bonava is a leading residential developer in Europe with the purpose to create happy neighbourhoods for the many. With its 1,300 employees, Bonava develops residential housing in Germany, Sweden, Finland, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. To date, the company has built about 40,000 homes and reported net sales of approximately SEK 13 Bn in 2023. Bonavaâ€™s shares and green bond are listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.




Contact Person

Helena SjÃ¶berg

helena.sjoberg@bonava.com

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description:

Are you passionate about solving business challenges through data? Do you have robust experience with data analytics, data engineering and data visualization methodologies and tools? Are you good at collaborating and communicating with various stakeholders, collecting and understanding their needs? Are you a structured person with the right mix of analytical skills and business acumen? If so, join us!

What the job is ...

We are a team of Data Analysts and Process Managers who form the Business Performance and Improvement unit within Product Management. The role of our unit is to drive all projects, initiatives, analytics and automation required to lead the transformation of Product Management towards a data and process centric organization. Our end goal? Drive growth, boost business performance and competitiveness.

The position is located in Copenhagen, Denmark.

In your position as Data Analyst you will be required to:


Support the development of an online platform by leading the work package responsible for data collection, data analysis and data quality
Work and collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges and opportunities that can be addressed through data analytics and automation.
Lead the development of digital tools, automation and dashboards to support decision making, corporate presentations, etc.
Process and transform complex, high-volume data from multiple sources.
Acquire datasets and ensure data quality and availability.
Communicate complex analytical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Support the data-driven transformation of Product Management.


What do you offer?

You are an enthusiastic team player, self-driven, proactive, structured and autonomous with a business-oriented mindset. You are curious and enjoy providing solutions to business needs. You demonstrate excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to translate complex analytical and technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

Ideally, you have:


3-5 years of professional experience in Data Analytics
MSc in Mathematics, Computer science, or a related field.
Good experience of programming languages such as Python and R.
Proven experience in developing and implementing analytics solutions in a business context.
Fluency in English.


What does your next challenge look like?

At SATAIR, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe.

We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international and diverse teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow, making an impact on aviationâ€™s digital and sustainable transformation.

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company!

About SATAIR

Satair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customersâ€™ orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment.

With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of over $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family.

Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

What do we offer at SATAIR?

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options


Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company

Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

Satair (a 100% subsidiary of Airbus) is offering first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. With our global functional organisation spanning across eleven different sites and locations worldwide, you will be part of a truly global family. Change is the only constant at Satair. The aviation industry is an ever changing - and fast moving environment.

That calls for someone special - someone like you!

Welcome to the Satair family!

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Companyâ€™s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Satair A/S

Contract Type:

Permanent

Experience Level:

Professional

Job Family:

Digital

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst that want to play a key role in shaping data-driven insights and deliver functional Power BI solutions? Do you want to support one of Europeâ€™s largest residential portfolios, providing essential data insights to business users? Then this role with us, may be your next step!







The Team

Join the AnalytiX team as our Data Analyst and contribute to our mission of delivering innovative Power BI solutions and automating manual data processes. Youâ€™ll be part of a cross-functional team consisting of data engineers, data analysts. Youâ€™ll have opportunities to collaborate across Data & AnalytiX function, where our shared passion for data drives us toward common goals of quality and ensuring satisfaction with our products.

This full-time position is based in either our Copenhagen group office.







Key Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role on delivering visually appealing, functional, and high-quality Power BI reports and ensuring adoption by connecting with end-users of the solutions.




your core responsibilities encompass:

Develop, maintain and fine-tune Power BI reports to meet business needs
Provide proactive maintenance of current solutions while optimizing them for better performance
Document solution designs and workflow in Miro for clear communication and alignment
Take part in developing data models that enable self-service BI
Facilitate discussions and meetings with product owners to understand business needs and align solutions accordingly
Ensure the smooth transition of existing solutions to a more scalable and future-proof setup
Contribute to the technical debt management of the Power BI platform and ensure best practices







To fit this role, we look for you who has:

Minimum Bachelorâ€™s degree in relevant fields
Strong passion for statistics and data analysis, and experience with large datasets and dimensional modelling.
Knowledge of ETL tools and data processing techniques.
Experience with data warehousing, data modeling and DAX programming.
Ability to work within an agile setup and prioritize tasks efficiently.
Confidence in engaging with stakeholders across various functions and asking insightful questions.
Fluent in English; Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills.




You have a systematic, analytical mindset. As a person you are naturally curious about new methods and technologies, enabling effective interaction with both technical and business teams (with the ability to translate tech lingo to something non-tech people can understand). You immediately take our values, Care, Dare, Share to your heart and enjoy working in an informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility goes hand in hand.










Join Us

Joining Heimstaden means being part of a team that dreams big, works passionately, and continuously strives for improvement.




We celebrate talent in all its forms and encourage you to apply, even if you donâ€™t meet every qualification listed. Letâ€™s explore together how your unique strengths can contribute to our shared goals.

Apply today to connect with the People & Culture team to further explore this opportunity!







We will initiate conversations with selected candidates prior to the application deadline.

We conduct background checks as part of our recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding this, you are welcome to contact us.




We know the value of challenging unconscious bias and the importance of focusing on the full potential and competences of each individual. That is why we do not require a cover letter when applying to our positions, and we use testing as a tool in the process.

For questions, please contact Franco Hurtado at franco.hurtado@heimstaden.com

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever itâ€™s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.




About the position: (This is aÂ Maternity Cover role - FTC 11 months )

Are you adept at problem-solving and able to provide a high level of service to colleagues and members? As a Panel Administrator you will be integral in fostering and maintaining high engagement and strong cooperation from Nielsenâ€™s panel members in Denmark.Â 

The Data Analyst / Panel supporter maintains a close relationship with individual panel members as well as field technicians in order to ensure smooth and efficient data collection from the panel.




Responsibilities:
Provide clear and effective telephone and written support for both panel members and Nielsen field technicians
Â Ensure that information in databases is accurate, valid and up to date
Ensure that data received from participating households adheres to quality control standards
Resolve problems by clarifying issues, researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions, implementing solutions, and escalating unresolved problems
Manage projects from start to finish (ideation/initiation to execution and evaluation), that can improve overall data quality and efficiency





Key Competencies:
University degree (preferably long-term higher education programme) within fields such as business administration, sociology, media studies
Able to speak Danish fluently.
Analytical skills and an ability to work with data in a structured manner
Able to drive continuous process improvements.A good understanding of media usage habits.Â 
Advanced knowledge of the ever-changing media landscape.Â 
Have a good sense for Tone of Voice when communicating with panel members
Able to speak and communicate in English

Nice to have :
General good IT skills (e.g. Google Sheets/Excel)
Adept at understanding and learning to use new IT systems and applications











Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with aÂ nielsen.comÂ domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @nielsen.comÂ address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

  • Provide clear and effective telephone and written support for both panel members and Nielsen field technicians
  •  Ensure that information in databases is accurate, valid and up to date

  • General good IT skills (e.g. Google Sheets/Excel)
  • Adept at understanding and learning to use new IT systems and applications




Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

Title: GAME Data Analyst â€“ Student Worker
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do you want to help bring LEGO play to gaming and gamers to LEGO play?

We are looking for an enthusiastic student worker to support our GAME Play Performance and Business Modelling team in enabling data guided decisions.


Core Responsibilities

As a student worker in the GAME PP & BM team, you will â€¯â€¯â€¯





Assist in ensuring data consistency, through continuous improvement of processes and documentation.
Support preparation of communication materials and reporting by collecting and ensuring quality of relevant information.
Contribute with ideas and recommendations to further improve our data maturity.
Build and maintain dashboards.
General support for ad-hoc tasks and projects.




Play your part in our team succeeding

As a student worker you will get a chance to shape the journey of our gaming experiences. Dive deeper into the data insights and support the growth of self-service culture within LEGO GAME.

This opportunity is for you who are passionate about analytics and insights. Where you will get hands on experience in relevant tools, data management and dashboard building. All while collaborating with colleagues and inspiring game innovation.

Do you have what it takes?

It is a prerequisite that you are enrolled in an educational institution during your employment as a student worker. Further





We imagine that you are a master level student, or in the final year of your bachelorâ€™s degree. Your educational focus is business-related such as Business Administration, Business Intelligence, or similar.
You are able to work at a minimum of 10-15 hours per week.
You are comfortable with working independently in a trusting and virtual environment.
An interest for the LEGO Group and a passion for video games.
English at a professional level.
Knowledge of basic SQL.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Whatâ€™s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances â€“ All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount â€“ We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Childrenâ€™s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Childrenâ€™s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGOÂ® team today.

Title: Senior Analytics Consultant
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com

Job Description

We are looking for a dynamic Senior Analytics Consultant to join our Northern Europe analytics team, specializing in credit risk management with a strong focus on client engagement and innovative solutions. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in the banking and finance sector or management consulting, with a deep understanding of credit risk management and EU/local regulations such as IRB, IFRS 9, NPL management and ESG standards.

You will be responsible for building and maintaining client relationships, leading and managing analytics projects, and delivering analytics solutions to the benefit of our clients and their customers. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and SQL is preferred, along with excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex information clearly. You will also play a key role in developing new scores and attributes, new analytics products and use cases of analytics platforms, staying updated on industry trends. If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and have a keen interest in fintech development, we would love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Build client relationships, and identify and drive client opportunities, being a trusted advisor for our clients.
Participate in pre-sales and sales meetings with clients and prospects to describe and position Experian's analytics projects, determine the client requirements across the full range of Experian Decision Analytics solutions ensuring the relationship with the client is productive and professional.
Engage in a consultative way with the clients to identify problems and define, design and deliver solutions and identify new opportunities. Create and present proposals and recommendations to clients for solutions.
Lead and manage project teams, ensure successful delivery of analytics projects, delivery of value-driven recommendations, knowledge transfer and effective advisory.
Lead innovation analytics driven projects, playing an active role in developing new analytics products and solutions for our clients.
Act as a Project Manager for projects involving statistical modelling, analytics platforms, sandbox use or regulatory analytics, assessing project scope, duration, resources and cost to define the project plan.
Review the project deliveries to ensure that all analysis is thorough and established, quality procedures are followed to help guarantee the robustness of the solution and that all critical business issues are identified through data analysis.
Stay on top of industry trends and engage and collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Sales, Pre-Sales, Product, Operations, Data and Platforms as well as international teams to ensure scaling Experian Analytics presence & capabilities across financial services.
Lead workshops and knowledge sharing sessions with our clients, joining Experian events as a speaker to provide expertise and insights to our clients.
Analyze and identify value creation and improvement opportunities at the intersection of business, data and technology.
Mentor and coach junior colleagues in the team.


Qualifications


Masterâ€™s degree in quantitative fields such as Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Business Science, Economics, Management or a related field.
4 to 8 years of proven experience in credit risk management within the banking and finance sector or in any management consulting or analytics and data driven industry.
Strong understanding of credit risk management and analytics areas. Knowhow with EU and local credit risk regulations, including IRB, IFRS 9, NPL Management and ESG standards.
Strong understanding of analytical products, data and analytics. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, SQL and Databricks knowledge is a plus and familiarity with advanced analytics techniques and tools such as machine learning and AI.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly to clients and bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to analyze large datasets and develop predictive models, innovative thinking and the ability to translate data and analytics into business outcomes.
In-depth knowledge of market trends, financial products including strong market knowledge and experience in the Nordic financial sector.
Experience in managing projects and leading teams.
Fluency in Danish or Norwegian and English is a must.


What we offer?


Great compensation package and bonus plan.
Core benefits including health insurance, Experian shares discount, pension and wellbeing benefits.
Flexible work environment, hybrid work.
Flexible work hours including volunteer time off and 6 weeks holidays.


Additional Information

Proud to be a Worlds Best Workplace 2024

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are main differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what truly matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; Great Place To Workâ„¢ in 24 countries, FORTUNE Best Companies to work and Glassdoor Best Places to Work (globally 4.4 Stars) to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is a critical part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data Analyst - Heimstaden Group Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Heimstaden is a European residential real estate manager and investor, with around 160,000 homes across nine countries with a property value of EUR 29bn. We acquire, develop, and manage properties with an evergreen perspective, focusing on creating lasting value for people and communitiesâ€”together, we are shaping the European real estate market towards a better and more sustainable tomorrow.




The Team



Join the AnalytiX team as our Data Analyst and contribute to our mission of delivering innovative Power BI solutions and automating manual data processes. Youâ€™ll be part of a cross-functional team consisting of data engineers, data analysts. Youâ€™ll have opportunities to collaborate across Data & AnalytiX function, where our shared passion for data drives us toward common goals of quality and ensuring satisfaction with our products.
This full-time position is based in our Copenhagen group office.





Job Description



Key Responsibilities:



As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role on delivering visually appealing, functional, and high-quality Power BI reports and ensuring adoption by connecting with end-users of the solutions.
your core responsibilities encompass:



Develop, maintain and fine-tune Power BI reports to meet business needs
Provide proactive maintenance of current solutions while optimizing them for better performance
Document solution designs and workflow in Miro for clear communication and alignment
Take part in developing data models that enable self-service BI
Facilitate discussions and meetings with product owners to understand business needs and align solutions accordingly
Ensure the smooth transition of existing solutions to a more scalable and future-proof setup
Contribute to the technical debt management of the Power BI platform and ensure best practices


Qualifications



To fit this role, we look for you who has:



Minimum Bachelorâ€™s degree in relevant fields
Strong passion for statistics and data analysis, and experience with large datasets and dimensional modelling.
Knowledge of ETL tools and data processing techniques.
Experience with data warehousing, data modeling and DAX programming.
Ability to work within an agile setup and prioritize tasks efficiently.
Confidence in engaging with stakeholders across various functions and asking insightful questions.
Fluent in English; Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills.

You have a systematic, analytical mindset. As a person you are naturally curious about new methods and technologies, enabling effective interaction with both technical and business teams (with the ability to translate tech lingo to something non-tech people can understand). You immediately take our values, Care, Dare, Share to your heart and enjoy working in an informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility goes hand in hand.





Additional Information



Join Us



Joining Heimstaden means being part of a team that dreams big, works passionately, and continuously strives for improvement.

We celebrate talent in all its forms and encourage you to apply, even if you donâ€™t meet every qualification listed. Letâ€™s explore together how your unique strengths can contribute to our shared goals.
Apply today to connect with the People & Culture team to further explore this opportunity!



We will initiate conversations with selected candidates prior to the application deadline.
For questions, please contact Franco Hurtado atâ€¯franco.hurtado@heimstaden.comâ€¯. We conduct background checks as part of our recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding this, you are welcome to contact us!â€¯

We know the value of challenging unconscious bias and the importance of focusing on the full potential and competences of each individual. That is why we do not require a cover letter when applying to our positions, and we use testing as a tool in the process. This way we ensure we do not miss out on candidates who may have less experience, but still would bring the right attitude, skills and prerequisites to succeed in the role. If you have any questions, please feel welcome to reach out.



We conduct background checks as part of our recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding this, you are welcome to contact us!

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever itâ€™s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.

About the position: (This is a Maternity Cover role - FTC 11 months )

Are you adept at problem-solving and able to provide a high level of service to colleagues and members? As a Panel Administrator you will be integral in fostering and maintaining high engagement and strong cooperation from Nielsenâ€™s panel members in Denmark.

The Data Analyst / Panel supporter maintains a close relationship with individual panel members as well as field technicians in order to ensure smooth and efficient data collection from the panel.

Responsibilities:


Provide clear and effective telephone and written support for both panel members and Nielsen field technicians.
Ensure that information in databases is accurate, valid and up to date.
Ensure that data received from participating households adheres to quality control standards.
Resolve problems by clarifying issues, researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions, implementing solutions, and escalating unresolved problems.
Manage projects from start to finish (ideation/initiation to execution and evaluation), that can improve overall data quality and efficiency.


Key Competencies:


University degree (preferably long-term higher education programme) within fields such as business administration, sociology, media studies.
Able to speak Danish fluently.
Analytical skills and an ability to work with data in a structured manner.
Able to drive continuous process improvements.A good understanding of media usage habits.
Advanced knowledge of the ever-changing media landscape.
Have a good sense for Tone of Voice when communicating with panel members.
Able to speak and communicate in English
Nice to have :
General good IT skills (e.g. Google Sheets/Excel)
Adept at understanding and learning to use new IT systems and applications.


Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @ nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about enabling insights to be discovered through data? Do you have a keen eye for how to best visualize and communicate with data through reporting and analytics solutions? Do you want to assist in enabling data-informed decision making in area of Supply & Distribution to grow the worldâ€™s largest jewelry brand? If yes, you are the person we are looking for. As our new data visualization specialist, you will play a pivotal role in making sure that we create technical analytics solutions that solve real business problems and engage users to drive adoption.

Transform, model and visualize data

At PANDORA, we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new Data Visualization Specialist, you will collaborate with product managers, data engineers, stakeholders, and end-users across the global organization. You will help business verticals and clusters maximize the value of our data and drive impactful business change.

Your primary focus will be building and implementing analytics solutions on our global data platform along with our team of excellent engineers in the organization.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: â€¯


Working closely with your products team to design efficient, stable, and to-the-point products to drive commercial business value through reporting, self-service analytics and other data communication cases.
Creating and maintaining high-quality and high-performance Power BI reports and semantic models.
Taking ownership of your products and continuously tracking stability, adoption, and impact.
Ensuring that great user experiences are at the heart of all deliverables.
Delivering self-service solutions for end-users and training them in their usage.
Working with stakeholders and end-users to assist with data-related technical challenges.
Following best practices and existing guidelines but also challenging the status quo.



Team Player With Strong Analytical Skills

We are looking for a real team player with a product-oriented, can-do attitude who is both technically proficient but also able to engage with end-users. You are structured and analytical, always aiming to achieve great results. Furthermore, we are looking for a confident communicator that can explain solution designs and can tailor their message and solutions according to the audience.

Youâ€™re perfect for this role if you have:


Relevant education within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field, however experience and passion for data analytics is most important.
At least 2 years of experience working with BI, data preparation, and visualization.
Experience from a global retail organization.
Experience with Power BI, DAX, Analysis Services, Tabular Editor, SSMS, Databricks, Power Automate, Power Apps, and Jira.
Experience in working with relational data sets using SQL and Tabular models.
High proficiency in English and ability to communicate at all levels of technical competence.
Agile mindset and experience with Scrum and agile ways of working.



Your new team

You will be an essential asset to one of PANDORAâ€™s Data & Analytics product teams, consisting of data engineers, business analysts, scrum masters, and product managers who all enable our global business users in making impactful decisions informed by data. You will join our Digital Hub in Havneholmen, a peninsula on Kalvebod Brygge with a great view over Copenhagen Harbour.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Kelly Kavarnou

Global Tech Recruiter

kekav@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandoraâ€™s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We are an international team, so please make sure to send us your application in English to be considered. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cakeâ€¯

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandoraâ€™s experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment â€“ that we are not only talking about â€“ but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational â€“ and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to peopleâ€™s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment â€“ that we are not only talking about â€“ but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational â€“ and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to peopleâ€™s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer/Data Analyst â€“ Microsoft Fabric, Analytics and Insights, GN Group

Are you interested in a position within an analytics team, actively engaged in shaping the way our business interacts with data â€” from building the underlying dataflows to creating meaningful data products for insights that influence business decisions? This role is a hybrid of practical data engineering and insights generation, with a special focus on supporting the team's adoption of Microsoft Fabric and enhancing self-serve analytics capabilities.

In the role as Data Analyst you will contribute to our purpose of Bringing People Closer.

As our new Data Engineer, you will contribute to our purpose of Bringing People Closer. You will be working closely with the IT department, data analysts in your team and business experts. Your primary responsibility will be to deliver a robust data foundation that enables your colleagues to develop valuable insights for business stakeholders.

The team you will be part of

At our global HQ, located in Ballerup, Denmark, you will be part of the Analytics and Insights team within the Global Customer Experience (GCX) function. The team consists of five data analysts with skills in data engineering, modelling, insights development, process automations, advanced analytics and user adoption. We provide actionable insights within our own function, external GN departments and are closely collaborating with other BI teams across the organization.

This is a team where personal development is highly valued, collaboration is actively encouraged and supported, and new ideas are always listened to. We have adopted the new technologies and processes while organizing our work in a structured and governed way.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:


Coordinate the integration and adoption of Microsoft Fabric within the BI team.
Design and implement a lakehouse framework for the department.
Build robust, reusable pipelines and transformations in Fabric.
Support data governance, lineage, and workspace structures across business units.
Manage, evaluate, and validate data from various sources to ensure data quality and integrity.
Champion best practices around data modeling, naming conventions, semantic layer design.
Work with stakeholders to understand data requirements, ensure data flow improvements, and develop scalable and re-usable data products.
Manage and maintain the teamâ€™s Git repository.
Translate business requirements into data model designs and technical specs for BI backend developers.
Analyse data from a business perspective, create insights and produce reliable and actionable recommendations for GCX Management and key business stakeholders.
Manage data-centric initiatives within GCX and offer authoritative guidance on issues pertaining to data.


Your personal and professional journey is valuable to us, and we consider the following factors as possible contributors to a mutually beneficial partnership. You have:


Solid experience with data engineering tools (ETL/ELT pipelines, data transformations, data modelling).
In-depth experience with or a keen interest in Microsoft Fabric.
Proficiency in SQL, especially Python, and Spark for data transformations.
Solid working knowledge of Power BI, including DAX, Power Query, and dataset optimization.
Experience using Git for version control.
Thorough experience with designing and structuring data for efficient querying and analysis.
Effective communication skills, stakeholder management abilities and ability to collaborate across the organization.
Capacity for self-guided work and collaboration within a group setting.
A relevant higher education degree in IT, engineering, or other relevant fields of studies.
A genuine interest in data and a mindset of continuous learning and upskilling â€” whether it's exploring new tools, staying current on platform updates, or sharing knowledge with the team.


We encourage you to apply

Even if you donâ€™t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset and motivation that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure progress for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the â€˜APPLYâ€™ link no later than 30 of April 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so donâ€™t wait to send yours.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Manager of the Analytics and Insights team on +45 28 27 01 27 or Talent Attraction Partner at: aniewiadomy@gn.com

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our innovative intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiast.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
For a newly created position, we are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to ensure continuous improvement, development, and timely delivery of regulatory reporting.




Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark is a leading player in the automotive financial services industry, operating as a joint venture between Semler Gruppen and Volkswagen Financial Services. To enhance reporting structures and meet evolving European standards, Moment Search & Selection is looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join the IT-PMO team in BrÃ¸ndby and to take on a key role in a newly created position.




Drive Data Excellence while bridging Business and Data.

With increased regulatory demands from the European Central Bank and the Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA), you will play a crucial role in ensuring compliance, optimizing data processes, and driving continuous improvement in regulatory reporting. You will join a dynamic and forward-thinking environment where innovation, collaboration, and adaptability are key drivers of success. At Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark, you will be part of an international and growth-oriented organization that values your analytical thinking, proactive problem-solving, and cross-functional collaboration.




In this role, you will be the link between business and data, ensuring that regulatory demands are translated into effective, data-driven solutions. You will work closely with skilled colleagues in IT, Finance, and Risk to develop high-quality reporting solutions and your key responsibilities will include:




Define, analyze, and refine regulatory reporting requirements from business owners and stakeholders.
Collaborate with business owners to produce detailed specifications and work with developers to translate these into SQL.
Represent business requirements, working closely with developers to ensure accurate implementation.
Participate in and facilitate testing with business stakeholders, ensuring all requirements are met.
Work effectively within agile teams, contributing to sprints and iterative development processes.
Develop and specify requirements for reports and data warehouses to support a variety of business needs beyond regulatory reporting.
Navigate and contribute to a complex international environment, ensuring compliance with global standards and best practices.




In this role, you will also need to build and maintain close working relationships with stakeholders at various levels. You will demonstrate strong analytical skills to ensure data integrity and quality in complex environments.




Your qualifications

To succeed in this role, you must have significant experience with complex data transformations and regulatory reporting. You should have a deep understanding of managing large datasets and collaborating across departments, and you must be able to communicate confidently in English, both verbally and in writing.




You hold a bachelorâ€™s degree in data science, computer science, finance, or in a related field and have at least five years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the financial sector. A strong proficiency in SQL and data warehousing is essential, and experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Qlik will be an advantage. Experience with data governance and GDPR compliance is essential.




You have developed a robust technical expertise that enables you to ask critical questions and provide guidance when needed. Additionally, you will act as a "safety net" for data handling, ensuring that data is managed accurately and in full compliance with relevant regulations and standards, both within Danish and German law.




Join an international workplace with significant opportunities for professional and personal growth.




At Moment Search & Selection, we are handling the recruitment of Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmarkâ€™s new Data Analyst. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so donâ€™t hesitate to apply if this sounds like your next challenge! Once the right candidate is found, the recruitment process will be closed.




If you have any questions regarding the position, feel free to contact Senior Recruitment Consultant, Morten Thomsen, on mobile +45 31365625.




About Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark

Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark A/S is a leading player in the automotive financial services industry, operating as a joint venture between Semler Gruppen and Volkswagen Financial Services. Semler Gruppen, with over 100 years of experience, is Denmarkâ€™s largest car importer, representing renowned brands such as Volkswagen, Audi, Skoda, Porsche, and Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles. Volkswagen Financial Services, a division of the Volkswagen Group, operates across 48 markets globally, making it the worldâ€™s largest provider of financial products and services to the automotive sector. Together, the two partners offer comprehensive and flexible financial, leasing, insurance, and mobility services to customers and dealers in Denmark.

Title: Consultant - McKinsey Digital
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleaguesâ€”at all levelsâ€”will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, youâ€™ll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you wonâ€™t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have


Continuous learning Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. Youâ€™ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firmâ€™s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.


Your Impact

As a junior associate, you will join a client service team and take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face. And these arenâ€™t just any clientsâ€”they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And weâ€™ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting.

You will take on a role that goes beyond advising. Youâ€™ll be at the heart of the actionâ€”helping to uncover the true challenges behind a clientâ€™s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. Working alongside clients and other McKinsey colleagues, youâ€™ll combine research, analyzing data, interviews, and brainstorming to generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions. Your commitment to our values will be crucial in earning our clients' trust and delivering results that matter.

As you collaborate directly with clients, youâ€™ll help them solve problems, refine strategies, and implement transformations. By equipping them with the tools and knowledge to continue innovating and improving after weâ€™ve left, youâ€™ll ensure the impact of our work endures. In doing so, youâ€™ll uphold McKinseyâ€™s commitment to making a meaningful difference in the industries and communities we serve.

Read more about McKinsey Digital here.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and local office language(s), with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
Proficient in rational decision making based on data, facts, and logical reasoning.
Ability to create work product-focused materials / outputs, which may include PowerPoint decks, Excel models, articles, or other written deliverables.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Ability to work or attend meetings outside of traditional business hours or take on projects with limited or no notice at times.
Ability to travel to and work in varying environments that may be challenging and/or not accessible (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines).

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Itâ€™s an exciting time to join Tactile. We're a diverse team of storytellers, puzzle enthusiasts and casual mobile game creators. Our story began in 2008 in the heart of beautiful Copenhagen, and since then we have experienced continuous growth, establishing ourselves as one of the largest gaming companies in Denmark. In more recent years, we have been scaling fast, in big part thanks to the success of a little game called Lilyâ€™s Garden. Now weâ€™re on a mission to solidify our position as one of the leaders in creating out-of-the-ordinary casual puzzle games.

With more than 350 talented individuals, we are a mix of over 55 nationalities and 43% women. We truly appreciate the richness of different experiences and perspectives that Tactilers bring to the game. This is why we foster a lean organisational culture, in which each individual is encouraged to take responsibility, be open and grow in their own way. We pride ourselves in cultivating a studio environment that stays away from crunch, that fosters your skills no matter what your discipline is, and one that gives you a place to be creative alongside other passionate and invested storytellers.

ðŸš€ Your Role & Impact

We are currently growing our Analytics team and are on the search for Game Analysts to support our Product and LiveOps functions.

Our analysts are embedded directly within our game teams, ensuring each team has dedicated experts who understand the intricacies of data and their unique needs. Your role will be crucial in validating decisions with data, offering valuable insights to shape product roadmaps, and fostering a culture of backing up decisions with data. This means you will have a real impact on the game and contribute to enhancing our playersâ€™ experience.

So, if you are super passionate about games or mobile tech and have data deeply embedded in your DNA, then you might just be our missing piece! ðŸ§©

Role

ðŸ“ This role is based in our beautiful Copenhagen office, as we truly believe that when talented people work closely together, amazing things happen! Hereâ€™s what you'll do on the day-to-day:


Analyse the performance of the game to help the Product/LiveOps team understand player behaviour, what to improve in the game and what is the estimated impact of each improvement
Create compelling dashboards to monitor key metrics of the game
Work closely with the Product/LiveOps team to design, analyse and derive conclusions from A/B tests
Help game designers and product specialists to balance game features
Work with developers to define the necessary tracking data points in the game
Present your findings to stakeholders (product or LiveOps team members) and propose courses of action or improvements to the game
Work closely with the rest of the game analysts on the team and brainstorm on how to solve problem


What weâ€™re looking for:


Strong background in data analytics
Proficiency with SQL
High proficiency in presenting analyses and results to all audiences, from senior stakeholders to junior colleagues and in particular to non-technical teammates
Experience applying analytic techniques in order to understand user behaviour and their interactions
A good understanding of applied statistics (such as sampling, hypothesis testing and ab testing)
Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau)


You'll make us extra excited if you also have:


Prior experience working within gaming/mobile apps
Python/R knowledge


Whatâ€™s in it for you?

ðŸŒ† Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

ðŸ©º Pension and private health insurance

ðŸ’» A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

ðŸ“š Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

ðŸŒ® Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

ðŸ¥³ Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

ðŸ” Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher

Our interview process

Submit your application via the fill-in form at the top of this page. This is the easiest and fastest way to get in touch with our recruiters. We foster an inclusive culture and accessible workplace and want to make sure we provide everyone with the same opportunities for success. This is why we encourage you to apply regardless of your gender, sexuality, age, nationality, neurodiversity or disability. We review applications based on competencies and experience, so please do tell us about your favourite projects and technologies.

After we review your application, you can expect to go through the following conversations: â˜• Introductory chat with one of our Recruiters to make sure weâ€™re aligned on the scope of the role ðŸ‘‹ Introductory conversation with Ivan, our Analytics lead to dive into the technical details of the role ðŸ§ª A test assignment, to see your skills in action. ðŸš€ Follow-up technical interview, in which you will meet with the team, present & discuss your test solutions ðŸ¤ The final interview will be with Norberto, our Head of Analytics

We are pretty thorough with our hiring process. It is important to us that we choose new Tactilers carefully - just as it is vital to ensure that we are the right place for you.â€

We want to ensure you have a great candidate experience whilst in our recruitment process. We will do everything we can within reason to make sure that your interview takes place in an environment that fairly and accurately assesses your skills. If you need assistance or accommodation, please let us know. We look forward to receiving your application! ðŸ‘‹
