We pride ourselves in cultivating a studio environment that stays away from crunch, that fosters your skills no matter what your discipline is, and one that gives you a place to be creative alongside other passionate and invested storytellers.

ðŸš€ Your Role & Impact

We are currently growing our Analytics team and are on the search for Game Analysts to support our Product and LiveOps functions.

Our analysts are embedded directly within our game teams, ensuring each team has dedicated experts who understand the intricacies of data and their unique needs. Your role will be crucial in validating decisions with data, offering valuable insights to shape product roadmaps, and fostering a culture of backing up decisions with data. This means you will have a real impact on the game and contribute to enhancing our playersâ€™ experience.

So, if you are super passionate about games or mobile tech and have data deeply embedded in your DNA, then you might just be our missing piece! ðŸ§©

Role

ðŸ“ This role is based in our beautiful Copenhagen office, as we truly believe that when talented people work closely together, amazing things happen! Hereâ€™s what you'll do on the day-to-day:

  • Analyse the performance of the game to help the Product/LiveOps team understand player behaviour, what to improve in the game and what is the estimated impact of each improvement
  • Create compelling dashboards to monitor key metrics of the game
  • Work closely with the Product/LiveOps team to design, analyse and derive conclusions from A/B tests
  • Help game designers and product specialists to balance game features
  • Work with developers to define the necessary tracking data points in the game
  • Present your findings to stakeholders (product or LiveOps team members) and propose courses of action or improvements to the game
  • Work closely with the rest of the game analysts on the team and brainstorm on how to solve problem

What weâ€™re looking for:

  • Strong background in data analytics
  • Proficiency with SQL
  • High proficiency in presenting analyses and results to all audiences, from senior stakeholders to junior colleagues and in particular to non-technical teammates
  • Experience applying analytic techniques in order to understand user behaviour and their interactions
  • A good understanding of applied statistics (such as sampling, hypothesis testing and ab testing)
  • Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau)

You'll make us extra excited if you also have:

  • Prior experience working within gaming/mobile apps
  • Python/R knowledge

Whatâ€™s in it for you?

ðŸŒ† Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

ðŸ©º Pension and private health insurance

ðŸ’» A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

ðŸ“š Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

ðŸŒ® Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

ðŸ¥³ Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

ðŸ” Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher

Our interview process

Submit your application via the fill-in form at the top of this page. This is the easiest and fastest way to get in touch with our recruiters. We foster an inclusive culture and accessible workplace and want to make sure we provide everyone with the same opportunities for success. This is why we encourage you to apply regardless of your gender, sexuality, age, nationality, neurodiversity or disability. We review applications based on competencies and experience, so please do tell us about your favourite projects and technologies.

After we review your application, you can expect to go through the following conversations: â˜• Introductory chat with one of our Recruiters to make sure weâ€™re aligned on the scope of the role ðŸ‘‹ Introductory conversation with Ivan, our Analytics lead to dive into the technical details of the role ðŸ§ª A test assignment, to see your skills in action. ðŸš€ Follow-up technical interview, in which you will meet with the team, present & discuss your test solutions ðŸ¤ The final interview will be with Norberto, our Head of Analytics

We are pretty thorough with our hiring process. It is important to us that we choose new Tactilers carefully - just as it is vital to ensure that we are the right place for you.â€

We want to ensure you have a great candidate experience whilst in our recruitment process. We will do everything we can within reason to make sure that your interview takes place in an environment that fairly and accurately assesses your skills. If you need assistance or accommodation, please let us know. We look forward to receiving your application! ðŸ‘‹

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Aalborg Municipality, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Data Analyst â€“ Drive Operational & Strategic Impact in the Global Music Industry

Location: Aalborg, Denmark (Hybrid possible)

Company: Music Manager




Do you dream of working with big data, music, and real-world impactâ€”every day?

At Music Manager, we work with some of the most prominent investment firms and label groups in the world to help them unlock the full commercial potential of their music rights. Our data-driven platforms power strategic decisions behind thousands of top digital assets globally.




We're now looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Aalborg and take a central role in our operational and technological evolution.




What youâ€™ll do:

As our in-house Data Scientist, you'll help us turn complexity into clarityâ€”both for our internal teams and our clients. You will:

Support end-to-end execution of client projects by bringing structure, insights, and clarity to large, messy, and complex data sets.
Source, structure, and manage critical datasets, working with everything from consumption to rights metadata across platforms and stakeholders.
Analyze and produce metadata at scale, optimizing commercial output for high-value digital music catalogs.
Explore innovative ways to monetize and enhance data, tapping into collection societies, platforms, and other industry stakeholders across the value chain.
Co-develop internal systems and tools that directly contribute to our companyâ€™s intellectual property.
Work closely with our CTO (Lisbon) on the next generation of our platformâ€”building new features and capabilities on a path from ML to AI.
Report directly to the Founder & CEO (Aalborg), and collaborate with finance (Aalborg), client services (Copenhagen), and tech (Lisbon).

What you bring:

A background in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or similar.
Strong Python + SQL skills. Familiarity with libraries like Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn is a plus.
Experience working with large datasets and building custom data pipelines or models.
Bonus if youâ€™ve worked with music, media, or rights/royalties dataâ€”but not required.
Curiosity and a systems mindset: you donâ€™t just analyzeâ€”you improve, automate, and optimize.
Youâ€™re passionate about using data to fuel strategy, not just dashboards.

What we offer:

A rare chance to work at the intersection of music, finance, and data science.
Real ownership in developing systems and products used by the worldâ€™s leading music investors.
A close-knit, high-trust team with global collaboration (Aalborg, Copenhagen, Lisbon).
Hybrid work flexibility + a cozy HQ in central Aalborg.
Lots of autonomy. Even more impact.




Apply now, or reach out directly via LinkedInâ€”weâ€™re hiring with heart, and weâ€™d love to hear from you.




Company Description

Music Manager is a technology-driven company specializing in maximizing the commercial potential of music rights portfolios. Partnering with labels, investment firms, and rights holders worldwide, we deliver tailored solutions through music catalog auditing and portfolio management, using cutting-edge technologies for measurable results.

Title: Student Data Scientist / Data analyst â€“ Join a Fast-Growing Scale-Up!
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Student Data Scientist â€“ Join a Fast-Growing Scale-Up!

Are you passionate about uncovering business opportunities through data? Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company where your skills will make a real impact? If so, we have the perfect student job for you!

Legal Desk: Innovation, Growth & A Great Place to Work

At Legal Desk, we are transforming the legal industry through automation, making legal services more accessible and affordable for individuals and businesses across the Nordics.

As Denmarkâ€™s leading provider of automated legal services, we help form over 30% of all new Limited liability companies in Denmark and are expanding into Sweden and Norway. With 275,000+ users, our growth is accelerating - and we want you to be part of the journey!

At Legal Desk, we believe that innovation, creativity, and ownership fuel success. As a Student Data Scientist, youâ€™ll gain hands-on experience in a dynamic, supportive, and fast-moving environment, all while having the flexibility to balance work with your studies.

If you're ready to apply your skills to real-world challenges and grow in a company that values your development, then letâ€™s talk! ðŸš€

Shape the Future of Data at Legal Desk

As our Student Data Scientist, youâ€™ll play a key role in transforming our data into powerful insights that drive smarter decision-making. Your work will involve integrating diverse data sources (GA4, Virk open data, internal databases, etc.) into dynamic dashboards, helping uncover key insights, solve business challenges, and improve our platformâ€™s performance.

If you love working with data, thrive in a fast-paced startup environment, and want to make a real impact, we want to hear from you!

What Youâ€™ll Do


Identify business challenges and opportunities and translate them into meaningful visualizations.
Analyze data to optimize business operations and improve the customer experience. Build data models and visualizations, primarily for dashboards.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders in marketing and UX to collect, process, and integrate data from multiple sources.


Who You Are


Currently pursuing a Masterâ€™s degree in Data Science or a related field
A strategic thinker with a business-oriented mindset
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, startup environment
You live in Sweden or Denmark, and you are able to work from our physical office in Copenhagen. Work from home is optional from time to time, however we find it important that you are a part of the social culture in Legal Desk, why you must be able to work form the physical office.


Your Technical Skills

Must haves:


Python â€“ Very proficient (3+ years, including academic experience)
Strong understanding of Python and database structures
Experience with key Python libraries: Pandas. Plotting libraries (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly)
SQL experienced + basic knowledge of data-base structures


Nice to have


Familiarity with Git (basic experience required)
Basic web scraping knowledge
Basic understanding of HTML & CSS
Basic knowledge of BI dashboard principles
Experience with Google Analytics (GA4) and Looker is a plus, but not required
Experience with Streamlit (Python module) is a plus, but not required


Why Join Us?

At Legal Desk, we offer a flexible work environment that adapts to your studies, allowing you to balance your education with real-world experience. Youâ€™ll work alongside a vibrant team of students, gaining hands-on experience in a supportive and innovative environment.

But itâ€™s not just about work - youâ€™ll also get to be part of our thriving social culture! From company trips to some of our many Friday bars, youâ€™ll have plenty of opportunities to connect, collaborate, and have fun with your colleagues.

If youâ€™re excited about using data to drive meaningful change - apply today! ðŸš€

Write a very brief motivational letter along with your CV.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Ageras, we are redefining how entrepreneursâ€”freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEsâ€”manage their banking, and administrative tasks. Through seamless tools and innovative accounting & banking solutions, we help them focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

Our vision is to become the best friend of every small entrepreneur across Europe. ðŸ’š

Over the years, Ageras has grown through the merging of top European FinTechs like Shine (ðŸ‡«ðŸ‡·), Kontist (ðŸ‡©ðŸ‡ª), Tellow (ðŸ‡³ðŸ‡±), and more. Today, weâ€™re a team of nearly 500 people, including 150 talented engineers, working together from Paris, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, and Berlin.




ðŸ‘€ Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneursâ€”freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEsâ€”manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team, currently composed of 4 data analyst and 1 lead data analyst.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Big Query, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

ðŸ“‹ Your Role as a Senior Data Analyst

Data analysis at Ageras means working with a large volume of data across diverse domains (payment transactions, user behavior and conversion, product usage, ticket volume, revenue, marketing...), and and draw business insights from it to support or impact the company strategy ðŸ’¥




Your Responsibilities Will Include

Data Analysis & Visualization
Build and optimize analytical data models using dbt.
Develop and maintain dashboards on Looker Studio and Metabase to empower teams with actionable insights.
Analyze complex datasets to solve business challenges and provide recommendations.
Collaboration & Strategy
Work closely with Business, Tech, and Data teams to align on priorities and insights.
Translate stakeholder needs into effective data solutions.
Deliver clear, data-driven insights to support strategic decision-making.
You will work closely with Product team on the product roadmap and help them on applying analysis like A/B test
Team Development & Best Practices
Help grow and structure the Data Analytics team by sharing knowledge and mentoring junior members.
Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis, visualization, and architecture.
Stay on top of emerging tools and methodologies to optimize our processes.




ðŸ”Ž About you

You have 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst with advanced skills in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Metabase, Tableau).
You have significant experience with modern data stacks (BigQuery, dbt) and a strong focus on detail and precision.
You simplify complex findings into clear, actionable insights for diverse stakeholders and decision-makers.
You demonstrate adaptability and proactivity, enabling you to thrive in dynamic and challenging work environments.
Teamwork is key for you: you enjoy mentoring others while continuing to grow and learn.
You are fluent in English and excited to work in an international team.




ðŸŽ‰ Our Perks

Remote Work Culture: Located in Paris with possibility of two remote working days per week but also you can you can work in all Ageras offices: Berlin, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Poland
Office Perks: Complimentary tea, coffee, refreshments, fruits, and snacks available daily.
Career Growth Opportunities: Build a successful career with ample opportunities for professional growth within the firm.
Team Building and Events: Participate in biannual team-building activities and summer/winter corporate events.




ðŸ’š Our recruitment process

1ï¸âƒ£ A 45â€™ introductory call with AnnaÃ¯g (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to learn more about each other and give you an overview of Ageras.

2ï¸âƒ£ A 90â€™ interview with Saghar (Lead Data Analyst) to discuss your experience, dive into the role, and evaluate your SQL skills.

3ï¸âƒ£ A 30' business case presentation, where youâ€™ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

Title: Impact Analyzer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.


What we look for:


Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
Business viability mindset.
New business model experience
Customer journey understanding.
Lifecycle management.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Workshop animation.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you ready to play a crucial part in transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions and improve operational efficiency across the business service organization? Then we would love to hear from you!

The role will be based in Billund campus, Denmark. Please note there is no relocation budget for this position.


Core Responsibilities





Collect, clean, and analyze large sets of data from various sources.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using BI tools, full proficiency in Power BI tool, including DAX and Power Query is a requirement.
Identify business trends and provide insights for process improvement.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and provide actionable insights (Global Process Owner, IT & other stakeholders)
Present findings and recommendations to leadership in a clear and concise manner.
Perform creation, maintenance, documentation, improvement & decommissioning of reports
Drive reporting standardization and definitions alignment
Assist with the design and implementation of data-driven strategies for business growth.
Training and daily support of users in BI reporting, governance and data-analysis
Stay updated on BI best practices, tools, and technologies.




Play your part in our team succeeding

You will be based in Billund and joining Service Experience team within Business Service Organization (BSO), covering Business Account Management, Service Management, Continuous Improvement & Business Process Management, Insights Hub and Experience Hub teams.

In this role, you will need to define and facilitate delivery of reporting requirements as well as participate in projects requiring Business Intelligence knowledge.

Do you have what it takes?

You bring several years of hands-on experience in Business Intelligence and data analysis, with a proven ability to develop in BI tools like Power BI and Tableau. You've used these skills to turn complex data into clear, impactful visual stories that support better decision-making. Along the way, you've also gained familiarity with the Databricks platform, which has strengthened your ability to navigate large-scale data environments. You're passionate about uncovering insights and applying data visualization best practices to communicate them effectively. Known for your sharp analytical thinking, you thrive in collaborative settings and have a natural talent for translating technical concepts into language that resonates with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Whatâ€™s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances â€“ All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount â€“ We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Childrenâ€™s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Childrenâ€™s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGOÂ® team today.

Title: Business Intelligence, Internship, Lystrup
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in an international high-tech company that operates within specialized areas like aerospace, defence, security, and space? Our Business Intelligence Team within the Finance Systems & Business Intelligence department offers a unique opportunity for a passionate student who wants to be part of our internal talent pipeline.

We are facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes, as we deliver advanced technologies and mission critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industry. Our systems provide security for people on land, at sea and in the air. Therefore, we are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Intern to become part of this journey and contribute to our overall purpose â€“ securing people through advanced technology.

Your role in our team

We are currently facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes. We are looking for a highly motivated BI Intern to become part of this journey and to join our Finance Systems & Business Intelligence department in Lystrup, which has a variety of responsibilities.

We offer an exciting position where you can start building your dream career. We will focus on your professional and personal development, and you will have the opportunity to make your mark in a dynamic company. You will experience a variety of tasks and the opportunity to apply your theoretical skills in practice. We pride ourselves on maintaining an open working environment where we support each other to stay focused, committed, and motivated to deliver value to our colleagues throughout Terma.

As a BI Intern at Terma, you will be part of a company with many engaged and knowledgeable employees, where technology, innovation, strategy, and continuous improvements drive everything we do. You will work closely with skilled colleagues and on exciting projects.

How You Will Make a Meaningful Contribution

Your key responsibilities include:


Assist in the development and maintenance of BI reports and dashboards
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in our BI solutions
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our BI processes
Participate in data analysis and visualization projects
Support the team in ad-hoc data requests and troubleshooting


Bring your world class expertise into play

You are fluent in English both in writing and verbal at a professional level. Danish is an advantage but not a requirement


We are looking for an Intern studying at the Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s level within Business Intelligence, Data Science, Finance, or a similar field of study
Familiarity with BI tools such as MS Power BI, SQL, or DAX is a plus


As a person, you bring a positive, can-do attitude and you thrive on turning theory into action. You are self-driven, detail-oriented, and not afraid to juggle multiple tasks at once. Collaboration comes naturally to you, and you take pride in delivering high-quality work on time.

The key points to success in our team are to show commitment, work with passion both in groups and independently, have an outgoing and proactive personality, curiosity, and show initiative in the daily work. You solve your tasks within set deadlines and with a strong focus on quality and detail, of course in close cooperation with your colleagues. You work in a structured manner, make things happen, and identify and deal with issues proactively. You are a good communicator and understand the importance of cross-functional cooperation.

We are an international company representing world class expertise, delivering complex and high-tech products. We value our colleagues and our meaningful contributions to securing people through advanced technology. You will also experience that we have a strong focus on your development, teaching you useful new competences and further strengthening current ones, both professionally and personally. Our company culture is autonomous and engaging, and we acknowledge the importance of flexibility in a great working environment.

When joining Terma, we promise that you will experience: Great people, challenging tasks, world-class expertise, and meaningful contribution in your daily work.

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

If you would like to take on the challenge of working in an innovative company, we look forward to receiving your application. A resume is required, while a cover letter is optional. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

Do you have any questions regarding the position?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: osp@terma.com

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Bear In Mind That Both Candidates And The Candidateâ€™s Adult Household Members, For This Position Must Be Able To Obtain a Security Clearance By The Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This Entails Among Other Issues


Full household as a minimum have stayed within NATO/EU countries for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad, and
None of the full household have committed serious criminal offences.


Terma group has headquarters in Denmark and is a high-tech company developing products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation.

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application Deadline

Ongoing

Title: Data Engineer (Student Assistant)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Management PrimeServ DK

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Student Assistant Data Engineer to join our Data Management department. This role offers an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data engineering, working with cutting-edge technologies and contributing to the development of our data infrastructure.

As a Student Assistant Data Engineer, you will support the team in managing and optimizing our data systems, ensuring data quality, and developing data pipelines. You will work closely with experienced data engineers and analysts to deliver high-quality data solutions.

You Will Play An Important Role In


Assisting in the design, development, and maintenance of data pipelines (ETL/ELT processes) using Azure services.
Writing and optimizing SQL queries for data extraction and transformation.
Supporting data modeling efforts to ensure data is structured effectively for analysis.
Implementing data quality checks and monitoring data integrity.
Developing and deploying machine learning and AI models in the cloud.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather data requirements and deliver data solutions.
Assisting in the development and maintenance data products documentation.
Conducting research and staying updated on the latest data engineering, AI, and cloud development trends and technologies.
Providing support in data visualization and reporting tasks.


We Imagine That You


Are currently enrolled in a university program (preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field that includes Business Analytics or AI).
Have a basic understanding of core data concepts, including data types, quality, governance, and security.
Have had an introduction to SQL and have touched upon concepts such as data modeling and pipelines.
Have some experience with programming languages such as Python.
Have an interest in AI and machine learning, with some knowledge of basic ML concepts.
Are familiar with data tools (e.g., Power BI or Excel) and can create basic reports and dashboards.
Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Are able to work independently and as part of a team.
Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Are fluent in English.


Benefits


Gain hands-on experience in data engineering and data management.
Help solve real business problems using ML or AI models.
Work in a dynamic and supportive environment.
Flexible working hours to accommodate your academic schedule.
Opportunity to contribute to significant data and AI projects and make an impact.


Welcome to Data Management in PrimeServ DK

Our department is dedicated to managing and optimizing the organization's data assets. We work collaboratively to ensure data quality, develop data solutions, and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. Our team values innovation, continuous learning, and teamwork.

Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

We offer you an opportunity to help shape the world of tomorrow â€“ whether you are just starting out, taking your first career steps after graduation, or looking for the next big career challenge.

At MAN Energy Solutions, we focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture. We believe that a diverse workforce with a mix of gender, nationalities, and perspectives will drive innovation, creativity and productivity. We are committed to our employeesâ€™ well-being, and you will have the opportunity to join different social activities from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.

We prioritize work-life balance, offering flexible working hours, the possibility of working from home, and mental well-being including health insurance and focus on work atmosphere. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship.

In 2027, MAN Energy Solutions will move to Trekroner in Roskilde. Here we will consolidate all our current locations on Zealand into one large site.

About The Student Network

The MAN Student Network is a community made for students by students at MAN Energy Solutions Denmark. The network has the purpose of connecting students in Denmark with the benefit of establishing strong academic and social relationships across group departments, but also as an opportunity to expand the academic network, which ultimately may prove to provide the first full scale step toward a future career at MAN Energy Solutions.

The students within the network have the opportunity to provide recommendations and improvements and actively affect the concept of this network.

About MAN Energy Solutions


250 years of experience in advanced engineering
We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe
We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy
We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are more than 2,500 passionate employees from over 55 nationalities


Build your own future

Please submit your application to us no later than Wednesday, the 30th of April, 2025. We will conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Francisco Moreano Lasso by phone (+45) 81 75 80 58. More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com .

In MAN Energy Solutions, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position. Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.
Show more
HTML:
Data Management PrimeServ DK

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Student Assistant Data Engineer to join our Data Management department. This role offers an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data engineering, working with cutting-edge technologies and contributing to the development of our data infrastructure.

As a Student Assistant Data Engineer, you will support the team in managing and optimizing our data systems, ensuring data quality, and developing data pipelines. You will work closely with experienced data engineers and analysts to deliver high-quality data solutions.

You Will Play An Important Role In

  • Assisting in the design, development, and maintenance of data pipelines (ETL/ELT processes) using Azure services.
  • Writing and optimizing SQL queries for data extraction and transformation.
  • Supporting data modeling efforts to ensure data is structured effectively for analysis.
  • Implementing data quality checks and monitoring data integrity.
  • Developing and deploying machine learning and AI models in the cloud.
  • Collaborating with stakeholders to gather data requirements and deliver data solutions.
  • Assisting in the development and maintenance data products documentation.
  • Conducting research and staying updated on the latest data engineering, AI, and cloud development trends and technologies.
  • Providing support in data visualization and reporting tasks.

We Imagine That You

  • Are currently enrolled in a university program (preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field that includes Business Analytics or AI).
  • Have a basic understanding of core data concepts, including data types, quality, governance, and security.
  • Have had an introduction to SQL and have touched upon concepts such as data modeling and pipelines.
  • Have some experience with programming languages such as Python.
  • Have an interest in AI and machine learning, with some knowledge of basic ML concepts.
  • Are familiar with data tools (e.g., Power BI or Excel) and can create basic reports and dashboards.
  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Are able to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Are fluent in English.

Benefits

  • Gain hands-on experience in data engineering and data management.
  • Help solve real business problems using ML or AI models.
  • Work in a dynamic and supportive environment.
  • Flexible working hours to accommodate your academic schedule.
  • Opportunity to contribute to significant data and AI projects and make an impact.

Welcome to Data Management in PrimeServ DK

Our department is dedicated to managing and optimizing the organization's data assets. We work collaboratively to ensure data quality, develop data solutions, and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. Our team values innovation, continuous learning, and teamwork.

Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

We offer you an opportunity to help shape the world of tomorrow â€“ whether you are just starting out, taking your first career steps after graduation, or looking for the next big career challenge.

At MAN Energy Solutions, we focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture. We believe that a diverse workforce with a mix of gender, nationalities, and perspectives will drive innovation, creativity and productivity. We are committed to our employeesâ€™ well-being, and you will have the opportunity to join different social activities from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.

We prioritize work-life balance, offering flexible working hours, the possibility of working from home, and mental well-being including health insurance and focus on work atmosphere. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship.

In 2027, MAN Energy Solutions will move to Trekroner in Roskilde. Here we will consolidate all our current locations on Zealand into one large site.

About The Student Network

The MAN Student Network is a community made for students by students at MAN Energy Solutions Denmark. The network has the purpose of connecting students in Denmark with the benefit of establishing strong academic and social relationships across group departments, but also as an opportunity to expand the academic network, which ultimately may prove to provide the first full scale step toward a future career at MAN Energy Solutions.

The students within the network have the opportunity to provide recommendations and improvements and actively affect the concept of this network.

About MAN Energy Solutions

  • 250 years of experience in advanced engineering
  • We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe
  • We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy
  • We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are more than 2,500 passionate employees from over 55 nationalities

Build your own future

Please submit your application to us no later than Wednesday, the 30th of April, 2025. We will conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Francisco Moreano Lasso by phone (+45) 81 75 80 58. More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com .

In MAN Energy Solutions, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position. Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Lead & Shape the Future of Marketing Analytics at Lunar!

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm ðŸš€

So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.

As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to lead and develop our marketing analytics function. This is a pivotal role where you will take full ownership of our marketing data strategy, driving advanced analytics and automation to optimize marketing ROI and scale our growth across the Nordics.

Be in the Driverâ€™s Seat

As our new Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you wonâ€™t just be working with dataâ€”you will be shaping and evolving the way we leverage data across marketing. You will set the vision for how we use analytics to fuel our marketing efforts, establish best practices, and build a function that delivers high-impact insights and measurable business outcomes.

Youâ€™ll be based in Copenhagen, embedded within our Audience and Acquisition team, reporting to Sally Armstrong. The team currently comprises 5 amazing individuals focused on leveraging data-driven insights to fuel customer acquisition and engagement within the broader Marketing function, led by Manuel Douchez. But youâ€™ll be the one steering the marketing analytics ship - driving strategy, developing methodologies, and making sure data is at the heart of every decision we make.

What Will You Do?

Set and drive the strategy for marketing analytics, defining how we measure and optimize marketing effectiveness.

Establish and implement best practices for data analysis, reporting, and visualization, ensuring marketing performance is continuously improved.

Lead and innovate in advanced attribution modeling, leveraging machine learning, MMM (Marketing Mix Modeling), and Bayesian techniques to optimize marketing investments.

Develop and champion best-in-class marketing measurement methodologies, ensuring data integrity and actionable insights.

Take ownership of incrementality testing and media experimentation to enhance ROI and inform strategic decision-making.

Collaborate cross-functionally with data teams in Commercial, Product, and Finance to ensure alignment in methodologies, shared learnings, and commercial impact.

Act as the key strategic partner for marketing leadership, providing data-driven recommendations that shape our marketing approach.

Automate marketing analytics processes, leveraging AI and cutting-edge tools to enhance efficiency and insight generation.

Serve as the go-to expert for marketing data, ensuring all marketing initiatives align with broader business intelligence efforts.

Curious About the Lunar Culture? ðŸ’š

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. Itâ€™s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, weâ€™re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

Is This You? Letâ€™s Find Out!

Weâ€™re looking for someone who is eager to take ownership, build something incredible, and truly shape the future of marketing analytics at Lunar. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

Proven experience in a marketing data analytics or business intelligence role, ideally with a strong commercial focus.

Expertise in advanced attribution models, including MMM, machine learning, Bayesian techniques, and media mix modeling.

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools.

Experience with Looker, Funnel.io, dbt, AWS, Redshift, Airflow, Git, or similar technologies.

Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and executive-level reporting.

A passion for automation, AI-driven analytics, and streamlining marketing data processes.

Experience working cross-functionally, ensuring data-driven marketing decisions are aligned with commercial goals.

Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.

Experience in high-volume, complex data environments such as fintech, banking, or large-scale consumer technology companies.

Are You Ready to Build the Future?

Apply now and letâ€™s explore how you can take Lunarâ€™s marketing analytics to the next level!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what weâ€™re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases ðŸ“¢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what itâ€™s like to work here ðŸ“¸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! ðŸ“±ðŸ«°

Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: Student Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Student Quantitative Analyst

At MFT Energy, we are at the forefront of energy trading, driving market efficiency, and facilitating the green transition. We are seeking a talented student quantitative analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team trading European power. Collaborate with experienced professionals, who are dedicated to excellence every day.

About The Role

As a Student Quantitative Analyst, you will play an instrumental role in our dynamic Intraday team. You will work alongside highly skilled quantitative analysts, machine-learning experts, execution-algo developers, system developers, and traders.

You will be part of a team working on machine-learning models that automatically execute in the market meaning you will get direct feedback on performance. With time, we will bring you into various decision-making processes as we believe in responsibility being a key driver for your success.

Your Key Responsibilities


Acquire and maintain data from external sources.
Contribute to existing trade signal frameworks.
Maintain and develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge.


Your Qualifications And Personal Skills


Studying: Data Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar.
A proactive approach and general interest in algorithmic trading.
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, etc. is considered a plus.
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail.
The ability to work independently and structure your workload.
A positive and competitive attitude but at the same time a valued team player.
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English.


Above all, we cherish passion and creativity. If you have made hobby projects, feel free to share them.

Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are more than 180 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in TÃ¼rkiye, Australia, New York City, and Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the bestâ€”we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.

We Offer


A part-time student position with a high degree of influence and autonomy, requiring on-site presence at our Aarhus C office to foster close collaboration and learning
A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.


Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a CV, a short cover letter, and your grade transcript. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Deadline: As soon as possible.

Start date: Flexible.

We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

As a global and independent energy trading hub, we specialize in power, gas, and environmentals trading 24/7 in 41 countries. At MFT Energy, we innovate energy trading through our people and technology, supported by our unique partner model. Our belief is that fostering a sense of ownership among employees is the most effective way to advance our business.

Place: BrÃ¸ndby Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Product Analyst with Power BI skillsÂ 

Do you want a rare opportunity to make an extraordinaire impact as part of a great team?Â 

If you have a passion for telemetry, usage, and behavioral data â€“ and you know how to leverage Power BI in this context â€“ this role offers a unique career opportunity. As part of Milestoneâ€™s transformation, your expertise will be a key asset for future growth. In this role, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to shape how the company works with telemetry data, giving you significant influence and learning opportunities. Turn data into clear and insightful PowerBI dashboardsÂ

Title: Analyst (Student Assistant), Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company (CISC) - a service provider working exclusively for the global fund management company Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), is currently looking for an Analyst to join our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

The team and the role
As an Analyst in the Data & Analytics team, your core responsibilities revolve around utilizing Power Platform tools, such as Power Automate, Power Apps and Power BI, to improve and automate business processes to drive forward the digital agenda across CIP and CISC. You will be working closely with business intelligence specialists, data engineers and master data experts to elevate the scalability and efficiency of core processes.

You will play an important role in supporting the Data & Analytics department in executing on key initiatives, with a unique opportunity to work alongside many colleagues across various teams. The position is part-time (15-20 hours/week). Youâ€™ll reporting directly to our Master Data Manager.

Responsibilities will further consist of:

Developing and maintaining Power Platform solutions, particularly Power Apps and Power Automate
Scoping and refining new requests to suggest data-driven solutions
Understanding business processes to design fit-for-purpose Power Platform solutions.


You
We are looking for you, who are currently studying and are on your 2nd or 3rd year of your bachelor's degree or coming into your 1st year of your masterâ€™s degree studying Computer Science, IT relevant study in ITU, KU, DTU or Data Science at CBS. You are motivated and interested in data and data modeling.

Moreover, you have a sincere motivation for learning new things and are a highly organized and motivated individual who is thriving in a highly effective and innovative environment.

We look for the following in a candidate

Willing to learn or previous experience with Power Apps, Power Automate and Power BI
Good knowledge of Excel and knowledge of SQL and Python
Comprehensive, analytical and problem-solving skills
Close attention to detail and a high level of accuracy
Willingness to work in an international, efficient, and highly varied environment
Fluency in English, both verbal and written, as well as great communication skills towards technical and non-technical colleagues.


The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISCâ€™s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.



---



Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects â€“ from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Calling on Junior Data Engineer




At Maersk Tankers, our purpose is to pioneer shipping solutions for our partners and the planet. We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion to make this happen, including providing equal opportunities for all. We offer a global and flexible workplace where passion and engagement are met with opportunities to pioneer professional and personal development.




Your opportunity to join the adventure




In Technology, you will join a team of 6 talented and welcoming colleagues.

As a Junior Data Engineer, you'll be part of a dynamic team, developing and providing solutions for the IT Security and Platforms team. With a collaborative mindset, you'll work closely with team members and business product owners to understand, define, and develop solutions that enhance performance across the organization.

Are you part of the solution?

At Maersk Tankers, you can come as you are and be among people who will expand your horizon. As our new Junior Data Engineer, we do, however, expect that you can contribute with the following:




Bring enthusiasm and an open mind. Hereâ€™s what youâ€™ll be doing:




Translating business needs into technical designs and solutions: You'll learn to create and operate data integrations, and participate in or facilitate the prototyping of new solutions and technologies
Ingesting and cleaning data: You'll work with various data sources and formats, from internal operation data to external market data
Collaborating with business users: You'll contribute to creating concise and meaningful data assets that fit into our platform architecture
Operating data pipelines: You'll ensure high robustness, fault tolerance, and availability, making optimizations and scheduling improvements along the way
Maintaining CI/CD and data platform infrastructure: You'll keep the platform secure and robust while minimizing costs




Technologies you'll be working with:




Python Azure Functions for ingestion
Azure DevOps for CI/CD, repository storage, and package repository
PySpark and Scala Spark for data pipelines
Azure Synapse Analytics




Maersk Tankers | Calling New Horizons




Maersk Tankers is a service company that provides commercial management solutions for shipowners in the tanker industry, operating one of the largest tanker fleets in the world. Our purpose is to pioneer shipping solutions for our partners and the planet. Founded in 1928, we have a century of expertise in management of tankers, which we use to develop and deploy solutions that help shipowners boost the economic and environmental performance of their vessels. Maersk Tankers employs approximately 300 employees in Denmark, Singapore, United Kingdom, India and the U.S. and is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Do you want to join one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing energy trading companies and play a key role in building our new Macro Trading portfolio? Keep reading; we are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our newly established Macro Trading team.







In Macro Trading, we combine macroeconomic insights and data analysis with market-specific knowledge of power, gas, and emissions to generate trading decisions. The macro portfolio is like a start-up with a high degree of autonomy and the opportunity to explore new ideas to innovate and rethink European Energy Trading, while having the backing of a larger and mature organization, increasing the probability of success.




As a Quantitative Analyst, you will be key in building our quantitative macroeconomic framework. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with traders, quants, and other analysts to develop quantifiable and actionable analysis.




Your journey as a Quantitative Analyst

We seek a highly analytical and detail-oriented Quantitative Analyst with a dedicated focus on macroeconomics and econometrics to support our energy trading activities. In this role, you will leverage macroeconomic dataâ€”such as interest rates, inflation, and growth - and advanced econometric techniques to create proprietary models that forecast market prices and support our trading strategies.




The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the global macroeconomic landscape and how it influences commodity prices, energy supply, and demand, paired with exceptional skills in econometric modeling and quantitative research.




We will ensure you are ready to take on your new role by giving you the best possible introduction to the team, our business, and our organization. You will be introduced to our macroeconomic framework, and any potential knowledge gaps will be addressed to maximize your success.




At InCommodities, we do not believe in bureaucracy, stringent processes, or micro-management. Instead, we grant you high autonomy, which we believe unlocks greater engagement and ensures that the best decisions are made â€“ always by those closest to the job.'




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement econometric models that predict key macroeconomic variables
Incorporate macroeconomic factors to predict energy prices and supply-demand dynamics
Collaborate with traders and quants to translate macroeconomic data and econometric insights into actionable trading strategies.
Continuously monitor and refine models to reflect changes in the macroeconomic environment




Qualifications â€“ we imagine that you:

Hold a masterâ€™s degree or PhD in Economics, Finance, or a similar field with a focus on econometrics
Have experience with time-series analysis, forecasting, and other advanced econometric techniques
Possess excellent coding skills (Python is an advantage)
Preferably have knowledge of energy markets (oil, natural gas, electricity)
Have great communication skills enabling you to present complex macroeconomic insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders




Personal skills â€“ we expect that you:

Are super passionate and knowledgeable about econometrics
Actively follow and understand what is happening in the world of macroeconomics
Have a curious and competitive mindset
Can be direct with your colleagues in a constructive way
Can work independently with a strong drive towards achieving results
Are a team player who will do what is best for the team and InCommodities




What you can expect from us:

You will join a team of experienced colleagues and will have the opportunity to work closely together with quants, analysts, and traders to build a macro trading desk
We will provide you with opportunities to develop both professionally and personally
We will provide you with flexibility and autonomy to drive real impact
You will be part a unique company culture where we live up to our values: Honesty, Transparency, and Rethink and where you don't have to abide by a dress code or a strict hierarchy, so you won't be frustrated with too many rules, policies, or bureaucratic processes.




Practical details

Location: Aarhus N, Denmark

Full-time job




Application deadline: As soon as possible




If you have any questions, please contact:

Morten Kold, Head of Macro Trading

Mail: mkj@in-commodities.com

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Commercial Strategy & Management (Private & Business Banking)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a data-driven strategist ready to fuel growth in a dynamic fintech environment? Lunar is revolutionizing Nordic banking, and we need a Senior Business Data Analyst to optimize monetization, sales, and partnerships across our private and business platforms.

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm ðŸš€

So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.

As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Business Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across monetization, sales, and partnerships so that we can optimize growth and commercial impact.

As our new Senior Business Data Analyst, you will be part of our Commercial team, reporting to Christian Sillesen, Head of Commercial. The team currently comprises a talented and ambitious group across Copenhagen and Stockholm, working on enhancing Lunarâ€™s commercial performance through data-driven insights within the broader Commercial function, led by Mats Persson, Chief Commercial Officer.

What will you do?

Monetization Optimization: Analyze user behavior and optimize pricing, promotions, and revenue generation.

Sales Lead Generation & Performance: Leverage data to improve lead generation and develop predictive sales models.

Partnership Performance Analysis: Evaluate ROI and track performance of strategic partnerships.

Price & Deposit Analysis: Conduct pricing and deposit trend analysis and provide competitive insights.

Data-Driven Insights & Reporting: Extract, clean, and analyze data to generate actionable business insights.

Curious about the Lunar culture? ðŸ’š

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. Itâ€™s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, weâ€™re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

We're excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We canâ€™t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Who are you?

3-7 years experience as a Data Analyst (commercial/fintech/banking preferred).

Strong expertise in SQL (R, Python) and data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).

Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling.

Ability to analyze large datasets and extract key trends.

Strong understanding of commercial KPIs.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Experience with HubSpot or similar CRM systems is a plus.

Familiarity with pricing analysis and working with data engineers is a plus.

Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and letâ€™s find out more!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what weâ€™re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases ðŸ“¢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what itâ€™s like to work here ðŸ“¸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! ðŸ“±ðŸ«°

Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: Business Insights Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
JOB TITLE â€“ Business Insights Manager, Next Generation Products

LOCATION â€“ Copenhagen, Denmark

HOURS â€“ Full Time

About The Role

We are excited to offer an incredible opportunity as Business Insights Manager for Scandinavian Tobacco Groupâ€™s growing Next Generation Products team. In this pivotal role, you will be essential in tracking and following up upon our strategic initiatives through commercial insights. To succeed, you must be able to build up a strong understanding of market dynamics and translate findings into commercial actions across functions within our organizational teams. You will be responsible for tracking our global footprint and identifying our synergetic thresholds - internally and externally.

Your role as a self-reliant professional is crucial in our fast-paced environment. A key part of your role will involve ensuring clear communication and alignment within the organization, while fostering robust professional relationships. You will be reporting to the Head of Commercial Insights.

WHAT WILL YOU BE RESPONSIBLE FOR?


Collecting Data & Tracking of strategic and commercial initiatives:
Collecting data and insights across functions and teams to conduct analysis and reporting on commercial initiatives within our product life cycle: from P&L, budgets and forecasting to product launches, marketing initiatives and activations, market performances, growth tendencies and portfolio adaptions.
Develop and implement comprehensive tracking tools for our global performances and organizational teams, ensuring synergetic effects across markets are captured and distributed ongoingly.
Understand, develop and adapt strong methodological frameworks and reports to capture and consolidate our performances within organizational teams.
Lead and ensure a data driven approach to commercial initiatives, capturing enhancers of growth and profitability across markets.


Foster insights into strategic performance culture


Understand stakeholder capabilities, targets and ambitions and convert these into trackable KPIs.
Identify, evaluate and share insights ongoingly and ensure fostering of insights into tangible and trackable decisions across functions and teams.
Evaluate adaptability and scalability of local, regional and global know-how and winning formulars to build the NGP teamsâ€™ insights toolbox.
Assess global and local dynamics and convert proven concepts into trackable actions across organizational teams, ensuring synergetic effects.


Follow Up And Global Collaboration


Follow up on commercial and strategic decisions across teams via KPIs and ensure distribution of commercial insights to stakeholders.
Work closely with regional and local teams to adapt insights to local market needs and ensure successful growth.
Drive a cohesive approach to data management and decisions across markets, driving synergies and efficiencies globally.
Enable repeatability of proven concepts across functions.
Contribute to and drive data driven performance culture across global teams.


Performance driven approach through data


Collection, analysis and tracking of data canâ€™t stand alone in this role. You will be the enabler of translating and distributing insights into recommended actions to our global stakeholders across functions.
Our team will lead the exploration and validation of proven concepts through data and commercial insights.
We will conceptualize insights into tangible actions and trackable KPIs to ensure repeatability.
You will work closely with R&D, category, operational, marketing, and sales teams to ensure relevance and implementation of insights to reach the organizationâ€™s strategic targets and profitability.


WHAT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WILL BE REQUIRED?


3-5 years of experience as business and/or data analysist, ideally within multinational FMCG companies.
In-depth experience with BI-tools, Powerquery and Excel is required. PowerPoint skills and proven experience in utilizing other data analytics tools is a great plus.
Strong analytical skills and strategic thinking with a track record of identifying and capitalizing on growth opportunities.
Comfortable with ambiguity and ability to build assumptions based on limited data.
Desire to shape the role in line with the dynamic environment and evolving needs
Deep understanding of consumer behaviour, what drives their decisions and how we can adjust our strategies to fit their needs and expectations.
Excellent project management skills, with experience leading cross-functional teams & influence senior stakeholders.
Strong communication and relationship-building abilities across diverse global teams.
Fluency in English and ability to travel 5-10% of time.


OUR HIRING PROCESS

Requirements

Before we enter a hiring process, your job application will be reviewed by a member of our recruiting team. Your application will be reviewed in line with the hiring competencies we have for the role you have applied for. If your experience aligns with the requirements, you will enter our hiring process which will consist of the following:


Recruiter Screen
Hiring Manager Interview
Behavioral Assessment
Final Task


WHAT IS ON OFFER?

At Scandinavian Tobacco Group, we offer a competitive compensation package, including a generous pension scheme, healthcare, dental, and career development opportunities. We also provide you with the chance to be part of a dynamic, results oriented & global company that values continuous growth, sustainability with consumer at the heart of everything we do.

About Scandinavian Tobacco Group

Scandinavian Tobacco Group is a global leader in cigars and tobacco products, with a rich heritage dating back 250 years. Since our formation in 1961, we've grown into a truly international company, operating in over 100 countries with a diverse workforce of more than 10,000 employees representing numerous nationalities and cultures. Our success is built on a portfolio of iconic brands including Signature, Cohiba, Macanudo, CAO, and Partagas. We specialize in crafting cigars and tobacco products that are synonymous with moments that matter - celebrations, achievements, and life's special occasions. We're proud of our dynamic growth strategy, having successfully acquired and integrated multiple companies over the past decade. This approach has not only expanded our market presence but also enriched our organizational culture with diverse perspectives and expertise. Sustainability is at the heart of our operations. We're committed to minimizing our environmental footprint and implementing responsible practices across our supply chain. This dedication to sustainability extends to our relationships with employees, partners, and the communities where we operate. At Scandinavian Tobacco Group, we foster an inclusive, international work environment where collaboration and knowledge-sharing are key. We believe that our diverse team is our greatest strength, driving innovation and helping us to continuously evolve in a changing global market. We're always looking for talented individuals who share our passion for excellence and our commitment to creating a positive impact. By joining our team, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to a company that values creativity, embraces change, and encourages you to craft a career that truly makes you more. Whether you're collaborating with colleagues across continents, contributing to our sustainability initiatives, or helping to integrate newly acquired businesses, you'll be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking organization that's shaping the future of our industry.

Please be informed that this Direct Search is conducted exclusively by Scandinavian Tobacco Group. We do not accept applications from agencies, and we will not provide compensation for unsolicited CVs.
