Title: Senior Data Analyst - Commercial Strategy & Management (Private & Business Banking)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a data-driven strategist ready to fuel growth in a dynamic fintech environment? Lunar is revolutionizing Nordic banking, and we need a Senior Business Data Analyst to optimize monetization, sales, and partnerships across our private and business platforms.

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm ðŸš€




So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.




As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Business Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across monetization, sales, and partnerships so that we can optimize growth and commercial impact.




As our new Senior Business Data Analyst, you will be part of our Commercial team, reporting to Christian Sillesen, Head of Commercial. The team currently comprises a talented and ambitious group across Copenhagen and Stockholm, working on enhancing Lunarâ€™s commercial performance through data-driven insights within the broader Commercial function, led by Mats Persson, Chief Commercial Officer.




What will you do?

Monetization Optimization: Analyze user behavior and optimize pricing, promotions, and revenue generation.
Sales Lead Generation & Performance: Leverage data to improve lead generation and develop predictive sales models.
Partnership Performance Analysis: Evaluate ROI and track performance of strategic partnerships.
Price & Deposit Analysis: Conduct pricing and deposit trend analysis and provide competitive insights.
Data-Driven Insights & Reporting: Extract, clean, and analyze data to generate actionable business insights.




Curious about the Lunar culture? ðŸ’š

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. Itâ€™s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, weâ€™re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.




We're excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We canâ€™t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Who are you?

3-7 years experience as a Data Analyst (commercial/fintech/banking preferred).
Strong expertise in SQL (R, Python) and data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling.
Ability to analyze large datasets and extract key trends.
Strong understanding of commercial KPIs.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Experience with HubSpot or similar CRM systems is a plus.
Familiarity with pricing analysis and working with data engineers is a plus.




Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and letâ€™s find out more!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what weâ€™re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases ðŸ“¢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what itâ€™s like to work here ðŸ“¸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! ðŸ“±ðŸ«°




Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: Data Engineering Student Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Drive Meaningful Change

Are you ready to support a dynamic Data Engineering team and grow your skills in building scalable data solutions? Join our team at Abacus Medicine Group, where youâ€™ll play an integral role in developing and maintaining data pipelines while contributing to impactful projects. You will be part of a fast-paced, collaborative environment, gaining hands-on experience and enhancing your technical capabilities.

Get a Glimpse of Our World

The Data Engineering team is a growing team of skilled professionals responsible for building and maintaining the backbone of our companyâ€™s data ecosystem. We work closely with various departments and stakeholders, ensuring that data infrastructure and workflows run smoothly and efficiently. We value curiosity, innovation, and collaboration, making this an exciting place to grow both professionally and personally.

As a Data Engineering Student Analyst, you will work alongside experienced Data Engineers, supporting various teams while contributing to the development and optimization of our data infrastructure. If youâ€™re looking for a fast-moving and dynamic team where you can apply your skills and learn new technologies, this is the right place for you.

Realize Your Opportunities as Data Engineering Student Analyst

The Data Engineering Student Analyst will support the Data Engineering team in developing, maintaining, and optimizing data pipelines and infrastructure. You will work on data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, monitor and troubleshoot workflows, and collaborate with different teams to improve our data systems.

Your Main Responsibilities Include


Developing and maintaining data pipelines that extract, transform, and load data from various sources.
Monitoring and troubleshooting data workflows, identifying and resolving issues proactively.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and design scalable data solutions.
Optimizing data storage and retrieval processes to enhance system performance.
Staying up to date with emerging data engineering trends and contributing to continuous improvements.


Fuel for Your Success in the Role

We are looking for someone who is proactive, curious, and eager to learn, with a strong interest in data engineering. You should be comfortable working independently while also contributing to a collaborative team.

Furthermore, We Hope The Following Points Describe You


You have 2 to 3 years left of your education in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
You have proficiency in Python and an understanding of SQL.
You can work independently while also being a strong team player.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud) is an advantage, but not required.
Prior knowledge of the Azure data stack (Data Factory, Databricks, Data/Delta Lake) is a strong advantage but not required.
You have strong communication skills in English and a proactive mindset.


Would you like to know more about us?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.

Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.

Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, youâ€™ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. Youâ€™ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Title: Commercial Insight Specialist
Description:
Apply now Â»

08/04/2024

DNK-Randers, Danish Crown Vej

Commercial Insight Specialist

Do you want to accelerate your career in an international food company? Do you have a solid analytical mindset and thrive in a data-driven environment? Are you motivated by creating actionable business insights from large datasets? Then you might be the Commercial Insight Specialist we are looking for.

Join us on our journey towards creating a more sustainable future for food

Danish Crown is on a transformation journey to becoming an international food company through a dedicated focus on creating even better products and brands for the benefit of consumers. In our Commercial Insight team, we contribute to this journey by turning data into fact-based insights and recommendations for how to deliver on the commercial agenda. As our new Commercial Insight Specialist, you will join a team of five skilled and dedicated colleagues who are working together in a professional and informal atmosphere to deliver the best solutions for our stakeholders. The team is anchored in our Global Sales & Categories organization, and we are responsible for driving key processes around commercial development and insights.

Gain Valuable Experience With Commercial Tasks

Specifically, you will become part of the Commercial Insight team that supports our global sales and category organizations with analytical tools, insights, and recommendations for data-driven commercial decision-making. Together with your colleagues you will be working on quantitative analyses that provide insights into our categories and customers. We are working as internal consultants and you will be involved in all phases of the analysis, from defining the problem, driving the analysis, translating it into actionable recommendations and presenting your results. You will be the go-to person for selected sales and category teams, while you will also assume responsibility for some of our tools and data sources.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities Will Include


Acting as a trusted advisor for sales and category organisations on commercial insight topics
Analysing and optimizing our categories and customers from a data-driven perspective
Supporting on annual customer negotiations and category deep dives etc.
Preparing materials for presentations and communicating your findings to stakeholders
Developing tools and reports for the commercial business


Who are you?

You have a masterâ€™s degree within business or economics (e.g. cand.merc, cand.oecon or the like). Ideally, you have 2-4 years of experience from a similar position as Business Analyst, Data Analyst or Commercial Analyst. Alternatively, you can also be newly graduated with relevant experience from student job or internship. In both cases, you have above average skills in Excel and PowerPoint. If you have experience with PowerBI, PowerQuery or Think-cell it is a plus. You are proficient in both English and Danish.

As a person you are enthusiastic about working with numbers and see data as your most valuable resource. You can apply your commercial understanding to convert data into actionable insights and recommendations. At the same time, you manage to convey your messages through simple and visual PowerPoint-presentations. You are structured and thorough in your work and able to navigate ad hoc tasks and long-term projects at the same time. You have a good amount of curiosity and are motivated by following your tasks all the way through - even if there are bumps on the way there.

What do we offer? Glad that you asked!

Danish Crown isn't just a big player in the food industry; it's also a workplace with top-notch facilities and a lifestyle-oriented approach to employee well-being. Our brand new, sustainable headquarters (DGNB Heart Certification) provides an inspiring environment designed to foster collaboration and creativity.

In this position, you will have the opportunity to work closely with multiple stakeholders in one of Denmark's leading food companies. For the right candidate, the position can therefore also be a steppingstone towards a career in a large international food company.

Appetite for more?

If you are curious to hear more about the position before handing in your CV and motivated application, you are more than welcome to contact Director, Andreas Muff on +45 3089 1385.

Please send your CV and cover letter as soon as possible in Danish or English, as we evaluate and contact candidates continuously. We will remove the post once the right candidate is selected.

We are a food company owned by Danish farmers supplying high-quality food to customers and consumers all over the world. From butchers to business developers, weâ€™re more than 23,000 colleagues, all committed to lowering our carbon footprint and becoming climate neutral by 2050, for better food and a brighter future.

Job Segment: Sustainable Agriculture, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Intern, Social Media, Agriculture, Technology, Data, Entry Level, Marketing

Apply now Â»

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to drive data innovation in the automotive industry, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and big data solutions? Then you might be the Data Scientist we are looking for!




About Us

We are a global company specializing in online car auctions and IT solutions for the automotive industry. With more than 15 years of data across Europe, we are continuously growing and seeking a Data Scientist to help us commercialize our data and create value for our customers.




The Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing and automotive IT solutions, as well as business intelligence solutions for used vehicles and professional fleet management.

Headquartered in Denmark, the Autorola Group currently employs around 850 people and has branches in 19 countries across Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Asia-Pacific region.

Through an extensive network of companies, manufacturers, banks, leasing companies, and fleet managers, Autorola offers dealers worldwide the opportunity to acquire and market vehicles through auctions. Our product portfolio is complemented by our workflow management system, which enables the digital integration of individual customer processes throughout the entire vehicle lifecycle, as well as our artificial intelligence, which provides real-time indicators for developments in the used car market.







Your Role

Reporting to the Head of Data Science in our Business Unit, Indicata, you will play a key role in building and maintaining our big data platform, supporting various markets with data insights, Power BI dashboards, and developing data science solutions that enhance our appraisal engine and forecasting capabilities.




Your key responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining our big data platform, including building out the data lake.
Engaging in platform discussions and collaborating on data architecture.
Utilizing SQL, Python, R, and Power BI for data analysis and dashboard creation.
Working closely with the Data Engineer to prepare datasets for analysis.
Designing and executing complex data analyses across multiple markets.
Commercializing data insights to add value to our customers.
Ensuring data quality and optimizing existing algorithms.
Supporting and potentially developing machine learning solutions over time.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.







Your Profile

We imagine you have at least 2 years of relevant experience, but we are also open to recent graduates with the right motivation and approach. Additionally, we expect you to have:

Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and Power BI.
Experience with Spark and Databricks is a plus.
Strong commercial acumen and the ability to translate data insights into business value.
Experience in creating Power BI dashboards for complex data analysis and forecasting.
A methodological approach to problem-solving and improving data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with the â€œTeam Data Science Processâ€ or similar to be able to work structured and independently on own projects.
The ability to work both independently and collaboratively with stakeholders.
A willingness to learn about the automotive industry and its data ecosystem.







What We Offer

Autorola A/S is a global company with over 850 employees and 19 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific.

You will get the opportunity to work for a fast-growing company that collaborates with some of the strongest brands in the automotive industry. Our environment is characterized by an informal and easygoing communication culture. Our headquarters is located right by the railway station at Skibhusvej 52 A, 5000 Odense C.




You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as have the chance to participate in company social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and a Friday bar to end the week on a high note.




Want to Join the Team and Have an Impact on the Future?

We are looking to fill the position as soon as possible, so if you see yourself thriving in the above-mentioned tasks, we look forward to receiving your application.




Even if you do not meet all the ideal requirements, we encourage you to apply, as we strongly believe in inclusion and diversity.




We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the advertisement once we find the right candidate.




If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, by phone at +45 31624481.

Title: Quantitative analyst for US short-term power trading
Description:
Are you curious and passionate about financial markets? If you have just graduated and want to gain hands-on experience and a deep understanding of the American energy sectorâ€”this could be the opportunity for you to become our new Quantitative Analyst for US short-term power trading!

Hereâ€™s what the job entails
In this role, you will support the US short-term trading team in their daily operations and help transform strategies into algorithms.

Your key responsibilities will include:

carrying out market analyses and testing hypotheses using the coding languages Python and SQL
building and maintaining trading and data visualisation tools
developing trading algorithms



Meet the team
As our new Quantitative Analyst, you will join our US Short-Term Power Trading team in Aarhus, where we trade both financial and physical power across all North American markets.

You will be part of a close-knit, dedicated team of five colleagues who motivate, support and challenge one another. We thrive on curiosity and innovation, and we are always seeking new ways to enhance our strategies and processes.

But enough about usâ€¦ over to you!
Since we operate in a fast-paced, ever-changing market, we are looking for someone who thrives in dynamic environments and adapts quickly. An innovative mindset, a natural drive to take responsibility and a deep curiosity about our field will be your strongest assets.

We also imagine that you:

are currently pursuing or have completed a degree in Economics, Finance, Mathematics or a related field
have an interest in coding with Python and SQLâ€”and already possess some coding experience
are proficient in English, both written and spoken



Please note that prior knowledge of the energy sector is not required for this role.

Weâ€™ll take good care of you
At Danske Commodities, we take great care of our people. Joining us means youâ€™ll get a lot of great perks â€“ including social events, cultural experiences, tasty food and benefits to better your health, your life and your future.

Here are some of the benefits we offer our employees:

Flexible working hours including the opportunity to work part-time as well as the option to work from home up to two days per week
Vast development opportunities with the help of your own individual development plan, access to our DC University with 50+ courses as well as remote courses through Harvard Learning
Global career prospects as part of the Equinor group with +20,000 colleagues across the world
10% paid pension as well as a beneficial health care and insurance package
Great parental leave conditions from day one including 26 weeks of paid maternity leave, 16 weeks of paid paternity/co-parent leave, paid pension while on leave and the opportunity to join â€˜Inspired Beyond Babiesâ€™
Unlimited paid childrenâ€™s sick days no limit on paid absence days in relation to child sickness
Fuel Fridays a monthly Friday off with pay, except for July and December, to fuel your energy
Extra days off five, to be exact - adding to the standard five weeks off each year
Senior days if youâ€™re over 55 years old
Bonus scheme
Share savings meaning you have the opportunity to participate in our parent company Equinorâ€™s attractive share savings programme
Paid at home internet and equipment including a mobile phone with paid subscription and IT equipment for when working from home
100+ yearly social and professional events including DC Sports and DC Talks events, gatherings in our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, CS:GO team and more
Various free tickets to family-friendly and cultural attractions
Discounts at hotels, restaurants, sports clubs and more
Organic food including a light breakfast, lunch buffet and snacks throughout the day
An office in the heart of Aarhus right next to the central train station



Recruitment process and relocation
You can read more about our recruitment process here. Please note that if you are an international candidate, we will reimburse travel expenses in connection with potential interviews and support you with the relocation process.

What weâ€™re about
We're a tech-driven energy trading company present in +40 markets across five continents. Our +600 people are driven by a need to constantly better things. If you are too, we could very well be the right place for you. You'll join a collective of thinkers and doers. Aspiring chefs, runners, parents, beekeepers, gamers â€“ the list goes on. We're highly specialised experts within our fields. But itâ€™s actually our diversity of ideas weâ€™re most proud of, which is why we continuously work on strengthening an inclusive culture where diverse teams thrive.

Our organisation is flat with an open-door policy. We expect you to care. About your work. About your own and your colleaguesâ€™ collective successes. And about the difference we make at Danske Commodities. Together with our parent company Equinor, we have the vision and strength to accelerate the energy transition and make an impact. Like no other.

In summer 2025, we'll be moving to our brand-new headquarters in Aarhus. Our future home, Akson, will be located in Sydhavnskvarteret â€“ a vibrant district where business meets culture. On top of being in this urban oasis, weâ€™ll enjoy state-of-the-art facilities â€“ including our own barista coffee shop, modern fitness facilities and breathtaking views that will make every day at the office even sweeter. We can't wait.

Title: Data Engineer, Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer, Data & Analytics, Global IT

Are you passionate about data? Do you have experience in preparing data to facilitate innovative analytics solutions? Do you aspire to empower businesses to employ self-service analytics in a global organization focused on brain health? If that sounds like you, Lundbeck wants to hear from you!

Your new role

You will contribute to empower our business to leverage and gain value from our state-of-the-art data platform within an ambitious, dynamic & international team.

Collaborating with fellow data engineers, data professionals in our business units, and other stakeholders in cross-functional teams, you will contribute to creating and enabling impactful data products to our global lines of business in R&D, commercial, and manufacturing.

Working as a data engineer at Lundbeck, you will get a unique opportunity to leverage advanced technologies together with motivated colleagues in a company committed to restoring brain health.

Your future team

As our data engineer, you will join a team committed to bringing cutting-edge data platform technologies and bespoke data deliveries to the Lundbeck business based on best-practice data management principles.

We leverage dbt and Snowflake as the core of our data deliveries, using Python and SQL as our go-to languages for development. The rest of our stack is mainly focused on enabling efficient DataOps and we strive to build things right. Upon joining, we'll provide comprehensive onboarding to get you up to speed on our DevOps, and DataOps tools.

The Data & Platform team is part of our new Data & Analytics department in Global IT, a department currently consisting of approx. 25 data-, software-, and AI engineers. We are on a mission to provide innovative solutions to the whole of Lundbeck focusing on unlocking the value of our data.

What You Bring To The Team

Whether your greatest strength is in solving technical challenges or igniting enthusiasm in delivering quality products, your colleagues would agree that you are a role model in collaboration and co-creation, and that you are technically adept. You are passionate about leveraging technology to deliver best-in-class data models.

In addition, you have:


Minimum of a bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent.
Extensive experience ingesting, preparing, modeling and orchestrating data in data engineering or similar role, for example in sales, manufacturing, or research domains.
Advanced ability to collaborate in cross-functional teams, effectively interpreting and translating user requirements into practical data solutions.
Experience with bridging the gap between technical teams and business stakeholders is beneficial.
Familiarity with developing BI products and dashboards is advantageous.



Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace and innovative culture, where our curiosity, accountability and adaptability enable us to transform lives. We want to go faster and further on addressing the big unmet needs of people living with brain disorders. We offer rewarding careers with a mix of exciting tasks and development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

We need every brain in the game, and at Lundbeck, we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but youâ€™re not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include your motivation for applying. No separate cover letter is needed. We ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

If you have questions or want to hear more, please feel free to contact Kjetil Lavik, Head of Data & Platform at kjla@lundbeck.com.

Applications must be received by 4th of May, but donâ€™t wait to apply as we will be having interviews ongoingly.

Learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com, LinkedIn or Instagram (@h_lundbeck).

#EveryBrainInTheGame

This job ad is intended for individuals seeking a career opportunity with Lundbeck. We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.

Title: VIE - Data Analyst, Denmark, Engesvang
Description:
How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?

Specialty Gases is a team of 7 experienced colleagues with different ages and gender. We work between 7:00-16:00 producing different mixtures every day were no day is as the previous one. The laboratory is a team of 3 experienced women with good routines and procedures. We work very close together and enjoy the work as well as the breaks.

The goal is to achieve an accreditation for ISO 17025 (Laboratory) & ISO 17034 (Specialty Gases) to provide a better variety of products with shorter leadtimes to our customers in the Nordics. This is important for Air Liquide to achieve profitable growth in the Nordics.

You will be the project manager on this way ensuring that we will stay on track, use our resources in the best way and bring the results and stakeholders together to achieve the goal. The main interactions will take place with the specialty gas team and the laboratory as well as the accreditation body but also colleagues and experts in Europe. The project will benefit from the experience of other plants in europe that already have achieved the accrediation.

The mission requires very good English communication skills in both verbal and writing with people at various level internally as well as externally.

___________________

Are you a MATCH?

Educational Qualifications:


Masterâ€™s degree in Chemical Engineering or a related field, with a specialization in chemistry, physics, mathematics, or similar disciplines.



Essential Skills and Competencies:


Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
Strong sense of responsibility, open-mindedness, and a results-driven mindset.
Highly motivated and committed to achieving project goals.
Proficient in uncertainty calculations and preparation of official reports.
Advanced skills in Google Sheets for data analysis and reporting.



Nice to have:


Strong interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders
Proven experience in project planning and leadership.
Expertise in data evaluation and analysis.
Familiarity with accreditation processes and standards.



Language:


Fluency in English (both written and spoken).
Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Norwegian, Danish, or Swedish) is advantageous



Please send the CV and cover letter in English.

Position open only for candidates eligible to the VIE program. Therefore, only the applicants meeting the requirements of the French V.I.E program will be taken into consideration. Please visit this website for more information about these requirements

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en/what-is-the-vie-french-international-internship-program

The V.I.E., an international young graduate program, enables young professionals who are less than 28 and European Union nationals to work for a French company in any country of the world. Becoming part of this program means going abroad to carry out a professional assignment for up to 24 months whilst benefiting from social care coverage and an interesting salary, which depends on the host country.

Business France, the French agency for international business development, is in charge of all the administrative procedures of your assignment. For further information, please visit the following link:

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en

Our Differences make our Performance

At Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.

We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.
Show more

Title: Digital Technology Early Career Student Worker(s), Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Our Digital Technology team share ideas and explore possibilities to make every LEGOÂ® experience awesome. We experiment, innovate and create to change the way our colleagues work, and LEGO fans play, all around the world.â€¯

Weâ€™re on the lookout for our next generation of digital talent. So, if you want to build a career full of support, learning, opportunities and play, join us.â€¯

Are you our future talent?

We view our student workers as the future talents of our organization. We provide opportunities for learning and growth, aiming to equip you with the skills needed to become strong candidates for full-time positions â€“ our mindset is Hire4Career.

We believe in fostering flexibility in career growth, ensuring that your studies can seamlessly integrate with work in a healthy balance.

As our student worker, you will be considered a full team member and you will from day one be an integral part of our Digital Technology teams, contributing to the development of a wide range of projects, and you will of course also have the opportunity to seek for internal internships an case collaborations with us, as part of our student worker program.

You are also invited to join our Early Career community organizing fun, energizing and social events for you can meet fellow student colleagues sharing a similar experience to yours. Read more about our student community, benefits and available facilities here Start en karriere i Digital Technology - Careers - LEGO.com

The Learning Journey we offer

During your journey with us, you will right from the start receive mentoring and training toward your passions and skills. We have 7 overall tracks in digital technology and within the tracks there is flexibility for you to be in the driver seat of your career and skills progression all supported by mentors and training we offer.

Within the tracks here youâ€™d focus onâ€¦





Software engineering â€¦ coding standards, development methodologies, and participating in the entire software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering to deployment e.g. front-end, back-end or full stack development within modern programming languages like Go, GoLang, C#, and more.â€¯
Data & AI, large-scale processing systems and databases. Data Science, Data Engineering, machine learning algorithms, data mining techniques, natural language processing, Phyton, LLM, Databricks and more.â€¯
Cloud Dev/Ops, platforms like AWS, Azure, Gen-AI, Kubernetes, GitHub Co-Pilot, cloud services, network architecture, and security practices to support cloud-based applications, data storage solutions and more.â€¯â€¯
Cybersecurity, protecting information systems, networks, and data from cyber threats and vulnerabilities. E.g. security principles, technologies, and practices, such as encryption, intrusion detection systems, secure software development and more.
Business Systems Engineering, ERP systems to setup, customization, and maintenance of ERP software to align with an organization's business processes e.g. work with engineering or configuration to streamline, automate business functions and more.â€¯â€¯
Digital product design, interfaces and experiences of digital products such as websites, mobile apps, and software applications with e.g. design principles, wireframing, prototyping, and user testing, to create intuitive and engaging products.â€¯â€¯
Digital Consulting & Product Management value delivery of a specific Digital product area and engage with business partners to conceptualize, assemble and ultimately effectively manage the lifecycle of digital projects, in the mindset of Agile to participate in successful implementation of technology solutions.â€¯




Do you have what it takes?

Weâ€™re hiring few student workers within Back-end and Full-Stack Engineering track in our Copenhagen Digital Hub, and weâ€™d love for you to bring curiosity, creativity, and a desire to grow with us!

To thrive in these roles, youâ€™ll likely be curious and energized by exploring product groups and technologies such as





C#, Typescript, Python, React â€“ Join Product Delivery Technology team, ideal for those passionate about building engaging user interfaces and robust applications.
Python, Databricks, AWS & Azure â€“ Join a digital marketing team using data to drive smarter decisions and boost the impact of our marketing investments.
Typescript, Node.js, AWS & Serverless â€“ Help power backend solutions as part of our Point of Sale (POS) team, contributing to seamless retail experiences.




These are examples of the tech stacks you might encounter depending on the product teams you join. Don't worry if you don't know them all â€“ weâ€™ll support you with mentoring and training along the way.

Weâ€™re looking for students who





Are currently enrolled in Denmark in a Bachelorâ€™s, Masterâ€™s, or Erhvervsakademi (professional academy) program in fields such as Computer Science, Software Development or a related digital discipline.
Preferably graduating 2027 or beyond having at least 2 years left of studies
Are curious and willing to learn, with a positive, team-player attitude.
Can be present 15â€“20 hours per week, ideally with 1â€“2 days at our Copenhagen Digital Hub.
Are passionate about digital technology and eager to contribute to real projects.




If you're interested in joining us, please prepare your CV and cover letter in English. Upon submission, you'll receive a questionnaire to help us learn more about you. This will help us better match with hiring managers seeking specific skills and passion.

The application portal will remain open from 7 April to 28 April 2025. If you are shortlisted, you will be invited to attend our Assessment Day on 15 May 2025 at our Digital Hub in Copenhagen. Following the Assessment Day, there will be one final interview round. The expected start date for successful candidates is either 1 July or 1 August 2025.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Whatâ€™s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances â€“ All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount â€“ We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Childrenâ€™s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Childrenâ€™s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGOÂ® team today.

Title: Senior Analyst
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Commercial Operation Performance (COP) is a newly established department within Market Operation, collaborating across Market & Channels, Operations, and Product Marketing & Development (PMD) to optimize commercial momentum, support commercial strategies, and drive commercial insights.

This is a great opportunity to join a strong & global team. You will help COP succeed with our ambition to inspire and develop more builders of tomorrow.

No relocation assistance is offered for this position


Core Responsibilities

Demand Planning Support and Analysis





Support Commercial Demand Review meeting by developing, maintaining, and refining methods to evaluate in-year and next-year Consumer Sales Plan and Demand Plan.
Analyze specific operational concerns (such as discrepancies in Demand Plans vs. actuals, low in-stocks, or high excess inventory) to identify root causes and propose actionable recommendations for improvement.
Assist in understanding the underlying drivers of Demand Planning KPI performance by conducting data analysis and preparing comprehensive reports for stakeholder review.




Commercial Scenario Planning Support and Analysis





Actively participate in the Commercial Scenario Planning process by gathering use cases, analyzing potential outcomes, and defining the likelihood of each identified scenario to drive cross-functional alignment with the Operations organization.
Responsible for coordinating, supporting, and developing proposals for discussion and approval in regional alignment meetings, creating recommendations for Global Commercial Scenarios used for capacity planning.




Contribute to Performance Improvements





Support various Global Commercial Operations projects that require analytical capabilities, ensuring timely and accurate analysis to drive operational efficiency.
Collaborate with the Commercial Operations Performance team and stakeholders in GCO and Global S&OP teams to optimize key performance measures for demand planning, order management, and retail inventory composition.




Play your part in our team succeeding

The Senior Analyst plays a critical role in gathering, analyzing, and defining the likelihood of scenarios to develop recommendations that drive informed decision-making across the Commercial and Operational organization of the LEGO Group. Through cross-functional collaboration, this role enhances demand planning accuracy and efficiency, supports meeting customer demand, optimizes inventory levels, and adapts to market dynamics, ultimately improving supply chain efficiency and customer satisfaction.

Do you have what it takes?





Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or relevant field if preferred
Strong analytical & Problem-solving abilities Ability to analyze complex data, identify patterns, and derive actionable insights and propose data-driven recommendations.
Advanced handling of MS Office programs, especially Excel and Power BI skills Proficiency in Excel, including data manipulation, formulas, and visualization.
Demand planning experience Prior experience in demand planning or related roles in a global organization. Familiarity with forecasting methods and demand planning systems
Collaboration and communication Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and present information clearly.
Business acumen Understanding of business dynamics & operation with the ability to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.




Nice to have





Supply Chain knowledge Understanding of supply chain management principles, processes and how demand planning integrates with other functions
Strong time-management and with the ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize, and participate in process improvement initiatives.
Statistical modeling skills, Advanced Analytics and modelling experience Expertise in using tools like Python or R for data manipulation and modeling.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Whatâ€™s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances â€“ All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount â€“ We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Childrenâ€™s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Childrenâ€™s Rights.

HTML:
Job Description

Commercial Operation Performance (COP) is a newly established department within Market Operation, collaborating across Market & Channels, Operations, and Product Marketing & Development (PMD) to optimize commercial momentum, support commercial strategies, and drive commercial insights.

This is a great opportunity to join a strong & global team. You will help COP succeed with our ambition to inspire and develop more builders of tomorrow.

No relocation assistance is offered for this position


Core Responsibilities

Demand Planning Support and Analysis



  • Support Commercial Demand Review meeting by developing, maintaining, and refining methods to evaluate in-year and next-year Consumer Sales Plan and Demand Plan.
  • Analyze specific operational concerns (such as discrepancies in Demand Plans vs. actuals, low in-stocks, or high excess inventory) to identify root causes and propose actionable recommendations for improvement.
  • Assist in understanding the underlying drivers of Demand Planning KPI performance by conducting data analysis and preparing comprehensive reports for stakeholder review.



Commercial Scenario Planning Support and Analysis



  • Actively participate in the Commercial Scenario Planning process by gathering use cases, analyzing potential outcomes, and defining the likelihood of each identified scenario to drive cross-functional alignment with the Operations organization.
  • Responsible for coordinating, supporting, and developing proposals for discussion and approval in regional alignment meetings, creating recommendations for Global Commercial Scenarios used for capacity planning.



Contribute to Performance Improvements



  • Support various Global Commercial Operations projects that require analytical capabilities, ensuring timely and accurate analysis to drive operational efficiency.
  • Collaborate with the Commercial Operations Performance team and stakeholders in GCO and Global S&OP teams to optimize key performance measures for demand planning, order management, and retail inventory composition.



Play your part in our team succeeding

The Senior Analyst plays a critical role in gathering, analyzing, and defining the likelihood of scenarios to develop recommendations that drive informed decision-making across the Commercial and Operational organization of the LEGO Group. Through cross-functional collaboration, this role enhances demand planning accuracy and efficiency, supports meeting customer demand, optimizes inventory levels, and adapts to market dynamics, ultimately improving supply chain efficiency and customer satisfaction.

Do you have what it takes?



  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or relevant field if preferred
  • Strong analytical & Problem-solving abilities Ability to analyze complex data, identify patterns, and derive actionable insights and propose data-driven recommendations.
  • Advanced handling of MS Office programs, especially Excel and Power BI skills Proficiency in Excel, including data manipulation, formulas, and visualization.
  • Demand planning experience Prior experience in demand planning or related roles in a global organization. Familiarity with forecasting methods and demand planning systems
  • Collaboration and communication Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and present information clearly.
  • Business acumen Understanding of business dynamics & operation with the ability to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.



Nice to have



  • Supply Chain knowledge Understanding of supply chain management principles, processes and how demand planning integrates with other functions
  • Strong time-management and with the ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize, and participate in process improvement initiatives.
  • Statistical modeling skills, Advanced Analytics and modelling experience Expertise in using tools like Python or R for data manipulation and modeling.



Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
TimeLog is a leading Professional Services Automation (PSA) software, dedicated to helping professional service organizations streamline business processes and boost productivity. TimeLog fills the GAP between Project Managers and the Finance Department in the consulting business, empowering Project Managers to manage project financials in a way compliant with the requirements set by finance.

We are currently looking for a skilled Data Engineer who is passionate about building and operating a robust data platform that enables powerful analytics, reporting, and insights across our product and organization.

ðŸ“¢ About The Position

As our new Data Engineer, you will serve as the primary technical driver for our data platform, which sits at the heart of all TimeLog data processing, reporting, and analytics â€“ both internal and customer-facing.

You will manage and evolve the entire data pipeline and ensure that our platform is performant, reliable, cost-efficient, and secure. This role combines hands-on responsibility for production data infrastructure with the opportunity to influence architectural decisions and data strategy in collaboration with our Senior Software Architect.

You will report to the Chief Product and Technology Officer and work closely with colleagues across software development, product, and infrastructure.

ðŸŽ¯ In This Role, Your Responsibilities Are

Data Platform Operations & Ownership


Manage and contribute to the entire data pipeline from source databases to analytics platforms
Monitor the production environment and maintain system reliability
Optimize data platform performance, cost and efficiency while ensuring high availability
Develop innovative approaches to data analysis and information generation
Ensure data governance, compliance, and quality across the platform


Developer Support & Enablement


Support developers in building reports and new processing pipelines
Make data accessible, well-documented, and reliable for internal and customer use


Strategic Contribution & Innovation


Collaborate closely with the Senior Architect to evolve the technical data architecture
Contribute to strategic data decisions and develop innovative solutions
Ensure data security and compliance with company and regulatory standards


ðŸ† Your Qualifications

Experience & Technical Skills


Strong hands-on experience with Databricks
Proficiency in Change Data Capture (CDC) methodologies
Good knowledge of relational database systems, specifically SQL Server
Experience with Delta Live Tables and stream processing
Working experience with Kafka and Debezium for data streaming
Understanding of data security principles and DataOps practices
Bonus: Some experience in data science or analytics tooling


Mindset & Collaboration


You take ownership of platform reliability and love making things run smoothly
You thrive in cross-functional teams and enjoy supporting others through data
Youâ€™re a structured problem-solver who can prioritize and execute effectively
You stay updated on modern data technologies and want to make an impact


ðŸŽ We Offer


A dynamic, inclusive company culture that promotes teamwork and innovation
Opportunities for professional growth and career development
Flexible working hours and a healthy work-life balance
Centrally located office in Copenhagen
A high-impact role where your work directly powers product and business decisions


ðŸ  Location:

You will be working from our offices in Copenhagen

Title: Sales Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our purpose is to bring hope to life by enabling life-changing therapies for patients around the globe, creating a healthier and happier tomorrow. Our mission is to work side by side with our customers in order to improve patientsâ€™ lives by bringing new biopharmaceuticals to market.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will play a key role in managing and optimizing data processes within the Business Development (BD) department at AGC Biologics. This position is responsible for overseeing ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) and SQL (Structured Query Language) processes, ensuring data quality and integrity, and creating impactful BD related data visualizations using Microsoft Power Platform tools. Acting as a data steward, the Business Intelligence Analyst will ensure that BD data is accessible, accurate, and trusted, while collaborating with stakeholders to deliver actionable insights and support decision-making. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in data management and visualization, with a focus on building databases and reports to drive business success.

Essential Job Duties/Responsibilities


Oversee and manage ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data efficiently from various sources.
Write, optimize, and maintain SQL queries to support data analysis and reporting needs.
Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards to provide actionable insights and support data driven decision-making.
Leverage the Microsoft Power Platform to automate workflows and enhance data accessibility from diverse sources (Snowflake, Salesforce CRM, Evaluate Pharma, etc.â€¦).
Manage the visualizations and reporting of the key performance indicators (KPIs) for the Business Development department.
Develop and deliver regular and ad-hoc reports to monitor performance and identify trends.
Ensure the correctness, completeness, and integrity of data in source databases to maintain high-level data quality.
Develop and deploy Business Intelligence applications for Sales analytics projects.
Implement processes and maintain a data inventory and data lineage to ensure transparency and traceability of data across the BD Dept, facilitating improvement in data quality.
Act as a data steward to ensure that Business Development data is accessible, usable, safe, and trusted and drives efficient decision making.
Establish and enforce data governance practices to maintain data security and compliance.
Work closely with BD stakeholders to understand their data needs, data related risks and provide tailored solutions to mitigate risks.
Serve as a trusted partner to support data-driven decision-making within the department.
Use business data to create compelling visuals and dashboards that communicate insights effectively.
Translate complex data into user-friendly insights for various audiences.
Design, build, and maintain databases to support the departmentâ€™s data needs.
Develop and deliver data reports that align with business objectives and priorities.
Support the digital transformation of the Lead to Contract process.
Create user guides and training materials for team members.
Recommend and help implement improvements to BI, business tools, data modeling and data management processes.


Leadership Skills


Integrates own development into daily tasks and prioritizes and acts on personal development.
Is aware of the impact of own tasks and improve day by day.
Performs tasks with the customer in mind and acts in due time to secure business results, maintaining high standards of quality.
Acts as a team player, promoting and living the AGC Biologics Core Values.
Cooperates across the organization.
Excels in area of expertise and contributes to the ongoing development of area of expertise.


Required

QUALIFICATIONS


Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Data Science, Business Intelligence/Analytics or a related field (or equivalent experience).
0-2 years of experience in digitalization, data management, or a related field (internship experience is acceptable).
Data savvy with the strong understanding of data models, query optimization, query profiling, and query performance monitoring tools and techniques.
Basic knowledge of CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce) is a plus.
You have hands on experience with Power BI, exposure to utilizing a data warehouse such as Snowflake.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel.
Strong attention to detail, organizational and, documentation skills.
You are keen to understand the business, ask questions and dive into the data.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and processes.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Familiarity with sales processes or the CDMO industry is a plus but not required.
Strong communication skills in English (writing and speaking)


Our culture at AGC Biologics is defined by the six core values: Knowledge, Trust, Quality, Ingenuity, Accountability and Teamwork. Our core values stem from our team members and are embedded into our DNA. They provide a common language and understanding of how we as an organization are connected across three continents. Our core values serve as a compass and reminder of how we achieve our purpose of bringing hope to life for patients around the globe.

AGC Biologics is a leading global biopharmaceutical Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with a strong commitment to delivering the highest standard of service as we work side-by-side with our clients and partners, every step of the way. We provide world-class development and manufacture of mammalian and microbial-based therapeutic proteins, plasmid DNA (pDNA), messenger RNA (mRNA), viral vectors, and genetically engineered cells. Our global network spans the U.S., Europe, and Asia, with cGMP-compliant facilities in Seattle, Washington; Boulder and Longmont, Colorado; Copenhagen, Denmark; Heidelberg, Germany; Milan, Italy; and Chiba, Japan. We currently employ more than 2,500 employees worldwide. Our commitment to continuous innovation fosters the technical creativity to solve our clientsâ€™ most complex challenges, including specialization in fast-track projects and rare diseases. AGC Biologics is the partner of choice. To learn more, visitâ€¯www.agcbio.com.â€¯â€¯Want to keep posted about our growth and learn more about our company? Follow us on LinkedIn and give us a quick Like on Facebook!

AGC Biologics offers a highly competitive compensation package and a friendly, collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievement. AGC Biologics is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Title: AI & Business Analyst / Consultant (Remote Internship)
Description:
About Role

As an AI & Business Analyst / Consultant Intern you work daily on data analytics / strategy consulting tasks and projects related to mining and researching data, later on data optimization, cleaning, and finally on the interpretation and data visualization for clients and internal company needs.

Your mission:


AI first approach - we use AI in all possible cases that is available
Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses and informative, actionable global markets research and reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
Collaborate with other teams to build valuable content using BI and market insights solutions
Develop dashboards and descriptive analytics solutions for clients
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends
Take care of data integration and data /database management
Support and maintain existing BI solutions and resolve bugs as they arise


Your perks:


Access to very extensive educational resources and opportunities
Flexibility (work from home / remote setup)
Hi-tech and world-class working tools available also for personal use
Life-coaching & mentoring arranged by senior internal and external mentors
Team-buildings that are really different from â€œstandardâ€ companies


Your superpowers:


Currently enrolled in a University degree (Bachelor/Master) or fresh graduate
Generative AI and other AI tools daily user
Serious interest in marketresearch, data science, consulting and finance audit
Your personality captivates with enthusiasm for innovation, curiosity and the courage to question facts and always double-check data
Ability to thrive in fast-paced environment with competing priorities and last-minute changes
Staying on top of all innovation-related news and leveraging your experience to conceptualize innovation strategies and methodologies
Business acumen and clientâ€™s focus
Basics and willing to improve skills in: Tableau, Power BI, Qlick


Your mission frame:


Type: Full Time/Part Time internship (40/30h per week)
Compensation:Non-paid / Students' scholarships
Location: Remote
Duration: 3+ Months, optional to be extended
Start: ASAP


The exact starting date of the internship can be flexible after successful interviews and agreement.

This is a Remote (work from home) position.

Note: Due to the high number of applications we receive, we will only respond to applications that match our criteria and expectations. Thank you for understanding.

Title: Data Analytics Business Partner (North)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we dream of a planet with no food waste

Imagine if there was something we could all change today that would reduce global warming by 10%. Thatâ€™s how much food waste contributes to the climate crisis, and yet we continue to waste edible food all over the world.

As the worldâ€™s largest food waste-fighting app, we connect stores that have unsold, surplus food with consumers who buy and enjoy it. But weâ€™re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation and our mission is to inspire and empower everyone to take action against food waste.

Weâ€™re growing fast: Our community of 118 million registered users and 246,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 443+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.198.000 tonnes of CO2e!

This role is based in Amsterdam OR Copenhagen.

Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analytics Business Partner to strengthen our knowledge around how to drive excellence in Operations.

While you will report directly to the Director of Analytics, you will be embedded in the Operational Leadership team for our Cluster North European markets. Your mission will be to work as a trusted advisor to our Vice President of Operations in driving key strategic decisions with a data-driven approach, mapping strategy to data-driven ways of working, and championing data literacy across your operational area. You will be 1 of 6 in a similar role, each dedicated to an Operational Leadership team, working together to share cross-country insights in an efficient and scalable way.

Your role


Provide deep analytical insights to inform timely Cluster North European Operations leadership team decisions - either proactively, on a regular cadence (QBRs, MBRs), or through ad hoc projects
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive operational excellence in our Cluster North European markets
Opportunity size and prioritise analytics ideas and questions in our Cluster North European markets, with the support of your Vice President of Operations
Proactively bring relevant & actionable insights from the rest of the Analytics team (embedded in other areas of the organisation) to the Cluster North European Operations leadership team;
Elevate the data literacy across the Cluster North European Operational leadership team
Identify, advocate, and build opportunities for scale and automation across the team
Elevate our Global Analytics specialisation by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You demonstrate business acumen through significant experience in an analytical role supporting 2 or more of the following functions: Sales, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Strategy, Business Operations, Leadership; or relevant work experience in Consulting
You are proficient in SQL, comfortable with Python or R, and proficient in manipulating data efficiently for ad-hoc analysis
You are experienced with Data Visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, PowerBI or similar
You are focused on business outcomes by framing insights in a way that inspires action
You are comfortable describing statistical uncertainty and educating non-technical audiences on how best to interpret and action off of new insights
You have proven experience in stakeholder management, with the ability to manage a high influx of requests in a structured way
You are driven by the â€œwhyâ€ behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure youâ€™re solving for the right thing
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
You have the ability to communicate effectively and convincingly in an English-speaking organisation
Previous experience in a hyper growth start-up environment will be valued


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: Weâ€™re proud of the change weâ€™re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Offer


A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corp) where you can see real and tangible impact in your role.
Working alongside an international community of users, partners and 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
Personal and professional development opportunities in a fast-paced scale-up environment.
An inclusive company culture where you can bring your authentic self to work
A strong, values-driven team culture where we celebrate successes and socialize with colleagues that care to offer


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, itâ€™s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when weâ€™re allowed to be ourselves, and weâ€™re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Student Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Student Quantitative Analyst

At MFT Energy, we are at the forefront of energy trading, driving market efficiency, and facilitating the green transition. We are seeking a talented student quantitative analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team trading European power. Collaborate with experienced professionals, who are dedicated to excellence every day.

About The Role

As a Student Quantitative Analyst, you will play an instrumental role in our dynamic Intraday team. You will work alongside highly skilled quantitative analysts, machine-learning experts, execution-algo developers, system developers, and traders.

You will be part of a team working on machine-learning models that automatically execute in the market meaning you will get direct feedback on performance. With time, we will bring you into various decision-making processes as we believe in responsibility being a key driver for your success.

Your Key Responsibilities


Acquire and maintain data from external sources.
Contribute to existing trade signal frameworks.
Maintain and develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge.


Your Qualifications And Personal Skills


Studying: Data Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar.
A proactive approach and general interest in algorithmic trading.
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, etc. is considered a plus.
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail.
The ability to work independently and structure your workload.
A positive and competitive attitude but at the same time a valued team player.
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English.


Above all, we cherish passion and creativity. If you have made hobby projects, feel free to share them.

Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are more than 180 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in TÃ¼rkiye, Australia, New York City, and Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the bestâ€”we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.

We Offer


A part-time student position with a high degree of influence and autonomy, requiring on-site presence at our Aarhus C office to foster close collaboration and learning
A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.


Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a CV, a short cover letter, and your grade transcript. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Deadline: As soon as possible.

Start date: Flexible.

We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

As a global and independent energy trading hub, we specialize in power, gas, and environmentals trading 24/7 in 41 countries. At MFT Energy, we innovate energy trading through our people and technology, supported by our unique partner model. Our belief is that fostering a sense of ownership among employees is the most effective way to advance our business.

Title: Product Analyst with Power BI skills
Place: BrÃ¸ndby Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Product Analyst with Power BI skillsÂ 

Do you want a rare opportunity to make an extraordinaire impact as part of a great team?Â 

If you have a passion for telemetry, usage, and behavioral data â€“ and you know how to leverage Power BI in this context â€“ this role offers a unique career opportunity. As part of Milestoneâ€™s transformation, your expertise will be a key asset for future growth. In this role, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to shape how the company works with telemetry data, giving you significant influence and learning opportunities. And youâ€™ll do it as part of a well-functioning, collaborative team where teamwork, knowledge sharing, and mutual support are part of everyday life.Â 

Turn data into clear and insightful PowerBI dashboardsÂ 

Your primary mission is to help business colleagues achieve better results by providing them with valuable data-driven insights. Youâ€™ll engage in dialogue with stakeholders across various business areas to understand their goals and needs. Using this knowledge, youâ€™ll collaborate with the Power BI backend team to to request, refine, and test data in our cross-organizational data model. From there, youâ€™ll transform data into compelling, easy-to-understand Power BI dashboards. At the same time, youâ€™ll continuously contribute ideas for optimizing our overall setup. Your primary tasks will be to:Â Â 



Engaging with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectivesÂ 
Building Power BI dashboards in collaboration with the backend teamÂ 


Acting as the data/Power BI lead in various business projectsÂ 


Developing an understanding of how usage data fits into the overall value chainÂ 


Assisting project teams in setting up data-driven metrics and coaching them on data interpretation (e.g., through workshops)Â 


Contributing to the compilation of monthly and quarterly royalty reportsÂ 



Experience in Power BI for telemetry, usage, and behavioral dataÂ 

We are looking for you that thrive on handling tasks independently while at the same time knowing when to engage with your colleagues to create 1 + 1 = 3. We are also looking for your entrepreneurial spirit as you shall play a key role in building the future way of working for your workstream. As part of this, you must be curious on new trends, technologies and tools.Â  Additionally, it is important that you like dialogue and collaboration with many different people covering multiple professions and nationalities. Finally, you can tick of the below:Â Â 



Degree in data science or equivalent experienceÂ Â 


Experience with telemetry/usage/behaviour data, preferably in a software companyÂ Â 


Power BI frontend experience, especially in visualization and storytelling of data with the data user in mindÂ 


Knowledgeable of DAX and star schema models / the Power BI platformÂ Â 


Experience with Azure DevOps and user story processesÂ 



Your new teamÂ 

Your new workplace will be Milestoneâ€™s headquarters in BrÃ¸ndby, Copenhagen, where youâ€™ll join a team of eight skilled colleagues in the Product Operations team where you will be part of the Product Analytics and Performance workstream. Our team brings together experts in product excellence, performance, telemetry, qualitative research, and outcome-driven product management. We work cross-functionally to enable product teams to make informed, customer-centered decisions and deliver real impact.Â Â 

Just as important. You can look forward to being part of a highly functional, professional, and socially engaging environment. Our team is diverse â€“ we are eight people representing seven different nationalities. At Milestone, youâ€™ll experience a positive and welcoming culture with frequent social activities, an on-site gym, private health insurance, and additional perks like free drinks, fruit, lunch, Friday bars, and more. Flexibility is also a natural part of life at Milestone.Â 

Contact and applicationÂ 

Please apply at our website using the â€Applyâ€ button.Â Â 

You will experience an inclusive and unbiased recruitment process where all employment decisions are based on qualifications rather than race, color, ethnicity, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and religion. We advise you not to attach a cover letter to your application but instead, we encourage you to write a few lines about why you are applying for the position in your resume/CV. Additionally we recommend you not to add a photo in your resume/CV.Â 

If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact Christina Hampson, Head of Product Operations at +45 2552 9352.Â 

We are looking forward to receiving your application.Â Â 

At Milestone, your work goes beyond what the human eye can see. With our unique video technology software, you help people make wiser and more responsible decisions â€“ in and beyond security. Whether you advance our software, inspire to new integrations, or elevate our customers, you are part of a growth company recognized by the industry. We have a unique people-first approach to everything we do, and itâ€™s not just empty words.
