Product Analyst with Power BI skills 

Do you want a rare opportunity to make an extraordinaire impact as part of a great team? 

If you have a passion for telemetry, usage, and behavioral data â€“ and you know how to leverage Power BI in this context â€“ this role offers a unique career opportunity. As part of Milestoneâ€™s transformation, your expertise will be a key asset for future growth. In this role, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to shape how the company works with telemetry data, giving you significant influence and learning opportunities. And youâ€™ll do it as part of a well-functioning, collaborative team where teamwork, knowledge sharing, and mutual support are part of everyday life. 

Turn data into clear and insightful PowerBI dashboards 

Your primary mission is to help business colleagues achieve better results by providing them with valuable data-driven insights. Youâ€™ll engage in dialogue with stakeholders across various business areas to understand their goals and needs. Using this knowledge, youâ€™ll collaborate with the Power BI backend team to to request, refine, and test data in our cross-organizational data model. From there, youâ€™ll transform data into compelling, easy-to-understand Power BI dashboards. At the same time, youâ€™ll continuously contribute ideas for optimizing our overall setup. Your primary tasks will be to:  


  • Engaging with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives 
  • Building Power BI dashboards in collaboration with the backend team 

  • Acting as the data/Power BI lead in various business projects 

  • Developing an understanding of how usage data fits into the overall value chain 

  • Assisting project teams in setting up data-driven metrics and coaching them on data interpretation (e.g., through workshops) 

  • Contributing to the compilation of monthly and quarterly royalty reports 



Experience in Power BI for telemetry, usage, and behavioral data 

We are looking for you that thrive on handling tasks independently while at the same time knowing when to engage with your colleagues to create 1 + 1 = 3. We are also looking for your entrepreneurial spirit as you shall play a key role in building the future way of working for your workstream. As part of this, you must be curious on new trends, technologies and tools.  Additionally, it is important that you like dialogue and collaboration with many different people covering multiple professions and nationalities. Finally, you can tick of the below:  


  • Degree in data science or equivalent experience  

  • Experience with telemetry/usage/behaviour data, preferably in a software company  

  • Power BI frontend experience, especially in visualization and storytelling of data with the data user in mind 

  • Knowledgeable of DAX and star schema models / the Power BI platform  

  • Experience with Azure DevOps and user story processes 



Your new team 

Your new workplace will be Milestoneâ€™s headquarters in BrÃ¸ndby, Copenhagen, where youâ€™ll join a team of eight skilled colleagues in the Product Operations team where you will be part of the Product Analytics and Performance workstream. Our team brings together experts in product excellence, performance, telemetry, qualitative research, and outcome-driven product management. We work cross-functionally to enable product teams to make informed, customer-centered decisions and deliver real impact.  

Just as important. You can look forward to being part of a highly functional, professional, and socially engaging environment. Our team is diverse â€“ we are eight people representing seven different nationalities. At Milestone, youâ€™ll experience a positive and welcoming culture with frequent social activities, an on-site gym, private health insurance, and additional perks like free drinks, fruit, lunch, Friday bars, and more. Flexibility is also a natural part of life at Milestone. 

Contact and application 

Please apply at our website using the â€Applyâ€ button.  

You will experience an inclusive and unbiased recruitment process where all employment decisions are based on qualifications rather than race, color, ethnicity, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and religion. We advise you not to attach a cover letter to your application but instead, we encourage you to write a few lines about why you are applying for the position in your resume/CV. Additionally we recommend you not to add a photo in your resume/CV. 

If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact Christina Hampson, Head of Product Operations at +45 2552 9352. 

We are looking forward to receiving your application.  

At Milestone, your work goes beyond what the human eye can see. With our unique video technology software, you help people make wiser and more responsible decisions â€“ in and beyond security. Whether you advance our software, inspire to new integrations, or elevate our customers, you are part of a growth company recognized by the industry. We have a unique people-first approach to everything we do, and itâ€™s not just empty words. Being part of a fun, friendly, and flexible environment youâ€™ll find, that working here almost feels like a home away from home.â€¯If you are curious to know more about who we are, we suggest you visitâ€¯http://milestonesys.com/careerâ€¯

Title: Analyst (Student Assistant), Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company (CISC) - a service provider working exclusively for the global fund management company Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), is currently looking for an Analyst to join our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

The team and the role
As an Analyst in the Data & Analytics team, your core responsibilities revolve around utilizing Power Platform tools, such as Power Automate, Power Apps and Power BI, to improve and automate business processes to drive forward the digital agenda across CIP and CISC. You will be working closely with business intelligence specialists, data engineers and master data experts to elevate the scalability and efficiency of core processes.

You will play an important role in supporting the Data & Analytics department in executing on key initiatives, with a unique opportunity to work alongside many colleagues across various teams. The position is part-time (15-20 hours/week). Youâ€™ll reporting directly to our Master Data Manager.

Responsibilities will further consist of:

Developing and maintaining Power Platform solutions, particularly Power Apps and Power Automate
Scoping and refining new requests to suggest data-driven solutions
Understanding business processes to design fit-for-purpose Power Platform solutions.


You
We are looking for you, who are currently studying and are on your 2nd or 3rd year of your bachelor's degree or coming into your 1st year of your masterâ€™s degree studying Computer Science, IT relevant study in ITU, KU, DTU or Data Science at CBS. You are motivated and interested in data and data modeling.

Moreover, you have a sincere motivation for learning new things and are a highly organized and motivated individual who is thriving in a highly effective and innovative environment.

We look for the following in a candidate

Willing to learn or previous experience with Power Apps, Power Automate and Power BI
Good knowledge of Excel and knowledge of SQL and Python
Comprehensive, analytical and problem-solving skills
Close attention to detail and a high level of accuracy
Willingness to work in an international, efficient, and highly varied environment
Fluency in English, both verbal and written, as well as great communication skills towards technical and non-technical colleagues.


The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISCâ€™s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.



---



Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects â€“ from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Calling on Junior Data Engineer




At Maersk Tankers, our purpose is to pioneer shipping solutions for our partners and the planet. We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion to make this happen, including providing equal opportunities for all. We offer a global and flexible workplace where passion and engagement are met with opportunities to pioneer professional and personal development.




Your opportunity to join the adventure




In Technology, you will join a team of 6 talented and welcoming colleagues.

As a Junior Data Engineer, you'll be part of a dynamic team, developing and providing solutions for the IT Security and Platforms team. With a collaborative mindset, you'll work closely with team members and business product owners to understand, define, and develop solutions that enhance performance across the organization.

Are you part of the solution?

At Maersk Tankers, you can come as you are and be among people who will expand your horizon. As our new Junior Data Engineer, we do, however, expect that you can contribute with the following:




Bring enthusiasm and an open mind. Hereâ€™s what youâ€™ll be doing:




Translating business needs into technical designs and solutions: You'll learn to create and operate data integrations, and participate in or facilitate the prototyping of new solutions and technologies
Ingesting and cleaning data: You'll work with various data sources and formats, from internal operation data to external market data
Collaborating with business users: You'll contribute to creating concise and meaningful data assets that fit into our platform architecture
Operating data pipelines: You'll ensure high robustness, fault tolerance, and availability, making optimizations and scheduling improvements along the way
Maintaining CI/CD and data platform infrastructure: You'll keep the platform secure and robust while minimizing costs




Technologies you'll be working with:




Python Azure Functions for ingestion
Azure DevOps for CI/CD, repository storage, and package repository
PySpark and Scala Spark for data pipelines
Azure Synapse Analytics




Maersk Tankers | Calling New Horizons




Maersk Tankers is a service company that provides commercial management solutions for shipowners in the tanker industry, operating one of the largest tanker fleets in the world. Our purpose is to pioneer shipping solutions for our partners and the planet. Founded in 1928, we have a century of expertise in management of tankers, which we use to develop and deploy solutions that help shipowners boost the economic and environmental performance of their vessels. Maersk Tankers employs approximately 300 employees in Denmark, Singapore, United Kingdom, India and the U.S. and is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Do you want to join one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing energy trading companies and play a key role in building our new Macro Trading portfolio? Keep reading; we are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our newly established Macro Trading team.







In Macro Trading, we combine macroeconomic insights and data analysis with market-specific knowledge of power, gas, and emissions to generate trading decisions. The macro portfolio is like a start-up with a high degree of autonomy and the opportunity to explore new ideas to innovate and rethink European Energy Trading, while having the backing of a larger and mature organization, increasing the probability of success.




As a Quantitative Analyst, you will be key in building our quantitative macroeconomic framework. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with traders, quants, and other analysts to develop quantifiable and actionable analysis.




Your journey as a Quantitative Analyst

We seek a highly analytical and detail-oriented Quantitative Analyst with a dedicated focus on macroeconomics and econometrics to support our energy trading activities. In this role, you will leverage macroeconomic dataâ€”such as interest rates, inflation, and growth - and advanced econometric techniques to create proprietary models that forecast market prices and support our trading strategies.




The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the global macroeconomic landscape and how it influences commodity prices, energy supply, and demand, paired with exceptional skills in econometric modeling and quantitative research.




We will ensure you are ready to take on your new role by giving you the best possible introduction to the team, our business, and our organization. You will be introduced to our macroeconomic framework, and any potential knowledge gaps will be addressed to maximize your success.




At InCommodities, we do not believe in bureaucracy, stringent processes, or micro-management. Instead, we grant you high autonomy, which we believe unlocks greater engagement and ensures that the best decisions are made â€“ always by those closest to the job.'




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement econometric models that predict key macroeconomic variables
Incorporate macroeconomic factors to predict energy prices and supply-demand dynamics
Collaborate with traders and quants to translate macroeconomic data and econometric insights into actionable trading strategies.
Continuously monitor and refine models to reflect changes in the macroeconomic environment




Qualifications â€“ we imagine that you:

Hold a masterâ€™s degree or PhD in Economics, Finance, or a similar field with a focus on econometrics
Have experience with time-series analysis, forecasting, and other advanced econometric techniques
Possess excellent coding skills (Python is an advantage)
Preferably have knowledge of energy markets (oil, natural gas, electricity)
Have great communication skills enabling you to present complex macroeconomic insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders




Personal skills â€“ we expect that you:

Are super passionate and knowledgeable about econometrics
Actively follow and understand what is happening in the world of macroeconomics
Have a curious and competitive mindset
Can be direct with your colleagues in a constructive way
Can work independently with a strong drive towards achieving results
Are a team player who will do what is best for the team and InCommodities




What you can expect from us:

You will join a team of experienced colleagues and will have the opportunity to work closely together with quants, analysts, and traders to build a macro trading desk
We will provide you with opportunities to develop both professionally and personally
We will provide you with flexibility and autonomy to drive real impact
You will be part a unique company culture where we live up to our values: Honesty, Transparency, and Rethink and where you don't have to abide by a dress code or a strict hierarchy, so you won't be frustrated with too many rules, policies, or bureaucratic processes.




Practical details

Location: Aarhus N, Denmark

Full-time job




Application deadline: As soon as possible




If you have any questions, please contact:

Morten Kold, Head of Macro Trading

Mail: mkj@in-commodities.com

Title: Student Assistant with a flair for Data modelling and Reporting
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where youâ€™ll will provide cost transparency, gather data, and generate reports for chargeback of infrastructure costs to the relevant applications / business units. You will provide accessible and timely reports and support the users with information on products and prices, as well as working with optimization of the data model and reporting process.

Welcome to DK CC Digital WP Engineering

Youâ€™ll be part of our infrastructure cost team (FinOps) where you, together with your colleagues, will work with IT- Finance to support management and teams in taking data driven decisions that creates business value.

As a team, we are a global diverse group and weâ€™re focused on our team within the agile framework.

Youâ€™ll play an important role in:


Providing transparency of IT infrastructure costs through reporting
Gathering data and generate reports for chargeback of infrastructure costs to the relevant applications / business units
Working with data modelling in Power BI
Engaging in dialogue with business units for optimization of models for transparency of infrastructure costs
Supporting our colleagues by communicating information about IT infrastructure products and prices.


To succeed in the role, you:


are enrolled in a relevant study programme at, e.g., CBS, KU, ITU, or DTU
have an analytical mindset with strong quantitative and problem-solving skills, as well as an eye for details
possess strong communication skills, enabling you to communicate topics in a clear and concise manner both orally and in writing
have the ability to speak and write English fluently
have a strong personal drive and are able to work independently, while also being a genuine team player.


Maybe youâ€™ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they donâ€™t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. Weâ€™ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when weâ€™ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.

Title: Data Analytics Business Partner
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

Weâ€™re more than an app: we are a certified BCorp with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Tech offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

Weâ€™re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

This role can be based either in Copenhagen or London.

Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analytics Business Partner to strengthen our knowledge around how to drive excellence in Operations.

While you will report directly to the Director of Analytics, you will work closely with our Strategy & Expansion teams, as well as members of the Global Management Team. Your mission will be to work as a trusted advisor to leadership in driving key strategic decisions, mapping strategy to data-driven ways of working, and championing scaled analysis across our Cluster Business Partnering team. You will be 1 of 6 Business Partners: while the others are dedicated to an Operational Leadership team in regional markets, youâ€™ll be working on connecting the dots at the global level. The Business Partnering team works closely together to share cross-country insights in an efficient and scalable way.

Your role


Provide deep analytical insights to inform timely Sales, Strategy and Leadership decisions - either proactively, on a regular cadence (QBRs, MBRs), or through ad hoc projects
Mobilize the Cluster Business Partners to bring relevant & actionable insights from the rest of the Data & Analytics team to the Regional Operations leadership teams
Utilize the deep in-market expertise of the Cluster Business Partner team to proactively identify and build opportunities for scale and automation; prioritize and advocate for further scale via data products with our Solutions team
Elevate our Global Analytics specialisation by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects
Opportunity size and prioritise analytics ideas and questions from common themes across our markets and clusters, with the support of the COO, the Strategy team, and Operations VPs in our Expansion Markets


Requirements


You have significant experience in an analytical role supporting 2 or more of the following functions: Sales, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Strategy, Business Operations; or relevant work experience in Consulting
You are proficient in SQL, comfortable with Python or R, and proficient in manipulating data efficiently for ad-hoc analysis
You are experienced with Data Visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, PowerBI or similar
You are comfortable describing statistical uncertainty and educating non-technical audiences on how best to interpret and action off of new insights
You have proven experience in stakeholder management, with the ability to manage a high influx of requests in a structured way
You are driven by the â€œwhyâ€ behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure youâ€™re solving for the right thing
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
You have the ability to communicate effectively and convincingly in an English-speaking organisation
Previous experience in a hyper growth start-up environment will be valued


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: Weâ€™re proud of the change weâ€™re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you get to wake up every day knowing youâ€™re achieving positive change.
The opportunity to truly drive impact within your domain towards a planet with no food waste.
The experience of being part of an international company with 1300 + enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across 19 countries (and counting) â€“ always ready to share knowledge and support!
Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment.
An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity.
A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, itâ€™s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when weâ€™re allowed to be ourselves, and weâ€™re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

HTML:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

Weâ€™re more than an app: we are a certified BCorp with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Tech offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

Weâ€™re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

This role can be based either in Copenhagen or London.

Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analytics Business Partner to strengthen our knowledge around how to drive excellence in Operations.

While you will report directly to the Director of Analytics, you will work closely with our Strategy & Expansion teams, as well as members of the Global Management Team. Your mission will be to work as a trusted advisor to leadership in driving key strategic decisions, mapping strategy to data-driven ways of working, and championing scaled analysis across our Cluster Business Partnering team. You will be 1 of 6 Business Partners: while the others are dedicated to an Operational Leadership team in regional markets, youâ€™ll be working on connecting the dots at the global level. The Business Partnering team works closely together to share cross-country insights in an efficient and scalable way.

Your role

  • Provide deep analytical insights to inform timely Sales, Strategy and Leadership decisions - either proactively, on a regular cadence (QBRs, MBRs), or through ad hoc projects
  • Mobilize the Cluster Business Partners to bring relevant & actionable insights from the rest of the Data & Analytics team to the Regional Operations leadership teams
  • Utilize the deep in-market expertise of the Cluster Business Partner team to proactively identify and build opportunities for scale and automation; prioritize and advocate for further scale via data products with our Solutions team
  • Elevate our Global Analytics specialisation by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects
  • Opportunity size and prioritise analytics ideas and questions from common themes across our markets and clusters, with the support of the COO, the Strategy team, and Operations VPs in our Expansion Markets

Requirements

  • You have significant experience in an analytical role supporting 2 or more of the following functions: Sales, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Strategy, Business Operations; or relevant work experience in Consulting
  • You are proficient in SQL, comfortable with Python or R, and proficient in manipulating data efficiently for ad-hoc analysis
  • You are experienced with Data Visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, PowerBI or similar
  • You are comfortable describing statistical uncertainty and educating non-technical audiences on how best to interpret and action off of new insights
  • You have proven experience in stakeholder management, with the ability to manage a high influx of requests in a structured way
  • You are driven by the â€œwhyâ€ behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure youâ€™re solving for the right thing
  • You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
  • You have the ability to communicate effectively and convincingly in an English-speaking organisation
  • Previous experience in a hyper growth start-up environment will be valued

Our values

  • We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
  • We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
  • We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
  • We build a legacy: Weâ€™re proud of the change weâ€™re driving.
  • We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.

What We Have To Offer

  • A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you get to wake up every day knowing youâ€™re achieving positive change.
  • The opportunity to truly drive impact within your domain towards a planet with no food waste.
  • The experience of being part of an international company with 1300 + enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across 19 countries (and counting) â€“ always ready to share knowledge and support!
  • Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment.
  • An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity.
  • A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.
  • We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.

How To Apply

  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
  • Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
  • Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
TimeLog is a leading Professional Services Automation (PSA) software, dedicated to helping professional service organizations streamline business processes and boost productivity. TimeLog fills the GAP between Project Managers and the Finance Department in the consulting business, empowering Project Managers to manage project financials in a way compliant with the requirements set by finance.

We are currently looking for a skilled Data Engineer who is passionate about building and operating a robust data platform that enables powerful analytics, reporting, and insights across our product and organization.

ðŸ“¢ About The Position

As our new Data Engineer, you will serve as the primary technical driver for our data platform, which sits at the heart of all TimeLog data processing, reporting, and analytics â€“ both internal and customer-facing.

You will manage and evolve the entire data pipeline and ensure that our platform is performant, reliable, cost-efficient, and secure. This role combines hands-on responsibility for production data infrastructure with the opportunity to influence architectural decisions and data strategy in collaboration with our Senior Software Architect.

You will report to the Chief Product and Technology Officer and work closely with colleagues across software development, product, and infrastructure.

ðŸŽ¯ In This Role, Your Responsibilities Are

Data Platform Operations & Ownership


Manage and contribute to the entire data pipeline from source databases to analytics platforms
Monitor the production environment and maintain system reliability
Optimize data platform performance, cost and efficiency while ensuring high availability
Develop innovative approaches to data analysis and information generation
Ensure data governance, compliance, and quality across the platform


Developer Support & Enablement


Support developers in building reports and new processing pipelines
Make data accessible, well-documented, and reliable for internal and customer use


Strategic Contribution & Innovation


Collaborate closely with the Senior Architect to evolve the technical data architecture
Contribute to strategic data decisions and develop innovative solutions
Ensure data security and compliance with company and regulatory standards


ðŸ† Your Qualifications

Experience & Technical Skills


Strong hands-on experience with Databricks
Proficiency in Change Data Capture (CDC) methodologies
Good knowledge of relational database systems, specifically SQL Server
Experience with Delta Live Tables and stream processing
Working experience with Kafka and Debezium for data streaming
Understanding of data security principles and DataOps practices
Bonus: Some experience in data science or analytics tooling


Mindset & Collaboration


You take ownership of platform reliability and love making things run smoothly
You thrive in cross-functional teams and enjoy supporting others through data
Youâ€™re a structured problem-solver who can prioritize and execute effectively
You stay updated on modern data technologies and want to make an impact


ðŸŽ We Offer


A dynamic, inclusive company culture that promotes teamwork and innovation
Opportunities for professional growth and career development
Flexible working hours and a healthy work-life balance
Centrally located office in Copenhagen
A high-impact role where your work directly powers product and business decisions


ðŸ  Location:

You will be working from our offices in Copenhagen

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Data Analyst




Get The Future You Want!

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way youâ€™d like, where youâ€™ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where youâ€™ll be able to reimagine whatâ€™s possible. Join us and help the worldâ€™s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.




Your Role

Monitored and tracked changes to the data dictionary in alignment with ongoing migration and evolving user stories.
Produced detailed configuration-type requirements to support effective UAT testing phases.
Conducted in-depth data item analysis to derive processing rules and ensure accuracy.
Developed relevant use cases to support data processing scenarios during UAT.
Analyzed implications of available data configuration options to guide informed decision-making.
Created data flow models to visualize and validate end-to-end data movement across systems.
Ensured data flow diagrams accurately captured system interactions and dependencies.
Reviewed and validated the configuration of preventative controls implemented in the system.
Assessed control effectiveness in reducing risk and ensuring compliance post-configuration.
Collaborated with stakeholders to refine requirements based on test outcomes and control reviews.




Your Profile

Tracked data dictionary changes in sync with migration and evolving user stories, ensuring consistency.
Produced configuration requirements for UAT, including data item analysis, rule creation, and supporting use cases.
Modeled data flows to validate system interactions and identify dependencies across platforms.
Reviewed and assessed preventative control configurations to ensure risk mitigation and compliance.
Engaged stakeholders to refine and finalize requirements based on UAT results and control effectiveness.




About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. Your Role

  • Monitored and tracked changes to the data dictionary in alignment with ongoing migration and evolving user stories.
  • Produced detailed configuration-type requirements to support effective UAT testing phases.

  • Collaborated with stakeholders to refine requirements based on test outcomes and control reviews.

Description:
A Little Bit About Us...

We make life more affordable.

Pion produces award-winning technology for the biggest retailers on the planet, connecting them with the youth market. We're always innovating and driving our SHARP values to offer new solutions that satisfy our consumers, drive ROI for our clients and create an empowering workplace for our employees.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion at Pion

At Pion, inclusivity, diversity, and respect are at our core. We value accountability and are fully transparent about our ED&I effortsâ€”our commitments and internal stats are open for all to see. Our culture is shaped by our people, and it's all part of life at Pion.

Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet 60% of the requirements, women and those in underrepresented groups tend to only apply when they tick every box. We don't think you should have to tick every box. We value your uniqueness, and it goes without saying that all applications are welcome, even if you don't think you fit the criteria.

If you need any adjustments to support you with your application, just drop us an email at talent@wearepion.com.

About The Role

As a result of our incredible success and growth, we are looking for an experienced Junior Data Analyst to join us. You will be part of a centralised data team, who are essential to ensuring that our internal teams have access to vital information and data which informs both product and commercial decisions.

Responsibilities Include-


Triaging requests within the Jira inbox by prioritising them based on business requirements
Responding to ad hoc queries
Speaking to stakeholders in order to understand their requirements or any concerns
Investigating potential issues and discrepancies across systems / reports
Performance monitoring
QA + reporting checking
Requirements gathering for new reports and small pieces of analysis
Building reports and dashboards in our BI tools
Some SQL based analysis in Count


Requirements

A little bit about you...

We'd really like to hear from you, if you have...


Experience building reports and dashboards in off-the-shelf BI tools such as Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, Lightdash
SQL proficiency is absolutely essential (there is a SQL test included within our recruitment process)
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Proactivity and drive for continuous improvement
Experience working as a Data Analyst as part of a data team
Experience working with Product and Engineering teams
Experience building alerting systems

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Bank of London

Bank of London offers a safer business banking model by holding all deposits at the Bank of England, eliminating the risk of 'bank runs.' It provides services such as Deposit-as-a-Service (DaaS), Embedded Banking, real-timeClearing, Payments, and Settlement, as well as Commercial Banking tailored to businesses. Powered by proprietary technology, the bank collaborates with SAP Fioneer to deliver innovative solutions. With a focus on exceptional service and core values of compassion, ownership, and curiosity, the bank strives for excellence in all it does.

â€Who we are looking for

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to oversee our organisation's data reporting, analysis, and visualisation efforts. The ideal candidate will possess advanced Power BI expertise with a track record of automation within a regulated environment.

This role is pivotal in driving data-driven decision-making across the business by ensuring the delivery of insightful, accurate, and timely management information.

You will be applying your advanced analytical skills, across complex data, commercial and product scenarios, guiding strategy, planning and operational activities. Your responsibility for delivery of management information, will be invaluable for equipping our teams with game changing insights.

You will play a critical role in design and production of Management Information (MI). You will engage and collaborate with colleagues, communicating your researched insights in order to drive individuals, teams and projects in their actions.

Lead the Data Function function, ensuring data integrity, accuracy and timeliness of reports
Drive the automation agenda, removing manual processes and building scalable MI solutions as a foundation for growth
Respond to ad-hoc data requests from colleagues
Prioritisation of regular and ad hoc reporting to satisfy external and internal stakeholders
Maintain the integrity of the MI Process with detailed review and data cleansing to ensure all data and reports are accurate, current, complete and consistent
Continuously review and improve MI processes to enhance efficiency, accuracy and relevance of reporting

What you bring

You will have an eye for detail which is second to none and be keen to keep learning in a tech savvy environment. You will be able to communicate the relevance and importance of your data insights, guiding colleagues towards achieving exceptional outcomes.

â€Data Visualisation: Expertise in creating interactive dashboards and reports in Power BI. (Essential)â€
SQL Proficiency: Strong ability to write and optimise SQL queries for data extraction and analysis. (Essential)â€
Data Warehousing: Experience with Snowflake for data storage and management. (Preferred)â€
Data Analysis: Advanced analytical skills to interpret data and provide actionable insightsâ€
DirectQuery & ETL: Experience working with DirectQuery mode and designing efficient ETL processes. (Preferred)â€
Stakeholder Engagement: Ability to translate technical concepts into insights for non-technical stakeholders.â€
Project Management: Proven track record of prioritising and managing department objectives.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to deliver a high level of accuracy in the role
Have the ability to organise and prioritise workloads to ensure business critical work is completed
At least two years experience working with Power BI
A good team player who can also work from own initiative especially with data

Work location

London (5 days per week in the office). Travel to other locations may be required on occasion.

Diversity

Bank of London is an equal opportunity employer committed to inclusion, diversity and belonging. All qualified applicants are welcome and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion or religious expression, sex, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity and expression, transgender, national origin, or military veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WALT Labs, a leading managed service provider, is dedicated to empowering businesses by harnessing the power of cloud technology. Our team specializes in delivering customized solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients, driving growth and operational efficiency across industries. From supporting small businesses with seamless data migration to enabling large corporations to manage complex infrastructure projects, we provide exceptional service while staying at the forefront of cloud technology advancements.

Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role 3 days a week minimum, for a Data Analyst at WALT Labs in London Kings Cross. The Data Analyst will be responsible for day-to-day tasks such as data analytics, data modeling, and utilizing statistical methods to drive business insights in Looker Studio and Looker Core. Effective communication skills will play a key role in collaborating with cross-functional teams.

Requirements


Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Data Modeling abilities
Proficiency in Statistics
Experience using Looker Studio at minimum
Strong Communication skills
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Statistics, Data Analytics, Computer Science)
Experience in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Python, etc)
Ability to work effectively in a team environment



Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and optimize datasets in BigQuery or other SQL databases for analysis and reporting
Use SQL to query large datasets and uncover trends that support business decisions
Design, build, and maintain Looker dashboards, including custom LookML models
Optimize queries and visualizations for cost efficiency and performance improvement
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather reporting requirements and present actionable insights
Ensure data privacy, security, and compliance with governance policies
Troubleshoot and resolve data discrepancies and support Looker or SQL database-related issues
Monitor and automate reporting for business-critical KPIs
Stay updated on best practices and recommend process improvements for data analysis and visualization


This role combines technical skills in SQL and Looker with strategic analysis to drive data-driven decisions.

Benefits

Benefits vary depending on location and employment type

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We have a new opportunity to be part of the IT team in the role of Data Analyst to work across departments excluded from the FIA Financial Regulations, primarily this will include non-F1 activities, Finance, HR, Commercial and Sustainability. As our Data Analyst, you will work on activities such as building dashboards and reports to present clear and insightful visuals to drive new insights and improve decision-making, ultimately contributing to the teamâ€™s primary objective of being a top three team in the FIA Constructorâ€™s Championship.




You will be responsible for:

Working with stakeholders to understand their data requirements
Building pipelines to ingest data into the data lake
Designing, building and deploying dashboards and reports in Power BI
Performing data mapping and modelling
Developing and update technical documentation
Implementing and owning a BI Centre of Excellence and driving best practices, engagement and Power BI training and education within the departments
Advocating for, and ensuring adherence to data governance and security standards
Handling and overseeing data pipelines, automating data collection and integration from diverse sources, and interacting with API systems
Providing support to key departments to ensure critical dashboards and reports are always available




What you will need to be successful in this role:

Expert Power BI knowledge
Microsoft Fabric experience
Ability to take client requirements, understand them and turn them into a powerful story told through engaging visuals in Power BI
Experience working in an agile environment using Azure Dev Ops
Expert knowledge of SQL and TSQL
Purview or similar data governance tools is beneficial
Experience of designing and building data models using Data Analysis Expressions (DAX)
Hands-on experience with Azure tools: Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks, SQL, Data Lake, Power BI, Delta Lake, and Spark.
Ability to design, build, and deploy interactive user interfaces for interrogating data
Experience of Power Automate would be beneficial
Experience with predictive analytics, Azure cognitive services, and AI.
Scripting skills in C# & Python (for statistical analysis and advanced analytics)
Eager to learn new technologies
Excellent verbal / written communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present and communicate technical designs
To be self-motivated and to motivate others to thrive in a challenging environment
Ability to calmly and confidently work under pressure to achieve targets and deliver results within required timescales
Microsoft certifications are a plus.




This is a full-time office-based role based at our campus in Silverstone, with additional requirement to travel to other locations where necessary.




Embark on a journey with the Aston Martin Aramco Formula OneÂ® Team to reshape history at our cutting-edge, sustainable campus in Northamptonshire. Combining our rich heritage with innovation, we bring fresh energy to the sport, driven by a commitment to challenge the status quo and dominate the track. With new investment fueling our ambitions, we're seeking talented individuals who share our passion for racing and drive for success. As part of our high-performing, collaborative team, you'll enjoy a competitive package, including a discretionary bonus scheme, private health care, pension plan, life assurance, and benefits like TEDSgroup childcare, cycle-to-work, tech, and car schemes. Plus, you can look forward to an on-site gym with fitness, spin, and yoga classes, as well as a new restaurant offering indoor and outdoor dining.




We are a business that fosters a supportive, inclusive, and compassionate culture, where our team genuinely embodies our core values: Growth, Readiness, Empowerment, Excellence, and Nurturing.




Aston Martin Formula OneÂ® Team is committed to attracting, recruiting, and retaining the most talented individuals, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, gender reassignment, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy or maternity, race, religion, belief, sex or sexual orientation. We strive to be a Team that reflects all the communities with which we engage around the world through diversity in the workplace and promoting an inclusive culture in which all team members are respected, empowered and valued.




Aston Martin Aramco Formula OneÂ® Team is committed to making sure our selection methods are fair for all. If you would like to request that reasonable adjustments are made, please complete our Request for Reasonable Adjustments form here.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: Â£35k-Â£45k (DOE)




Are you a data enthusiast looking to make an impact across multiple industries? Join a leading data consultancy in London that partners with clients in finance, retail, and healthcare to deliver data-driven solutions that transform their business operations.




My client is seeking a Data Analyst with strong analytical skills and a passion for leveraging data to solve complex problems. In this role, you'll work with a diverse portfolio of clients, using data insights to drive meaningful business improvements.




Your Responsibilities:

Analyse large datasets: Extract, clean, and analyse data from various sources to uncover trends and insights that inform key business strategies across finance, retail, and healthcare sectors.
Support decision-making: Use statistical methods and predictive models to assist clients in making data-driven decisions that improve their performance and efficiency.
Create data visualisations: Design and maintain interactive dashboards and visual reports to clearly communicate data insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with clients and internal teams: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, consultants, and client representatives, to ensure that data projects align with client goals.
Identify opportunities: Continuously explore ways to optimise processes, identify business opportunities, and deliver actionable recommendations to clients.




You Will Need:

Bachelorâ€™s degree in a quantitative field: Preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Experience with data analysis tools: Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis, manipulation, and reporting.
Data visualisation skills: Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to present complex data in a user-friendly format.
Strong analytical mindset: Ability to understand and interpret complex datasets, drawing clear and actionable conclusions for clients.
Excellent communication skills: Capable of conveying technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Industry experience: Prior experience working with clients in finance, retail, or healthcare, and familiarity with sector-specific data challenges.
Exposure to advanced analytics: Knowledge of machine learning techniques, predictive modeling, or advanced statistical analysis.
Problem-solving approach: A proactive, solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to think critically and creatively.




The Benefits:

Diverse projects: Gain experience working with clients across multiple industries, ensuring no two days are the same.
Learning and development: Access to training and mentorship to support your growth and help you stay at the forefront of data trends.
Collaborative work environment: Join a dynamic and supportive team of data experts, all working towards delivering exceptional results for clients.
Competitive compensation: A salary that reflects your experience and expertise, along with performance-based incentives.




If youâ€™re a motivated Data Analyst eager to work with a variety of clients and industries, apply now to become part of a dynamic consultancy shaping the future of data-driven decision-making!

  • Analyse large datasets: Extract, clean, and analyse data from various sources to uncover trends and insights that inform key business strategies across finance, retail, and healthcare sectors.
  • Support decision-making: Use statistical methods and predictive models to assist clients in making data-driven decisions that improve their performance and efficiency.
  • Create data visualisations: Design and maintain interactive dashboards and visual reports to clearly communicate data insights to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with clients and internal teams: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, consultants, and client representatives, to ensure that data projects align with client goals.
  • Identify opportunities: Continuously explore ways to optimise processes, identify business opportunities, and deliver actionable recommendations to clients.


You Will Need:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in a quantitative field: Preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
  • Experience with data analysis tools: Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis, manipulation, and reporting.
  • Data visualisation skills: Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to present complex data in a user-friendly format.
  • Strong analytical mindset: Ability to understand and interpret complex datasets, drawing clear and actionable conclusions for clients.
  • Excellent communication skills: Capable of conveying technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.


It's A Bonus If You Have:

  • Industry experience: Prior experience working with clients in finance, retail, or healthcare, and familiarity with sector-specific data challenges.
  • Exposure to advanced analytics: Knowledge of machine learning techniques, predictive modeling, or advanced statistical analysis.
  • Problem-solving approach: A proactive, solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to think critically and creatively.


The Benefits:

  • Diverse projects: Gain experience working with clients across multiple industries, ensuring no two days are the same.
  • Learning and development: Access to training and mentorship to support your growth and help you stay at the forefront of data trends.
  • Collaborative work environment: Join a dynamic and supportive team of data experts, all working towards delivering exceptional results for clients.
  • Competitive compensation: A salary that reflects your experience and expertise, along with performance-based incentives.


If youâ€™re a motivated Data Analyst eager to work with a variety of clients and industries, apply now to become part of a dynamic consultancy shaping the future of data-driven decision-making!

Title: TikTok LIVE Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities
The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touch-points to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages (Python is highly preferred)

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.â€‹


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect â€“ and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.â€‹
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.â€‹
â€‹
Diversity & Inclusionâ€‹
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.â€‹

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in transforming data into actionable insights to support strategic decision-making and drive operational excellence. Your responsibilities will include:




Collecting, analysing, and interpreting core Service KPI data to enhance current reporting and develop actionable recommendations.
Conducting detailed analysis of product repairs and failures to determine root causes, failure mechanisms, time to failure, components at fault, and financial impact.
Performing total product profitability and service cost analysis to support commercial and sales strategies.
Preparing monthly financial and volume-based management reports for the Board and Head Office.
Analyse spare parts usage and trends highlighting any anomalies back to the business
Delivering monthly reporting on service and sales KPIs, while designing innovative dashboards and reports to identify key issues and improvement opportunities.
Investigating failure trends and contributing to robust quality claims when failure thresholds are exceeded.
Leading initiatives to streamline reporting and implement smarter, more efficient data solutions.
Other ad hoc tasks per requirement.




Key Skills:

Expert proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including VLOOKUP, INDEX/MATCH, pivot tables, and other advanced functions.
Experience with macro recording and VBA scripting is a strong advantage.
Proficient in Microsoft Office tools such as PowerPoint, Access, Power Pivot, with desirable knowledge of SQL.
Strong analytical thinking with the ability to apply rational decision-making, problem-solving, and statistical techniques.
Meticulous attention to data quality and accuracy, ensuring high standards for reporting and analysis.
Ability to quickly comprehend and interpret complex datasets, drawing clear conclusions and actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present technical information clearly to non-technical stakeholders.




Benefits Include, But Are Not Limited To:

Competitive salary
Workplace pension
23 days of holiday plus Bank Holidays, with long service increment up to 25 days.
In-house learning platform, develop your skills for your career and your role.
Long service awards
Salary sacrifice schemes
Discounts on Hisense products
Access to a shopping discount portal
Restaurant and cafÃ© discounts at our Leeds office




About Hisense

Founded in 1969, Hisense is a global leader in technology for your home. We are passionate about making life enhancing technology accessible to the world through our innovations in televisions, laundry, refrigeration and other home appliances.




Hisense UK is part of Hisense Europe, to discover more, watch the Hisense Europe corporate video or visit our company website https://uk.hisense.com/




IMPORTANT NOTICE

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, and all qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.




As a courtesy, we strive to acknowledge all applications. However, due to the high volume of applications, we regret that we may not be able to respond to every applicant, we can only guarantee that shortlisted candidates will be contacted.




By submitting your application, you consent to the processing of your personal data by Hisense UK Limited for recruitment purposes in accordance with GDPR. Your personal data may also be shared with affiliated companies within the Hisense Europe group to facilitate the recruitment process. You can withdraw your consent at any time by contacting us at huk.hr@hisense.com

Title: Aerodynamic Data Analyst
Description:
Williams Racing is looking for a highly analytical and innovative engineer to enhance the correlation between Wind Tunnel, CFD, and track performance. This role is crucial in ensuring our simulation and part selection methodologies translate seamlessly to real-world track conditions.

Working in the Aerodynamic Correlation and Methods group, you will collaborate across multiple departments, including Trackside Aero, Vehicle Performance, CFD, Wind Tunnel, and Aero Development, using cutting-edge tools and techniques to push performance boundaries.

What Youâ€™ll Be Doing


Optimising Wind Tunnel to Track Correlation â€“ Analysing and refining simulation environments for improved accuracy.
Defining & Analysing DIL Experiments â€“ Understanding aero performance sensitivities and their impact on lap time.
Improving CFD Simulations â€“ Identifying deficiencies and working closely with the CFD team to enhance accuracy.
Leading R&D Projects â€“ Driving new instrumentation capabilities and data analysis improvements.
Enhancing Data Toolsets â€“ Collaborating with software engineers to develop cutting-edge performance analysis tools.
Cross-Department Collaboration â€“ Contributing to whole car simulation correlation to unlock new performance gains.


Who Weâ€™re Looking For


A strong communicator and collaborator with the ability to work seamlessly across technical groups.
A passionate problem-solver with a solid understanding of dynamic systems and optimisation.
Experience in performance and correlation data analysis, with a background in vehicle dynamics being a plus.
Knowledge of aerodynamics and aerodynamic data interpretation is highly beneficial.
Proficiency in scientific coding languages and the ability to develop data analysis tools.
Ability to present complex analysis in a clear, data-driven and insightful way.
Degree in Aerodynamics, Aeronautical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Data Science (or equivalent).


Why Join Williams Racing?


Work at the cutting edge of aero performance innovation
Collaborate with AI/ML engineers to revolutionize data-driven decision-making
Be part of a high-performance, fast-paced F1 environment
Work on groundbreaking projects that directly impact race performance


Company Description

For almost 50 years, Williams Racing has been at the forefront of one of the fastest sports on the planet, being one of the top three most successful teams in history competing in the FIA Formula 1 World Championship. With an almost unrivalled heritage of engineering and racing F1 cars and unforgettable eras that demonstrate it is a force to be reckoned with, the British squad boasts 16 F1 World Championship titles to its name.

Since its foundation in 1977 by the eminent, late Sir Frank Williams and engineering pioneer Sir Patrick Head, the team has won nine Constructorsâ€™ Championships, in association with Cosworth, Honda and Renault. Its roll call of drivers is legendary, with its seven Driversâ€™ Championship trophies being lifted by true icons of the sport: Alan Jones, Keke Rosberg, Nelson Piquet, Nigel Mansell, Alain Prost, Damon Hill and Jacques Villeneuve. The team has made history before and is out to make it again with a long-term mission to evolve and return to the front of the grid.

Additional Information

Atlassian Williams Racing is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We are happy to discuss reasonable job adjustments.

HTML:
Williams Racing is looking for a highly analytical and innovative engineer to enhance the correlation between Wind Tunnel, CFD, and track performance. This role is crucial in ensuring our simulation and part selection methodologies translate seamlessly to real-world track conditions.

Working in the Aerodynamic Correlation and Methods group, you will collaborate across multiple departments, including Trackside Aero, Vehicle Performance, CFD, Wind Tunnel, and Aero Development, using cutting-edge tools and techniques to push performance boundaries.

What Youâ€™ll Be Doing

  • Optimising Wind Tunnel to Track Correlation â€“ Analysing and refining simulation environments for improved accuracy.
  • Defining & Analysing DIL Experiments â€“ Understanding aero performance sensitivities and their impact on lap time.
  • Improving CFD Simulations â€“ Identifying deficiencies and working closely with the CFD team to enhance accuracy.
  • Leading R&D Projects â€“ Driving new instrumentation capabilities and data analysis improvements.
  • Enhancing Data Toolsets â€“ Collaborating with software engineers to develop cutting-edge performance analysis tools.
  • Cross-Department Collaboration â€“ Contributing to whole car simulation correlation to unlock new performance gains.

Who Weâ€™re Looking For

  • A strong communicator and collaborator with the ability to work seamlessly across technical groups.
  • A passionate problem-solver with a solid understanding of dynamic systems and optimisation.
  • Experience in performance and correlation data analysis, with a background in vehicle dynamics being a plus.
  • Knowledge of aerodynamics and aerodynamic data interpretation is highly beneficial.
  • Proficiency in scientific coding languages and the ability to develop data analysis tools.
  • Ability to present complex analysis in a clear, data-driven and insightful way.
  • Degree in Aerodynamics, Aeronautical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Data Science (or equivalent).

Why Join Williams Racing?

  • Work at the cutting edge of aero performance innovation
  • Collaborate with AI/ML engineers to revolutionize data-driven decision-making
  • Be part of a high-performance, fast-paced F1 environment
  • Work on groundbreaking projects that directly impact race performance

Company Description

For almost 50 years, Williams Racing has been at the forefront of one of the fastest sports on the planet, being one of the top three most successful teams in history competing in the FIA Formula 1 World Championship. With an almost unrivalled heritage of engineering and racing F1 cars and unforgettable eras that demonstrate it is a force to be reckoned with, the British squad boasts 16 F1 World Championship titles to its name.

Since its foundation in 1977 by the eminent, late Sir Frank Williams and engineering pioneer Sir Patrick Head, the team has won nine Constructorsâ€™ Championships, in association with Cosworth, Honda and Renault. Its roll call of drivers is legendary, with its seven Driversâ€™ Championship trophies being lifted by true icons of the sport: Alan Jones, Keke Rosberg, Nelson Piquet, Nigel Mansell, Alain Prost, Damon Hill and Jacques Villeneuve. The team has made history before and is out to make it again with a long-term mission to evolve and return to the front of the grid.

Title: Summer Data Internship
Description:
Are you interested in a career that changes the world? If so, global change communications might be for you. Weâ€™re on the lookout for candidates who are interested in the world around them and are passionate about tackling global issues.Â At M+C Saatchi World Services we are focused on tackling some of humanityâ€™s most challenging and important problems, in fragile states and developing countries, harnessing the power of cutting-edge communications and creativity to achieve long-term behaviour change.


The World Services Internship Programme is a paid 6-week scheme open to anyone looking to start a career in communications, with a focus on global change. It's a data boot camp designed for individuals passionate about the world of data science, data-driven insights and data analysis. Ideal for students or recent graduates, this programme offers the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic and forward-thinking environment.

The internship will commence 21 July 2025 and run until 28 August 2025 based in our offices in Soho at regular business hours (9:30am â€“ 6:00pm). Interns will be expected to come into the office at least three times per week at the discretion of their programme leads.

M+C Saatchi World Services will consider scheme graduates for potential employment opportunities. While a job is not guaranteed, the purpose of this program is to invest in potential future talent.

ABOUT THE ROLE

This role offers a unique opportunity to combine collaboration and learning.Â 

You'll work closely with a senior data scientist, gaining mentorship, guidance, and feedback on your data analysis projects.Â 
By actively participating in team meetings and project discussions, you'll contribute fresh perspectives and innovative ideas.Â 
To further develop your technical skillset, you'll undergo comprehensive training in data analysis tools and techniques, including SQL, and dashboarding.Â 
Finally, you'll master the art of data storytelling, preparing and presenting project reports that effectively communicate findings, methodologies, and results to both technical and non-technical audiences, ultimately impacting company decision-making.
You will be paid London Living Wage.

ABOUT YOU

We are looking for candidates who have:

Curious minds: We want someone who is naturally curious and fascinated by the world and why it is the way it is, particularly from a geo-political perspective. Someone who stops scrolling to read about whatâ€™s going on around the world and invests themselves in social issues. Someone who has a belief in the idea that communications, when applied properly, can lead to a better world.
A knack for collaborating: We work jointly with partners and agencies as well as other M&C Saatchi companies to provide support from strategy to implementation for many of our campaigns. We need a natural collaborator. Someone who empowers those around them and is open, willing and able to engage new people inside and outside of our organisation.
A desire for a meaningful career: What gets you out of bed in the morning? Those who are driven by a greater purpose and search for a â€˜whyâ€™ in what they do will often find commercial careers unfulfilling. We are searching for the people who want their career to mean something.
Technical experience and programmatic ability: Candidates are expected to have the requisite skills to work within a data team. Knowledge of Python is essential, SQL desirable, and wider technical skills are welcomed. Familiarity with version control systems, especially Git, is strongly desirable. Candidates should be comfortable processing, understanding, and drawing insights from large datasets.

As we value curiosity and collaboration, we are looking for individuals who are naturally fascinated by the world and why it is the way it is, particularly from a data-driven perspective. A belief in the power of data and communications to improve the world is a must.

APPLICATION CLOSING DATE: Monday 05 May, 2025*


Successful candidates will be invited for a short videoÂ interview in mid-May 2025, or sooner, depending on application volume.

Please note: Internships are offered subject to the provision of a successful background check, and proof of right to work in the United Kingdom.

*We reserve the right to close the application window earlier than stated if necessary.

ABOUT M+C SAATCHI GROUP

M+C Saatchi Group has pledged its commitment to create a company that values difference, with an inclusive culture. As part of this M+C Saatchi Group continues to be an Equal Opportunity Employer which does not and shall not discriminate, celebrates diversity and bases all hiring and promotion decisions solely on merit, without regard for any personal characteristics.

If you require any reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment and selection process, please make us aware as part of your application.

All employee information is kept confidential according to General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
